loans.name: Mey

texts.en:
Mrs. Mey P., 25, is married with one child and stays at home cooking food for her family. Her husband is the one who handles all his family’s expense by earning on average about $9/day in income working as a blacksmith. He is very talented and has experience with this job since 1998.

Mrs. Mey P. has applied for a loan to purchase more blacksmith’s tools and various kinds of spare parts to facilitate her husband’s work.

loans.use: To purchase more blacksmith’s tools and various kinds of spare parts to facilitate her husband’s work

loans.name: Bwase East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rose K.. She is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to add to her business. Rose is 30 years old and is married. Her husband sells chicken feed for work. She has 1 child aged 10 who goes to school. Each week, Rose makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to put up better poultry houses. Rose has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX in order to buy chicken business and the loan was paid back on time.

Rose is joined in her small group by Suzan N. and Madina K.. Suzan N. has a business in grocery and wants to increase stock. Madina K. is currently operating a business in sugarcane growing and wants a loan to expand business.

loans.use: To boost poultry business and make more profits

loans.name: Rosalina Elvira

texts.es:
Señora Rosalina belongs to the Women of Progress Communal Bank. She is dedicated to the sale of food in the market of Yungay in the district and province of Yungay, department of Ancash.

With the loan of 3000 soles, which will be repaid in 8 months, she will buy a stove, a canister of gas, a table, 2 bags of rice, 2 boxes of oil and 5 bags of sugar.

She is 47 years old of age, a widow with 2 children. Her husband passed away a year ago. She works alone to educate her children who are in secondary school.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosalina, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso, se dedica a la venta de Alimentos en el mercado de Yungay en el distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 el cual será cancelado en 8 cuotas, comprará, una cocina, un balón de gas, una mesa, 2 sacos de arroz, 2 cajas de aceite, 5 sacos de azúcar.

Ella tiene 47 años de edad, es viuda tiene 2 hijos, su esposo falleció hace un año, Ella sola trabaja para educar a sus hijos que están en educación superior.

loans.use: To buy a stove, a canister of gas, a table, rice, oil and sugar for her business selling food.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva belongs to the El Banco Comunal La Familia, located in the Jr Huancavelica 154, of the District of Calleria of the Department of Ucayali. She is 45 years old is a mother of 4 children, she is a widow, and her income does not support her daily life. Elva decided to invest the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for $300 to buy and sell fish.

Elva has a three-wheeled delivery vehicle and continues to sell fish, working for an company of the state and with the help of her children she moves forward with her business. She is very proud of her children as they are her biggest source of support.

With this loan of S/ 1.700 which will be paid in 4 months, she will buy different species of fish. She will also put money toward the maintenance of her three-wheeled delivery vehicle and other parts she needs for her business.

Necy is a woman that was widowed at a very young age and had to move forward alone with her children. She3 is very proud of her children who are now professionals and who help her. She is very happy with Manuela Ramos, who supported her when she needed it.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sedloff, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elva pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en el Jr Huancavelica 154, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 45 años es madre D. 4 hijos, es viuda, y el ingreso que tenia no le alcanzaba para su economía diaria, es así que Elva con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la compra y venta D. pescados.

En la actualidad tiene un motocarro y sigue con su venta D. pescado, trabaja en una entidad del estado y con la ayuda D. sus hijos salen adelante en su negocio y esta muy orgullosa D. ellos por que son su mas granD. apoyo .

Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,700 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará diferentes especies D. pescados, también le dará mantenimiento para su motocarro y algunas piezas que necesitaba.

Necy es una mujer que quedo viuda muy joven, y tuvo que sacar adelante a sus hijos sola pero esta muy orgullosa D. ello por que ya son profesionales y la apoyan. Esta muy contenta con Manuela Ramos porque la apoyo cuando más lo necesitaba.

loans.use: With the loand she will purchase different essential products for her current business

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị Hường, 54 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2007. Chồng mất, một mình chị nuôi 2 con ăn học, đến nay một cháu đã học xong phổ thông và có việc làm. Công việc chính của chị hiện nay là bán hàng hoa quả và tạp hóa. Với thái độ phục vụ niềm nở, ân cần, giá cả lại hợp lý nên khách hàng đến mua hàng của chị luôn cảm thấy thoải mái, yên tâm. Gian hàng của chị Hường tuy nhỏ nhưng mặt hàng nào cũng có. Thu nhập mỗi ngày của chị Hường khoảng 5-6USD. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị xin vay 575USD để mua thêm hàng.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Ms. H. Thi Pham, 54 years old, joined the fund in 2007. Widowed, she raises her two children by herself, one of which is now finished with school and has found work. Her main job is currently running a stall selling fruits and other goods. With her warm and friendly attitude and reasonable prices, her customers always feel comfortable shopping there. Even though her stall is small, it has almost all variety of goods. The daily revenue of Ms. Pham's business is about 5-6 USD. In this round of funding she is asking for $575 to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: Buy goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon R. is 26 years old, married and has one child. He works as a mechanic in a small garage not far from his house. About 80 percent of the people of Cambodia drive or travel in second-hand vehicles, most of which have to be repaired before they can be used. That is why car mechanics are thought to have good jobs. Thon's wife stays at home to look after their child and cook food for the whole family. She also has a job renting out a pool table to villagers, earning a small commission from each rental.

Thon has applied for a loan from Kiva to buy painting tools and a small motor to help him do his work.

loans.use: To buy  painting tools and a small motor.

loans.name: Eva António  José

texts.pt:
Eva António José N. is 27 years old, from Boane and a single mother to a six year old girl who is in the first grade. As well as her daughter she supports her mother by sending her money at the end of each month.

Eva is in the 11th grade at the Joaquim Chissano high school in Boane. She has always lived in the same house and in the same area. She lives in her parents' house.

Eva has been a trader for 6 years. She opens her establishment every day from 8am to 8pm and has one employee. Every products she has brings in some income as each customer chooses the right product for their hair. Income varies, but is around a minimum of 500,00 MZN which increases on the weekends. Monthly she saves 1000,00 MZN. At the moment she intends to increase her product range in order to increase revenue.

This is her third loan. Her first was for 6000,00 MZN, which she used to buy merchandise and the second was for 9000,00 MZN, which she also used to buy beauty products. The loan she is now asking for, of 15000,00 MZN, will also go towards buying beauty products.

It is Eva's dream to see her beauty salon be of a high standard with the capacity to attend to 15 customers at the same time.

Translated from Portuguese by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

Eva António José N. tem 27 anos de idade e natural de Boane, solteira e mãe de uma filha de 6 anos que estuda na primeira classe. Para além da sua filha sustenta a sua mãe enviando dinheiro cada fim do mês. Eva estuda na 11ªclasse na escola secundária Joaquim Chissano de Boane. Ela nunca mudou de local de resídência sempre viveu na mesma zona. Vive na casa dos pais. Eva é comerciante a 6 anos, onde abre o seu estabelecimento das 8h as 20h todos os dias e tem uma empregada. Para ela todos os produtos que tem lhe proporciona qualquer coisa dado que cada um escolhe o produto para o seu cabelo. Os rendimentos varia entre 500,00mt minímo e aumenta nos fins de semana. Mensalmente poupa 1000,00mt. Assim neste momento pretende aumentar os produtos de forma aumentar as receitas. Este é o terceiro empréstimo, onde o primeiro foi de 6000,00mt que usou para compra de mercadoria e o segundo foi de 9000,00mt também usou para compra de produtos de beleza. Assim este que pretende é de 15000,00mt também vai aplicar na compra de produtos. Constitui grande sonho para Eva ver o seu Salão numa classe bem alta com capacidade de atender no total de 15 clientes ao mesmo tempo.

loans.use: To increase stocks for her salon

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel M. is a taxi driver who uses his own car. At the moment the car is giving him problems and he needs financial assistance to buy spare parts for the repair of his car. He is married, but his wife's income as a merchant is not sufficient for Samuel and their 5 children. Demand for his services is high, but he needs to repair his car to be able to work.

He is asking for additional capital to carry on his business.

loans.use: repairing his car for use as a taxi

loans.name: Warmin Sartawipa Group

texts.es:
La fabricación y venta de ladrillos es la actividad principal de la asociación Warmin Sartawipa, traducido al español quiere decir Los pasos de la Mujer, grupo formado por once mujeres, trabajan junto a Pro-Mujer hace 10 años en el centro focal de Villa Tejada.
Casi todas casadas junto con sus esposos trabajan para salir adelante por el bien de sus hijos,  Luego de la fabricar los ladrillos los venden a pedido en las distintas zonas de la ciudad de El Alto. En ocasiones realizan sus ventas a crédito por lo que necesitan capital para comprar materia prima que les perM. entregar pedidos a los clientes. Solo trabajan con el objetivo de mejorar económicamente para brindar bienestar a sus familias
texts.en:
The production and sales of bricks is the main activity of the group Warmin Sartawipa, which when translated to Spanish means "Los Pasos de la Mujer." The group is formed by eleven women who have worked in the center of Villa Tejada with Pro-Mujer for ten years. Almost all the women are married and with their husbands they work to make progress for the good of their children. After making the bricks, they sell them by taking orders from various regions of the city of El Alto. On occasion they make sales based on credit, which is why they need capital to buy raw materials so they can fill the orders of their clients. They only work with the objective of improving economically to offer well-being to their families.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Sauma

texts.en:
Sauma has had a business baking and selling bread in Zanzibar since 1995. She is 49 years old, married, and has four children. Her children range in age from 15 to 30 years.  

Sauma works every day from 7:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. and earns a monthly profit of approximately $75. She is hoping that this loan will allow her to buy more ingredients so that she can produce and sell more bread.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her bread business.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Née le 10 juillet 1981 à Lomé, Mlle A. Afi est couturière de formation. Très tôt, ayant compris que les revenus de son activité arrivaient à peine à subvenir à ses besoins, elle décida de joindre à ça le commerce de sac de friperie qui depuis un certain temps est sollicité dans sa zone dû à leur qualité. Limitée par ses moyens, elle sollicite un appui financier afin d’augmenter sa capacité d’approvisionnement et de fourniture dans sa zone.
Tout ceci augmentera ses revenus et lui permettra d’améliorer sa condition de vie voire même d’ouvrir un atelier de couture et une boutique.
texts.en:
Born on July 10, 1981 in Lomé, Miss Afi A. trained as a dressmaker. Very early on, having found that the income from her business barely covered her needs, she decided to add the sale of used clothing which is much in demand where she lives, due to its high quality. Limited by her means, she is requesting financial aid so that she can expand her capacity for her businesses in her area.

This will raise her income and allow her to improve her standard of living, and perhaps even to open a sewing workshop and a shop.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing and selling used clothing

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: I. Dilorom lives in Khujand. She is married and has three children. Mrs. I. trades in the city’s local bazaar.  She purchases the goods from Istravshan and the Kyrgyz Republic two to three times a month.  Because she travels to buy her own supplies, she is able to sell them at a low price to make a high profit.  Over the past 4 years, she has developed loyal customers.  She will use her loan to buy and import more clothes to sell.

loans.use: Buy and import clothes

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita D. sells vegetables and other dry goods in Agusan Del Sur. She is a widow and operates her store, alone, to earn the income she needs for the food that she eats. Because all of her four children were already married, she often times feels old and alone. She wants to help her children raise their kids by helping to support the children financial needs.  By operating a small store and joining the CEVI credit program, she believes she could help build a better future for her family.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables and goods to sell. She is also considering expanding her business and converting it into a mini-grocery store. In this way she could sell more goods and earn a bigger income. 

Because she is an active member of CEVI credit program, she receives credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage which CEVI offers to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables and other dry goods.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en: Timothy Ogeniyi sells clothes and shoes. His shop is open daily from 7AM-6:30PM. He hopes to expand his business and is requesting a loan amount of $675 (N100,000) to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell. He says thank you to all that make this loan possible. He is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Ngoc Thi's Group

texts.vi:
P. Thị Ngọc sinh năm 1953 ( Mã số: 010117140030 ) . Chồng chị đã chết, chị hiện đang sống cùng con gái đã đi làm nên có thu nhập hỗ trợ chị. Hàng ngày, chị đi bán rau ở chợ đồng thời tăng gia sản xuất. Thu nhập bình quân của mẹ con chị khoảng 250.000 vnđ/tuần. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 5014000 vnđ để mua giống cây trồng và đi chợ. chị là nhóm trưởng nhóm vay vốn gồm có:
 Phạm thị Tuyết L. sinh năm 1973, ( Mã số: 010117140029 )  Chị bán hàng thực phẩm( gà, vịt quay chin,,,)gia đình chị có thu nhập ổn định trung bình khoảng:350.000 vnđ/tuần. Chị vay mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng.
 Cao Thị Thuần sinh năm 1971, ( Mã số: 010117140031 )  chồng chị làm nghề thợ mộc, bản thân chị bán trứng vịt có thu nhập theo ngày. Thu nhập binh quân của gia đình chị khoảng:300.000 vnđ/ tuần.Chị vay vốn mức vay: 4.578.000 vnđ để có vốn mua trứng về bán.
Nguyễn Thị Hồng sinh năm 1951, ( Mã số: 010117140032 )  gia đình chị có vườn cây ăn quả(cam, quýt, táo,..). Chồng chị có lương ổn định theo tháng( lương hưu), Chị vay vốn mức: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư vườn cây ăn quả và đi chợ.
 Nguyễn Bích Phương sinh năm 1974, ( Mã số: 010117140033)  chị bán hàng quần áo ở chợ, chồng chị làm công nhân, có thu  nhập ổn định theo tháng, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ/tháng. Chị vay mức vốn: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư mở rộng hàng quần áo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ngoc T. P. was born in 1953. Her husband has passed, and she is currently living with her adult daughter. Her daughter is already working so she has some income to support her mother. Everyday, Mrs. P. sells vegetables at the market while working other jobs on the side. The family's average income is around 250,000 VND per week. She joined the Fund with a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy seedlings to plant and to trade goods. She is the group leader for this group loan, which also includes: - Mrs. T. T. Pham, born in 1973. She sells various foods (chicken, roast duck, etc.). Her family has a stable income at around 350,000 VND per week. She is borrowing 4,142,000 VND to invest in her store. - Mrs. T. T. Cao, born in 1971. Her husband works as a woodcarver, while she sells duck eggs with a variable daily income. The family's average income is 300,000 VND per week. She is borrowing 4,578,000 VND to buy eggs to sell. - Mrs. H. T. Nguyen was born in 1951. Her family has a fruit orchard (oranges, tangerines, apples, etc.). Her husband has a stable income from his pension. She is borrowing 4,142,000 VND to invest in the orchard and to trade goods. - Mrs. P. B. Nguyen was born in 1974. She sells clothes at the market, and her husband is laborer with a stable monthly income. The family's average income is around 3,000,000 VND per month. She is borrowing 4,142,000 VND to invest in expanding her clothing sales.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales at the market, fruit orchard

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en: Altantsetseg D. is 41 years old, married, and has two sons. She runs a sewing business out of a 10 square meter rental room. In 2007, she started her business by buying a sewing machine and fabric that cost MNT 40,000 ($1.00 USD=1,600.00 MNT). Her business has been successful ever since and allowed her to purchase three more sewing machines and hire two tailors. Her working capital has grown from 40,000 MNT to 1.5 million MNT. Her daily income now is around 1.0 million MNT. She gets many orders due to the lack of competing businesses in her area. With her profits, her husband built a 40 sq. meter house on the plot of land that they own. Before her business flourished, she lived in a "ger" (traditional, nomadic form of tent housing) in the local ger district. One of her sons goes to elementary school, the other one is a university student. Her husband operates a taxi business that brings in MNT 250,000-300,000 every month. Altantsetseg requests a loan to purchase more silk for her business since spring is coming and college graduation approaches. At graduation, students wear traditional clothing made with silk. Altantsetseg dreams of hiring two more tailors and expanding her workplace further.

loans.use: to buy silk

loans.name: Rat

texts.en:
R., 65, is a mother of two children; one is married and lives separately and one is single and helps the family work. She is married to Keo, 66, who works as a local farmer on the land behind his house. 

R. is a local farmer who plants rice and vegetables on the land that she derived from her parents. Besides paying the family's expenses she also has to hire the neighbor's buffalo for her farming. R. is asking for a loan of $1200 to buy a pair of buffalo for her farming and to renovate her house. She wants to buy a pumping machine.

loans.use: To buy a pair of buffalo for her farming and to renovate her house.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
L. Nguyen, 38, lives in the town of Hưng yên. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, L. owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising chickens for sale. L. has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund, used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. L. is requesting a loan of 9000000 VND to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. The loan will be the second taken out by L. from TYM Fund. L. plans to use the revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Purchase livestock.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married. She and her husband, Ivan, live in Khoost. Mariya earns her living by working as a market entrepreneur in the central market of her home town. She sells household goods. Mariya has been in the market for 10 years. She has her own clientele who always come to buy certain products from her. Her net profit is about 3,000 Hryvnia. 

Mariya’s business can be characterized as stable and consistently growing. She is always very friendly with her customers. Mariya enjoys her work, and it shows through in her attitude and business approach. This time she is requesting a loan of 7,000 Hryvnia to increase assorted merchandise and increase her sales as a result.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Publio

texts.es: Publio tiene 32 años, es una persona muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada donde ha puesto su negocio. En una de las calles más céntricas de la ciudad de Juliaca está ubicada su sastrería, la cual puso en marcha con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, él es un sastre muy hábil, por lo cual siempre tiene clientes a quienes confeccionarles un buen terno. Lo que más le gusta a Publio es observar el término de su labor y ver cómo, con mucho empeño, puede crear una pieza de vestir de muy buena calidad. Lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cortar la tela sin equivocarse, ya que cualquiera fallo de su pulso podría malograr toda una jornada de trabajo y costarle mucho dinero. Para más adelante, quiere tener una sastrería más grande donde pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este es el segundo préstamo de Publio con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesto a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará una máquina remalladora para mejorar el trabajo que realiza.
texts.en:
Publio is 32 years old, is a very happy, hard working person, and lives in a rented house where he has set up his business. His tailor's shop, which he started with much effort and dedication, is located on one of the most centrally situated streets of the city of Juliaca. He is a very skilled tailor, so that he always has clients for whom he makes good suits. What Publio likes most is to observe the results of his labor and see how, with much determination, he can create a piece of clothing of very good quality. He has been working in this field for eight years and believes that the most difficult is to cut the cloth without making a mistake since any error of his steady hand could spoil a whole day's work and cost him a lot of money. To move ahead he wants to have a larger tailor's shop where he can provide better service to his clients. This is the second loan Publio has with MFP. He knows that he has to pay all the installments on time and is ready to do so. In his community bank he is a very responsible member. With the 1500 soles requested he will buy a mending (sewing) machine to improve the work that he performs.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Sagheer Choudhary Iqbal Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

Huzaira Bano baji wants a loan to buy juicer machine for her drinks corner.

Samra baji wants a loan to buy cloth for her cloth-selling business.

Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy costume jewelry to sell.

My name is Sagheer and I have been living in a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. My husband's name is C. I. and he runs a scrap business in the community. I operate my clothes-sewing business to share the financial burden with my husband. I am applying for a loan to buy scrap to grow my husband’s scrap business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas.
Margarita es casada, tiene 63 años y 6 hijos, Margarita venD. plantas ornamentales en las diferentes ferias dominicales D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho, Margarita tiene un vivero en Canaan actividad que realiza con L. ayuda D. sus hijos.
Margarita necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. bolsas, semilL..
Los sueños D. Margarita son construir un local para tienda, y que sus últimos hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Las Entusiastas (The Enthusiasts) Communal Bank. Margarita is 63 years of age, married and has six children. She sells ornamental plants in the various Sunday markets in the city of Ayacucho, and she has a greenhouse in Canaan which she built with the help of her children. Margarita needs a loan of 1,000 Sols which will be invested in the purchase of containers and seeds. Her dreams are to build a location for a store and that her last children will become working professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy containers and seeds.

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
K. Rahima lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan with two children. She has been selling women's clothing in one of the local markets for 5 years. Due to her highly motivated entrepreneurial spirit and meticulous survey of the market, Rahima has found her niche and customer base. Her unique ability to market her inventory and meet her customers' needs is contributing to the rapid growth of her business. However Rahima believes her venture has only started to grow and there is still great potential for further expansion. She would love to open more vending facilities. Her strategy is to increase her stock and generate additional profits which will then be reinvested in her trade. That is why Rahima is asking for a loan of $500 US to purchase new inventory and help develop and upgrade her small business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new women's clothing to diversify inventory

loans.name: Gladis Johana

texts.es:
Johana  forma parte del banco comunal Señora de la Luz desde hace 4 ciclos, es una madre soltera de una niña de 7 años, de ocupación maestra ella estudia educación Parvularia  en la universidad Eloy Alfaro de Manta y trabaja con niños en un jardín con alumnos de Pre-kínder.

Ella tiene 28 años de edad y trabajando de profesora hace 4 años, dos de ellos en su actual trabajo, en estos momentos tiene una pareja desde hace un año y medio él es Richard, y es su apoyo en todo.
Johana comparte el tiempo entre el estudio y su trabajo, se dedica a la venta de joyas y ropa, vende a crédito tiene pocos pero responsables  clientes, entre ellos están sus compañeras de trabajo y las compañeras de la universidad, empezó en el mundo de las ventas gracias a una buena amiga quien fue la que la impulso a trabajar.

En la mañana Johana sale al trabajo deja a su niña en la escuela y en la tarde regresa a casa para cumplir con su hija luego sale a la universidad ella cuenta con el apoyo de la mamá ya que es ella la que le ayuda a cuidar a su niña, Johana esta a punto de terminar su carrera solo le queda un año de estudio para graduarse de licenciada en Educación Parvularia.

Con el préstamo que ella esta solicitando a la fundación piensa invertir en comprar más joyas como cadenas, anillos, aretes, y también invertirá en compra de prendas de vestir como pantalones, camisas, blusas y más.

Johana al igual que muchas personas también tiene su sueño, ella espera poder hacer realidad tener su propio Jardín de Infantes.
texts.en:
Johana has been part of the community bank Senora de la Luz for the past 4 cycles. She is a single mother with a 7 year-old daughter. She is a teacher by profession, and studies nursery school education at Eloy Alfara de Manta University in addition to teaching gardening to preschool children. She is 28 years-old and has worked as a teacher for the past 4 years, 2 of which she spent in her current job. For the past year and a half she has been with a man named Richard, and she is his support in everything. Johana splits her time between her studies and her work. She sells jewelry and clothing, which she will allow some responsible clients to purchase on credit. Some of these include friends from work or university. She began in the world of sales thanks to a good friend who motivated her to work. In the morning Johana goes to work and leaves her daughter at school, and in the evening she comes back home to take care of her child before going to her classes. She counts on the help of her mother to look after her child. Johana only has a year left before she finishes her studies and graduates with a decree in kindergarten education. She plans to invest the loan that she is seeking in the purchase of more jewelry like chains, rings, and earrings, and also will invest in the purchase of clothing items such as pants, shirts, blouses, etc. Johana, like many people, also has a dream, which is to one day be able to have her own kindergarten.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es: Cirilo tiene 38 años y viene luchando por tener una vida mejor. Actualmente vive solo, pues es soltero. Su dedicación principal son los cultivos de café, plátanos y frutos cítricos (naranjas y mandarinas), con los cuales se siente muy feliz. Nos comenta que la siembra de café es dificultosa porque el abonado debe ser constante y eso requiere de mucha inversión, además que se cosecha cada año. Pero en el caso de los plátanos, aunque también necesitan de abono, su cosecha es semanal o cada quincena, donde los compradores van hasta su chacra y le compran por racimos dependiendo del tamaño de los plátanos. Con respecto a las naranjas, las vende por ciento. Cirilo prefiere vender sus frutos desde su chacra, en vez de transportarlos y comercializarlos él mismo, pues aun así logra buenas ganancias. A él lo acaban de invitar a integrarse a un banco comunal, por lo que se siente muy agradecido. Asimismo, hace compromisos de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente. El dinero del crédito que viene solicitando lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos cafetaleros.
texts.en:
Cirilo is 38 years old and fighting for a better life. He currently lives alone, as he is single. His main activity is growing coffee, bananas, and citrus fruits (oranges and tangerines), and this makes him happy. He told us that planting coffee is difficult because it requires fertilizer constantly, which requires a lot of investment considering it is only harvested once a year. Although the bananas also require fertilizer, they can be harvested every 1 to 2 weeks. Buyers come to Cirilo's farm to buy the bananas by the bunch, depending on the size of the fruit. He sells the oranges by the hundred. Cirilo prefers selling the fruit at his farm, instead of transporting and selling it in a market, because he makes better profit that way. He has recently been invited to join a community bank, and feels very grateful. That is why he has committed to making all his repayments on time. He plans to use the loan money he is requesting to invest in chemical fertilizers for his coffee crop.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer.

loans.name: Rabab

texts.en: Rabab is a young married woman who lives with her husband and five children in the city of Nablus in Palestine. She sells women clothes. Rabab wants her children to get a good education to have a better chance to succeed in the future. This is what makes her sacrifice worthwhile. She needs a loan of $1200 to buy more and different types of clothes to expand her business.She is grateful for your kindness. Support her!

loans.use: Buy clothes and expand her business

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Managing a tricycle transport business and hog raising business is the one that Catherine R. chooses to engaged with. Their daily income from their tricycle transport was being divided for their daily family needs, allowances of their children in school and feeds supply that her raised pig needed to grow. In this regard, she wanted to ask for financial assistance from the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP4, 000 as additional business capital to further maintain her livestock and motorcycle transport business. 

She is living with her family in the village of Old Centro 1 San Mateo, Isabela. Catherine is already 27 years old and is being married to Rey R. who is a farmer. Her family has harmonious a relationship that Catherine use to make her happy. She hopes to give her family with a better living someday through their simple livelihood in their village.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years of age and she is married to Jovencio S., they are blessed with three children, they are Josielyn- 30 years of age, followed by her sister Flordeliza- 23 years of age, and their youngest is Fely Jean- 19 years of age, they are all married. They are peacefully living together at San Francisco, Alicia Isabela, a rural area. Their house is located near their barangay basketball court.
She manages a retail store in their village for almost ten years, her weekly net income is PHP 500.00,she plans to avail a loan amount of PHP 3,000.00 to purchase some grocery items to sell in her retail store,being a grandmother to her grandchildren is very hard for her, because she's the one who always supports their daily needs, she hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her the loan as much as possible.

loans.use: Additional Capital to purchase grocery items for her store

loans.name: Jantsan

texts.en: Jantsan T. is 36 years old and lives with her 23-year-old daughter in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. She and her daughter live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. T. operates a meat trading business in her town. She sells a variety of meats to her customers from a stall in the local market. T. started her business in 2000 after retiring from her career at a construction company. Her business currently operates at a stable level and she continues to make progress. She hopes to increase her business in the future and her continued success is very important as she must support her daughter, who is disabled. T. is requesting a 485,000 tugrug (~340 USD) loan to purchase more meat in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase more meat in order to increase her sales

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan S. is from the village of Talakag , Bukidnon. She is 53 years old, married, and has 8 adult-aged children. To make a living, Susan owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling hogs to butcher for a meat vending business in the local community. Susan has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Susan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Susan is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Susan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean A. is from the village of San Rogue, Maramag, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old. Jean is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jean owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling poultry products in the local community. Jean has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. The previous loan was very helpful for her family's daily needs. Jean is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to continue her business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jean from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and slowly pay off her credits. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is 28 years old and is married with four children aged between 1 and 7 years. She and her family live in Musanze, which is approximately two hours drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Helena has been a proven entrepreneur, selling travel items for the past ten years. She employs three people in her business who work from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day except Sunday.

Helena is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more travel bags and accessories for the purpose of expanding her business. With this expansion, she hopes to meet the growing demand for travel bags and to attract more customers to her shop. If this strategy is successful, she will earn more profit which she will reinvest in her business and be better able to provide for her family and loved ones.

loans.use: To purchase additional travel bags and accessories to sell

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina A. Cotzojay tiene 48 años y vive con su padre, su hermana y la hija de su hermana.  Ella es soltera, y tiene su casa propia.  Ella empezó hace 27 años a vender ropa.  Con su propio capital, podía comprar manteles para vender.  Ahora, que ha crecido mucho su negocio, vende mucha ropa diferente.  

Con este prestamo, ella va a invertir una parte en ropa tipica, y otra parte en fruta para vender.  Por la época navideña, ella tiene demanda para vender estes productios.  La ropa es muy buen producto y también ella vende muchas uvas en este época.

Josefina ha trabajado con FAPE por 2 años, recibiendo prestamos de bancos comunales.  Este prestamo es su primero de Kiva.  Quiere modificar su mercadería por la competencia que existe.  Entre sus sueños, es que tenga un capital fuerte para que pueda trabajar en el futuro sin préstamo, y que pueda retirarse sin la ayuda de otros.
texts.en:
Josefina is 48 years old and lives with her father, a sister, and a niece. She is single and has her own house. Some 27 years ago she began selling clothing. With her own capital, she bought table-cloths to sell. Now, since her business has grown considerably, she sells a lot of different clothes.

With this loan, she will invest a part in traditional (folk) clothing, and another part in fruit to sell. During the Christmas season, there will be great demand for these products. Clothing is a very good product and, also, she sells a lot of grapes at this time.

Josefina has worked with FRAPE for 2 years, receiving loans from communal banks. This loan is her first with Kiva. She wants to modify her merchandise due to competition. Among her dreams is to have a strong capital base so that she can work in the future without loans, and to be able to retire without the assistance of others.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY FOLK CLOTHING AND FRUIT TO SELL

loans.name: Jose Ernesto

texts.es:
El Señor José Ernesto L. Cáceres, Labora como Higienista ( limpieza) en el Mercado Roberto Huembes de Managua, el tiene a su cargo dos hijos, se encuentran en edad escolar, esta casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en ese lapso ha invertido  2 créditos en el mejoramiento de las condiciones de su vivienda otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es una excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales para la remodelación del techo de la vivienda y el pago de la mano obra, para darles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

José dijo que gracias a los prestamos otorgados por ceprodel ha podido mejorar su vivienda y darles mejores condiciones a sus hijos y esposa
texts.en:
Sr. José Ernesto L. Cáceres works as a janitor at the Roberto Huembes Market in Managua. He is married and has two dependent children in school. He has worked with CEPRODEL for two years and received two loans that were used for making home improvements.

The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase materials for refurbishing the roof of his house and pay for labor. He wishes to provide better living conditions for his children.

José says he is thankful for the loans CEPRODEL has provided so that he can improve his home and provide better conditions for his wife and children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for materials & labor

loans.name: Harde

texts.en: Harde D., 29 years-old, sells charcoal. He buys wood and coconut shells to make charcoal. He does this to have a regular income for his family. He has a two year old child and hopes to provide his child a brighter future.  He would like to ask for a loan of Php 8,000 from Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures Inc. The loan will go to buying more charcoal which he plans to resell in the town market.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Amaka

texts.en: Amaka sells fruits like apples to make a living in Sapele, Delta state, Nigeria. She loves this business and she sells for long hours to enable her to make more profits to make her business sustainable. She hopes for a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more apples to sell at retail prices to her customers. She is 40 years old and married with 3 children. Her children are excelling in their school work. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more apples to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en: Mrs. Choeun M., who is a villager in Trapeang Chrey village in Takeo province, is 46 years old. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to sell in order to support her family. She supports two children by herself because she is a widow. One of her children is attending local public school, while the other does farming so he has a lot of free time. For this reason, Mrs. Choeun M. decided to seek a loan from AMK to make more money for purchasing a new motorbike for her child to use as a motorcycle taxi driver.

loans.use: purchasing a new motorbike for her child to use as a taxi driver

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Rolando N. is a farmer. He has one child who is only 1 year old. As the head of the family, he thinks of ways to provide his family with an adequate supply of food, clothing and other basic needs. He is busy on the farm. He has been tilling it for so many years now. He would like to apply for a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is 29-year-old woman who resides in a city named Lahore, in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods.
 
Zubaida is a very hardworking lady. She operates a seasonal vegetable-selling business. She sells the vegetables to her neighbors from a four-wheeled cart at the entrance of her house. Her husband, whose name is Z., also helps her in her business. He goes to vegetable markets and purchases the seasonal vegetables for her business. She has been in this profession for over eight years. 

Zubaida is the mother of five children, two sons and three daughters. She has enrolled all of her children in school because she wants them to have a good education so they can improve their future and make themselves proud.  

Zubaida has successfully repaid three loans to Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a fourth loan to purchase vegetables to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal vegetables to sell

loans.name: Adolphe

texts.en:
Adolphe is 35 years old, married with 6 children aged between 1 and 13. Adolphe’s wife is a farmer and they both work hard for the development of their family. Adolphe owns a small shop which sells spare parts. This is his 5th year of successful operation in business! The hours of his shop are from 6 in the morning to 8 in the evening every day except on Saturday.

Even though Adolphe has a lot of experience, his monthly profit is too low to expand meaningfully and he believes that a small amount of additional capital would change that for him. For that reason, Adolphe is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase other products for his shop such as: beans; soap; cooking oil, and so on. With this loan Adolphe will be able to serve more customers from his community which will allow him to obtain more profits. With the profit, Adolphe expects to be able to save money for the school fees of his children.

loans.use: products for his shop such as: beans; soap; cooking oil, and so on

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy equipment and for working capital

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en: Marietta C. is from the village of Minang, Roxas. She is 66 years old. Marietta is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Marietta owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Marietta has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2008, Marietta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marietta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Marietta is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used for additional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Marietta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Naema

texts.en:
Naema A. is a 56-year-old housewife. Naema has two sons who are married and live in another village. Naema's husband suffers from health issues, so Naema is the one who works to support herself and her husband.

Naema started growing vegetables on a piece of land that her husband owns, and on which they have a greenhouse. Because summer has already started, and it's relatively hotter than in past years, she decided to build a tube well (a type of water well in which a long stainless steel pipe is bored into an underground aquifer) to avoid water shortages in the coming years.

In the picture, Naema appears at the FATEN office.

loans.use: Build a tube well

loans.name: Ema

texts.es:
La señora Ema R. es soltera vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Llojeta ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Ema R. es empleada domestica de una familia particular de esta ciudad ingresos con los que se mantiene.
El crédito solicitado es para la conclusión de construcción de una habitación en una fracción de terreno que le cedió su padre.
Esta es la tercera  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Ema R. is single and lives with her parents in the Llojeta area, on the hills west of the city of La Paz. She works as a maid for a family in the city and supports herself with the wages from this job. The loan she is seeking will be used to complete building a house on a plot of land left to her by her father. This is the third time that Ema has asked for a loan, and our analysis of her socioeconomic status qualifies her to receive one.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to complete house construction

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian K. is currently in the business of selling charcoal out of her home  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal  and some firewood to sell.  Lilian is 39 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a real charcoal store.

loans.use: Store more bags of charcoal  and buy some firewood to sell

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
El señor Feliciano H. Jiménez tiene 57 años y está casado con la Señora Basilia López Peña por más de 30 años, tienen 3 hijos dependiente que estudia en nivel secundaria, la actividad principal es la agricultura producen papa, papaliza, haba, en su terreno que tienen 2.5 hectáreas en la comunidad de Pie de Gallo, la esposa ayuda en la actividad agrícola, en cuidado de ganados y de la casa.

Don Feliciano H. Jiménez y su familia viven en una comunidad rural Pie de Gallo a 62 km de la ciudad, por lo tanto para ellos es muy difícil acudir a los Banco para un préstamo de dinero. El Cidre tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona Rural. 

Don Feliciano H. necesitaba dinero para comprar insumos agrícolas, nos comenta que hay que renovar la semilla cada tres años, porque la semilla tiene enfermedad para sembrar en parcelas nuevas tiene que renovar la semilla sana y libre de enfermedades, por esta razón, la cosecha de este año ha sido escasa y los precios de los productos agrícolas a bajado, por esta razón no tiene suficiente dinero para comprar insumos, con la semilla renovada la producción aumentara y también los ingresos económico es mejor.
texts.en:
Mr. Feliciano H. Jiménez is 57 years old. He has been married to Mrs. Basilia López Peña for more than 30 years. They have 3 dependent children who are in secondary school. The main activity is agriculture. They grow potatoes, papaliza, and beans on their 2.5 hectares of land in the community of Pie de Gallo. His wife helps in the farming, taking care of cattle and the house. Mr. Feliciano H. Jiménez and his family live in the rural community of Pie de Gallo, 62 km from the city. Because of this it is very hard for them to go to the bank for a money loan. El Cidre had the initiative of going to this rural area. Mr. Feliciano H. needs the money to buy agricultural materials. He tells us that he has to renew the seed every three years, because the seed has an illness and in order to plant in new lots new, healthy seed has to be used. For this reason, the harvest this year has been low and the prices have gone down. That is the reason he doesn't have enough money to buy materials. With the new seed, production will go up and his income will improve.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase agricultural materials to plant potatoes.

loans.name: Hermano Miguel (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Hermano Miguel está formado por 8 mujeres que son como una familia  unida que buscan  mejorar su economía y así salir adelante con sus familias. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad mas importante  del país, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía y una belleza natural.

La Señora Norma Beatriz vive en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 29 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 11, 9, 5 años de edad, todos sus hijos estudian en la escuela, su esposo es tapicero y posee su propio taller, la casa en la que habitan no es de su propiedad por lo que viven arrendando.
La Señora. Norma es maestra hace  4 años, pertenece al magisterio y labora medio día en una escuela, también se dedica a la venta de productos naturales  Forever.  Lleva 17 créditos trabajando con la banca comunal y nos comenta que los créditos son muy beneficiosos ya que tiene facilidad de pago, el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en  más productos Forever.  Su  sueño es tener su casa propia.

La Señorita Marcia Teresa Carvinagua vive por el sector de la Orquídeas en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, estudia en la universidad  la carrera de Psicología educativa y va en su primer año, también ayuda a su mamá en un bar que poseen, es su primer crédito en la fundación y ha sido incentivada por su mamá a formar parte de este  grupo de mujeres luchadoras.
La Señorita Marcia tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera, vive en la casa de su hermana y depende económicamente de sus papás. El  crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en su matrícula y en la compra de productos para el bar, su  sueño es terminar su carrera.

NOTA FOTO: Las Señora que esta parada en la parte de atraz con un niño en brazos vestido de rojo, no perteneca a la banca, es pariente de una de las socias.
texts.en:
The communal bank Hermano Miguel is made up of 8 women that are like a close knit family, all looking to improve their financial situations and to provide for their families. They live in the city of Cuenca. This is the third most important city in the country. It has a great variety of gastronomy and a natural beauty. Señora Norma Beatriz lives on the outskirts of Cuenca. She is 29 years old and married. She has 3 children, ages 11, 9 and 5. All of her children attend school. Her husband is an upholsterer and has his own workshop. They don't own their own house but live in a rented house. Señora Norma has been a teacher for 4 years and works half days in a school. She also sells Forever natural products. She has had 17 loans with the communal bank and she tells us that the loans have benefited her greatly since they have easy repayment plans. She will invest this loan in more Forever products. Her dream is to have her own house. Señorita Marcia Teresa Carvinagua lives near the Orquídeas neighborhood on the outskirts of Cuenca. Señorita Marcia is 20 years old and single. She lives in her sister's house and is economically dependent on her parents. She is studying educational psychology at the university. She is starting her first year. She also helps her mother in a bar they own. This is her first loan with the foundation. She was encouraged by her mother to join this group of hard-working women. She will use the loan from Fundación Espoir to pay her enrollment fees and to buy products for the bar. Her dream is to finish school. NOTE: The woman standing with the child in red in the back line of the photo is not a member of the bank. She is a parent of one of the members.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase Forever products, to pay school registration fees and buy food items

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida D. is from the village of Lactawan Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 59 years old. Leonida is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Leonida owns & operates a motorcycle transport business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport to local community members. Leonida has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Leonida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used for the repair and maintenance of the vehicle used in the business. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Leonida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for the repair and maintenance of the vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Genedina

texts.en:
Genedina S. is from the village of San Francisco, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 43 years old. Genedina is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Genedina owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Genedina has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Genedina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genedina has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Genedina is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Genedina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Abadahemuka Group

texts.en: Monique is 29 years old and married to a farmer. They have 4 children between the ages of 2  and 10 . Two of them go to school while the other two are still young. She has also adopted one child whom she helps. Monique is the group leader of the ABADAHEMUKA Group. Monique sells sorghum. She has spent 3 years in this business of selling sorghum. With this loan she will buy more sorghum to sell. With the  profit from this business she will increase the amount of sorghum and save money. She would like to set up her own strong business where everyone can know her better than the way she is known now. In the photo, Monique is sitting at the front row with a blue notebook.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell

loans.name: Solina

texts.en:
Solina is 23 years is old. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of one and fourteen. One of her children goes to school. Her husband works as a driver. Solina sells milk, tea and juices. She has had this business for one year. 

With this loan she will buy more milk and tea to sell. With the profit she will purchase more drink items to increase her total sales. She says that her business is successful because she offers good customer care. In the future she would like to own a mini supermarket.

loans.use: To buy more milk and juice to sell

loans.name: Orkhon

texts.en:
Orkhon, who is 29 years old, lives with his wife and two-year-old son in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. A carpenter by trade, since 2008 Orkhon has been running a taxi business and also working as a part-time handyman. His wife works in one of the “Khaan buuz”’ chain restaurants as a kitchen assistant.

Orkon's wife's younger brother is leaving for South Korea to work on a labor contract; such contracts are very hard to obtain due to the large volume of Mongolians applying to work abroad to earn some extra money, and they must pass through a very strict selection procedure. The loan Mr.Orkhon is requesting will be used to pay for his brother-in-law's travel to Korea and to cover some personal expenses.

loans.use: To pay for brother’s travel to Korea on labor contract and to cover some personal expenses

loans.name: Airish

texts.en:
Airish N. is from the village of Guanzon Tuto St. Gingoog City. She is 23 years old. Airish is single. To make a living, Airish owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells lotions, perfumes and deodorants from NATASHA & AVON in the local community. Airish has been engaged in her business for more than a  year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Airish joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Airish is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This will be the first loan taken by Airish from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to buy and sell

location.town: Guanzon Tuto St., Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Tserenpeljee

texts.en:
Tsrenpeljee is 36 years old, and lives with his wife and 2 daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They all live together in one-bedroom studio apartment, which they rent in the wintertime. In summertime, he lives in a ger, the Mongolian traditional nomadic tent, with his family on his younger brother’s plot of land.  His daughters are attending local secondary school. 

For 3 years, Tsrenpeljee has operated a taxi service in the city. He enjoys transporting people and is a very hardworking person. His wife, Oyunchimeg, is a kitchen assistant at a local café. Tsrenpeljee is providing a good education and other necessary expenses for his children. In the future, he is planning to purchase an apartment. He is requesting this loan to purchase some spare parts for his car and also to pay for apartment rent fee.

loans.use: To purchase some spare parts for his car and also to pay for apartment rent fee

loans.name: Eurocina Mercedes

texts.es:
Eurocina es socia del Banco comunal Despertar, es separada, tiene 56 años y 1 hijo. Se dedica a la venta de ropa para bebes. Solicita un préstamo para surtir su mercadería ahora que se aproxima las fiestas navideñas.
Eurocina, antes vivía y tenia su negocio en Ica, conoció con su pareja y decidieron vivir en Ayacucho, aprendió de este negocio de una amiga, antes era ambulante, ahora cuenta con un puesto en el Mercado 12 de Abril. Su sueño es que su negocio pueda crecer y que su hijo termine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Eurocina is a member of the Despertar community bank.  She is 56 years old, separated and has one child.  She sells baby clothes.  She is requesting a loan to stock her business with merchandise now that the Christmas holidays are approaching.

Eurocina used to live in Ica and had her business there.  However, she met her partner and they decided to go and live in Ayacucho.  She learned about this business from a friend.  She used to sell her products as an itinerant street vendor.  She now has a stall in the '12 de Abril' market.  Her dream is for her business to grow and for her son to finish his studies.

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothes

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en: Kiden K., a female who lives in Hai-gabat, Juba, Southern South Sudan.  She sells food like onions, tomatoes, etc.   Her future plan is to build a house for rent to help pay for her kid's school fees.

loans.use: To stock food like onions, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah K. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is not currently in school. Sarah has a candle-making business, which she has run for one year.
To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 150,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase candle wax materials for making candles for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Sarah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further. Sarah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future and taught her how to play games.

loans.use: To purchase candle wax for candle making

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Felipa tiene 42 años de edad , es casada, cuenta con una familia de dos hijos y una hija, ella es una madre luchadora ya que ha salido adelante con sus hijos  , y   esta solicitando su primer credito en asociacion ASDIR, para  comprar  un terreno, ya que ella es una persona responsable y desea lo mejor para su familia.
texts.en:
Felipa is 42 years old, married, and has a family consisting of two sons and a daughter.  She is a tenacious mother who has known how to get ahead with her children.

She is asking for her first loan from Asociación ASDIR to buy a lot since she’s a responsible person who wants the best for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a lot.

loans.name: Shumaila's Group

texts.en:
Shumaila is an educated lady who got her education up to the 12th grade.  After that, her parents had her married to S. N., who works in a private company for a reasonable income. She has a daughter who is studying in 10th grade. 

Shumaila started a sewing business 5 years ago to financially assist her husband. She takes orders from her neighborhood clients and fulfills the orders at a given time to earn profits. The income generated helps her to pay the school fees of her daughter and to pay the utility bills.  She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the improvement of her sewing business. She will use the loan money to buy a new sewing machine, which will allow her to complete the orders early and make larger profits.  Her old machine doesn’t produce quality work and takes much time to sew a single dress.  Shumaila is hopeful that, after buying a new sewing machine, she will be able to get improved profits, which will result in bettering the financial life of her family. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and hopes that it will be a good step for a better financial future.  Shumaila lives in an industrial city of Pakistan, known as Faisalabad. She owns a 2-room house there in the area of Samanabad. She moved there after her marriage 17 years ago.

Note: "In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Shumaila".

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Bernarditha

texts.en: Bernarditha is a married woman who lives in Bais City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store. Her husband Eduardo, who is 57 years old, works abroad as an OFW - overseas filipino worker so that he could save enough to secure his family's future, as well as be able to afford to send his children to college when they grow up. Their  two children who are 9 and 16 years old, are currently going to school. Bernarditha joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she also aspired to do something to improve her family's future wellbeing. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Bernarditha has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use to purchase merchandise to sell in her general store so that she can continue to support her family's day to day expenses and her children's school expenses as well as save up for future house renovations and to send her children to school. Bernarditha is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: purchase more merchandise to sell in her general store

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
La Sra. Milagros pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Bárbara” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 02 hijos, ambos dependientes de ella.
Milagros se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general y su bodega se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa. 
Con el primer préstamo de 300.00 Nuevos Soles que Manuela Ramos le brindó inició con su negocio adquiriendo leche en cajas, conservas de diferentes marcas y bebidas gasificadas. Cuenta con clientela fija como aAmigos, vecinos y personas de comunidades aledañas.  En su bodega tambiénofrece prodcutos de belleza que compra por catálogo.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará abarrotes para surtir más su negocio cómo: Arroz y azúcar en sacos, cajas de leches y aceites; gaseosas en paquetes de diferentes sabores y tamaños e insumos para la limpieza del hogar e higiene personal. Con ello podrá satisfacer a su clientela que a diario acuden a su tienda. Se siente muy orgullosa con el trabajo que realiza diariamente.

Milagros agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a mujeres como ella que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Milagros is a member of the "Santa Barbara" communal bank  in the Tarapoto District, in the province and department of  San Martin. She lives with her partner, is 31 years old and has 2 children, both dependent on her. Milagros sells general groceries and her shop is located in her own home. 

She started her business with a first loan of 300 soles that the Manuela Ramos Movement gave to her. With it she bought boxes of milk, canned food of different brands and soft drinks. She has a steady client base of friends, neighbours and people who live in surrounding communities. In her store she also sells beauty products that she buys through catalogue.  

With this loan of 1,000 soles she will buy groceries to stock up her business, such as bags of rice and sugar, boxes of milk and oil, packs of soft drinks of different sizes and flavours and household cleaning and personal hygiene products. This will meet the demands of her clients, who come to her store every day. 

She is very proud of her daily work. Milagros is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for supporting women who, just like her, want to succeed in life.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and sugar, boxes of milk and oil, packs of soft drinks of different sizes and flavours, and more.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of 4 children, Rosita works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Rosita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of starting an additional business and expanding the existing one.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Paula Cecilia

texts.es:
Paula de 32 años,  es una mujer emprendedora  que inicio su actividad hace 10 años en vista que tuvo que ayudar a su familia debido a que su padre falleció. Su negocio le a servido para suplir en algo las necesidades básicas de su casa.

El negocio lo tiene en su domicilio normalmente lo atiende todo el día, los fines de semana vende comida en  la esquina de su casa su mama le ayuda en el trabajo. Lo que más le afecta es la movilización ya que se quiere comprar un vehículo para facilitarle en la comprar de mercadería. Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas, hilos, herramientas de costura para aumentar sus ganancias. En un futuro poder tener una vivienda propia ya que donde vive le pertenece a su mama y la divide en varios familiares.
texts.en:
Paula, 32, is an enterprising woman that started her activity ten years ago, knowing that she had to help her family because her father passed away.  Her business has helped her provide some of her home’s basic needs.  Paula's business is based in her home and she usually tends to it all day.  On the weekends she sells food on the corner of her home, with her mother's help.

What affects Paula most is mobility, so she wants to buy a vehicle to help her purchase her merchandise.  She will use the money from this loan to buy more merchandise which will allow her to increase her income. In the future she wants proper housing, since she lives with her mother and shares the home with several family members.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, and sewing tools

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es:
Braulio es un joven de 19 años de edad, él es soltero, no tiene carga familiar directa, vive con sus padres. Vive en el  P.J  Vista Hermosa, cuenta con los servicios básicos (agua y energía eléctrica); esta ubicada  en el distrito de Pimentel, primer balneario del norte del Perú.

Braulio, cuenta con una unidad vehicular (mototaxi, vehiculo de transporte público, con  moto y una cabina para el transporte de personas), que es de su propiedad, con la cual  brinda servicio  de transporte publico de pasajeros. Además se desempeña como estibador (cargador), en el mercado mayorista de Mochoqueque, Braulio es un joven que tiene experiencia en el rubro, pues tiene bastante tiempo desempeñando esta labor.  

Braulio necesita este crédito que esta solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa de
 S/, 1000,00 para que el pueda adquirir ventanas de fierro y una puerta para su vivienda, así apoyar a sus padres de esta manera contribuir a la seguridad de su hogar pues que es donde por las noches guarda su mototaxi, herramienta principal de su trabajo.                  

 Braulio, es un cliente nuevo, para Edpyme Alternativa pero cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Braulio is a 19 year-old youth who is single and has no family responsibilities.  He lives with his parents in P.J. Vista Hermosa.  Their house has basic utilities (water and electric), and is located in the Pimentel district, the first seaside resort in the north of Peru.

Braulio has a vehicle (a mototaxi, which is a motorcycle with an attached cabin used for public transportation) that is his own property.  He uses it to provide passenger transportation services.  In addition, he provides cargo transportation to the wholesale market of Mochoqueque.
