loans.name: Hilaria's Group

texts.en:
Hilaria S. is from the village of Culalabat, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 44 years old. Hilaria is the group leader for a 17-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Hilaria is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Hilaria owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Hilaria has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Hilaria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hilaria is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand the range of products in her store. This loan will be her seventh loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand the range of products in her store

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Having two children, Perla O. doesn’t know anymore how she will budget their small income. Her husband works as a farmer and she is helping her husband maintain the rice field. In addition to the rice farm, she also ventures into a piggery business, as well as managing a small sari-sari store to supplement their family income.

Perla is currently preparing her farm for planting and that is why she is needing all the help to be able improve their harvest. She would like to apply for a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Ayoko Akpédjé

texts.fr: Cette jeune femme est très dynamique, elle n’a pas fait de longue étude, afin de subvenir à ses besoins elle s’est lancée il y a deux ans de cela dans le commerce de détail des télévisions, amplificateur, portables, radio et autres. Elle a déjà obtenu du crédit de WAGES qu’elle a bien remboursé, voulant augmenter son stock, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de baffles, télévision à écran plasma, portables et divers.
texts.en:
This young woman is very dynamic. She was not in school for long. In order to provide for her needs, two years ago, she launched herself in the retail business selling televisions, amplifiers, mobile phones, radios and more. She has already received a loan from WAGES that she fully reimbursed. Wanting to increase her stock, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase speakers, plasma screen TVs, mobile phones and various goods.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of electronic equipment

loans.name: Ebenerzer #6 Group

texts.en: Emmanuel W. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Ebenezer #6. He is 32 years old, single, with two children, 7 and 13. He was only able to attend school through 10th grade due to poverty. For 10 years, he has sold used shoes at Waterside Market downtown Monrovia, Liberia. His friendly manner keeps customers returning. He plans to use his 9,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 46,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more used shoes. His goal is to grow his business and continue to support his children so they can have a better future. In the photo, Emmanuel is the one holding the sign. Inset at the lower right is Rufus T.

loans.use: To buy more used shoes.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen tiene la edad de 57 años, no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos con Fundación pues siempre ha dicho que son de mucha ayuda. Tiene 6 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a su actividad que es un cafetín, pues siempre ha sido una persona muy dinámica y que disfruta de su trabajo, pues logro proporcionarles a sus hijos lo que ellos necesitaban. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y así invertir en productos como gaseosas, golosinas, frutas naturales, postres, desayunos y almuerzos. Siempre sueña con seguir ampliando su negocio y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
María del Carmen is 57 years old. This is not the first time that she has taken a loan from the Fundación, and she always has said that the loans have been very helpful. She has 6 children who are economically independent. For more than 10 years she has had a small cafe. She has always been a very dynamic person who enjoys her work, and through the work she managed to provide for the needs of her children. Currently she requests a loan for working capital that she will use to buy products such as soft drinks, snacks, fresh fruit, desserts, breakfasts and lunches. She always dreams of expanding her business and improving her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy food items for her cafe

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Josè Antonio de 33 años de edad habita en la Cmca. El Jicaro del municipio de San Miguelito junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa la Sra. Marisol Morales y sus 2 niños menores de edad.  Cuenta con una gran experiencia en la actividad agropecuaria pues desde muy joven se ha dedicado al cuido de su pequeña finca de 40 Mzs en donde realiza ordeño de su ganado, elaboracion de queso, establecimiento de cultivos.  

Esta solicitando su 4to crédito a la instituciòn de AFODENIC con el objetivo de comprar terneros de desarrollo, los cuales los cuidara y engordara para comercializarlos cuando obtengan el peso del mercado, esperando obtener ganancias que le permitan mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José Antonio is 33 years od and lives in the Comarca El Jícaro of the municipality of San Miguelito with his wife, Mrs. Marisol Morales, and their 2 young children. He has a lot of farming experience as he has been taking care of his small far of 40 Mzx since he was very young, he milks his cows and makes cheese as well as grows crops.

He is requesting his fourth loan with the AFODENIC to buy calves which he will look after and fatten to sell when they have reached the market weight. He hopes the profits will allow him to improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza B. is from the village of Gingoog City. She is 28 years old. Riza is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Riza owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Riza has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Riza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Riza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Riza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Benkadi  3 Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi 3 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de SESSO dans la préfecture de SAN, région de SEGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 28 ans et au moins 3 enfants.
Elles cultivent de l’arachide.   
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, cette année et sont à leur  premier prêt de campagne.
OUMOU B. compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide   des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles, au grand marché de TENE. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de TENE, de MOPTI et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 12500 à 37500FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Benkadi 3 is a group of married women from the village of SESSO in the SAN prefecture of SEGOU (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families. On average, they are 28 years old and have at least 3 children. They grow peanuts. With the intention of making their farming activities more profitable, the members of the group decided ton join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program this year. This is their first farming loan. OUMOU B. plans to use her loan to purchase a large enough quantity of peanut seeds, small tools and fertilizers at the general market of TENE. After the rainy season, the harvest is stored for a while for its value to increase, before selling it at the general markets of TENE, MOPTI and other nearby markets, retail (often wholesale), for cash to customers who mostly come from large towns. Each member of the group expects to make a profit on the sale of their agricultural products ranging from 12,500 to 37,500 CFA francs, which will be used to pay the interest on the loan and ongoing family expenses.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds and small tools

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine W. is currently in the business of selling both dried and fresh fish at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more fish and tomatoes to sell.  

Catherine is 31 years old and married to a driver. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: Stock more fish and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: La señora Luisa es cliente desD. el año 2004 comenzó con el grupo solidario Flor del Campo durante cinco años, actualmente se independiza como crédito individual por que el otro integrante del grupo viajo a su pueblo y no se sabe cuando retornara. Doña luisa es una mujer bastante trabajadora pese a que se separo D. su esposo no se dio por vencida y saca adelante a sus tres hijos sin descuidar sus estudios ya que dos D. ellos aun están en colegio y la mayor se encuentra estudiando en la universidad.  Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona alto tejar, avenida entre ríos,  casa D. sus señores padres.  La actividad que realiza es la venta D. comida hace 17 años su puesto D. venta es en la puerta D. su domicilio,  es una señora bastante emprendedora que desea seguir trabajando con la institución.  El crédito será destinado para la compra D. abarrotes por mayor  también comprara papa, tunta, chuño y otros.
texts.en:
Luisa has been a client since 2004 who started with the “Flor D. Campo” (Flower of the Field) group. Currently she is requesting this loan independently, because the other member of the group traveled to his (her) village and she doesn’t know when s/he will return. Ms. Luisa is a hard working woman. When she separated from her husband, she didn’t give up and has managed to move her three children ahead without disrupting their studies. Two of them attend school and the oldest studies at the university. Her home is located in the Alto Tejar zone, Avenida Entre Rios, Casa D. Sus Señores Padres. For 17 years she’s been selling food from a stall located within her home. She is a very entrepreneurial woman who wants to continue working with the institution. She will use the money from this loan to buy groceries in bulk, and also potatoes, tuna, chuño (a kind of Peruvian potato) and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Savorn V., 52, is the village bank president selected by the twenty-five group loan members, located in Preak Ta Kaev village, Kandal province. With their loan, each member of this village bank hopes to increase his or her income and to improve the living standards of their families.    
  
Mrs. Savorn V. is a groceR. seller in the local village while her husband, Mr. Pha Oem, is a motorbike taxi driver. With both occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to increase income and to expand the groceR. business, Mrs. Savorn V. will use the loan to buy more groceries to resell. This couple has five children who are all students and also help in their parents' businesses.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to resell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man with one child who attends school. His wife is employed as a sales representative and she helps in supporting the family. He has been operating his retail shop for the last two years, selling to town dwellers and passersby.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, a sack of rice and sugar and bottles of drinking water. In addition he works at the Kenya ferry services as his other source of income.

George faces the major challenge of inflation in his business. He hopes that in future he will be able to run a wholesale shop and improve his standard of living.

He decided to work with Yehu so as to get a loan to boost his business. He owns a house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To purchase  wheat flour, maize flour, a sack of rice and sugar and bottles of drinking water.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith T. is from the town of Trinidad. She is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Judith owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She sells sugar, oil and other products. 

Judith joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Judith has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is 25 years old and has two children. They live in their own home in the Anexo San Jose in the village of La Cedoroda in the district of Morrope.

Silvia sells fruit and candy in the mornings in her village and the surrounding area. She purchases inventory on a regular basis from the Mercado Moshoqueque, which is a sprawling wholesale market located in the northern portion of the city of Chiclayo. Her sales vary with the season, selling various fruits as they come into season.

The requested loan is designated for the purchase of additional merchandise so that she can expand the selection she offers to her clients. She also expects to be able to realize greater discounts because she will buy non-perishable items in bulk.

Silvia is a woman who is devoted to her family, and her neighbors think highly of her. This will be Silvia’s first loan and first experience with a financial institution. She hopes to be able to use the credit to improve her family’s quality of life and help provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruit and candy

loans.name: Armie

texts.en:
Armie S. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 40 years old. Armie is married. To make a living, Armie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale.

Armie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Armie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Armie is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs and hog feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support the immediate members of her family.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and hog feeds

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 19-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two brothers. Despite his young age, he has six years of experience working as a farmer. He has owned his own farm since 2007.  He works independently on his farm. 

He learned this occupation from his father; he used to help him in cultivating his land. He cultivates all type of vegetables and fruits according to the season. Lebanon is known by its multiple seasons, that’s the reason why it is always possible to find a variety of products year-round. He also uses plastic tents to grow his products. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase needed supplies for his agriculturA. work, such as fertilizers and seeds. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits for the coming harvest.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds for farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jyldyzkan's Group

texts.en:
Jyldyzkan A. is the leader of this group. She is 49 years old and divorced. She has raised a son who is now 24 years old. He went to work in Russia to make money. 

In order to cover personal expenditures, Jyldyzkan sells fruits and vegetables in the local market. She has been doing this for sixteen years. In this way she earns about $113 per month.  She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase more fruits and vegetables in order to increase the turnover of her business. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es:
Walter, de 37 años de edad, se dedica a la carpintería, reside en San Miguel, donde vive con su esposa y sus hijos de 15 y 17 años de edad, quienes dependen económicamente de él, la carpintería de Walter es estable ya que él lo conocen muchos clientes quienes lo recomiendan para nuevos trabajos, realiza decoraciones de madera en viviendas de residenciales, trabaja a domicilio y también en su taller.
Por el momento su dificultad es carecer de inventario ya que en ocasiones debe pedir a los clientes adelantado una parte del dinero para comenzar el trabajo, motivo que lo ha llevado a solicitar un préstamo para la compra de madera lo que permitirá tener disponibilidad de materia prima para salir con la demanda de trabajos.
Sueña con tener un negocio grande de muebles, ser reconocido por muchas personas e ir mejorando su trabajo cada día.
texts.en:
Walter, 37, is a carpenter.  He lives in San Miguel with his wife and children who are 15 and 17 years of age and depend economically on him.  Walter’s carpentry shop is stable now because he is known by many customers who recommend him for jobs.  He does wood decorations on residential properties, works both in his shop and on site.

For the moment his difficulty is the lack of stock inventory.  Sometimes he has to ask his customers for advance payments in order to start working.  This is why he’s asking for a loan to be able to buy lumber to have raw materials on hand so that he can meet customer demand.  He dreams with having a large furniture making business, to be widely known by many people and to improve his work every day.

loans.use: To buy lumber.

loans.name: Jenipher Dorcus

texts.en: Jenipher Dorcus O., 45 years old, is married to Thomas and they have five children. Jenipher is a tailor and has been in the tailoring business for the last four years with a good income. This being her first loan from KADET LTD, she plans to purchase more materials for making clothes. The anticipated profits have been directed to her children’s education. Her dream is to open a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for making clothes

loans.name: Nyame Na

texts.en: Nyame Na O. cooks rice and other foods for sale at Elmina. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Nyame has been cooking for sale for ten years. She assists her husband in paying for the education of her dependents. Her loan will be used to buy food items to cook to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy food items to cook

loans.name: Benson Amadu's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you teachers of the Badru Deen Secondary School, Kenema. This school was founded in September 2000 by the Badru Deen Islamic Organization to promote education in the country. Badru Deen Secondary school is staffed with thirty able teachers and has 695 pupils.  

This is the first loan that this school has applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. Benson A. M. is the leader of this group of teachers. The thirty-seven-year-old Benson was born in Ngiehun village. He has been in the teaching profession for eight years now. He is married to a housewife and they have one child who is attending primary school. Benson has requested this loan in order to purchase house building materials like cement, iron, corrugated zinc, nails, etc. for the construction of a house.

loans.use: Buy house building materials like cement, iron, corrugated zinc, nails, etc.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
El comité La Amistad se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la compañía de Hugua Rey, Distrito de Santaní.
El comité está en el quinto ciclo con 12 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas y pretenden terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento de responsabilidad. Al adquirir el crédito se le abren muchas puertas para el progreso de sus emprendimientos.
La presidenta del grupo, Liss Mabel, es una criadora de pollitos, que luego vende para poner huevos o para las pollerías, pero como ultimamente están subiendo de precio en el mercado de ofertas los pollitos, desea el préstamo para poder seguir con su negocio, ya que es la única fuente de ingresos económicos que posee.
texts.en:
The La Amistad group was formed by several neighbors in the neighborhood of Hugua Rey, Santaní District.

The group is in its fifth cycle with 12 members.  It is a group that stands out in the neighborhood for being very united, supportive, and responsible.  The members have great entrepreneurial spirit, since they are current with their payments and intend to finish this stage with very good fulfillment of their responsibilities.  When they receive the loan, many doors open to them for the progress of their work.  The president of the group, Liss Mabel, raises chicks, which she then sells as egg layers or to the poultry shop.  Since the market price for chicks is rising lately, she wants the loan in order to be able to continue with her business, since it is the only source of income she has.

loans.use: Purchase of chicks and balanced animal feed

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Sabali sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 33 ans et 3 enfants par femme. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Darsalam de la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenus au marché Château de Ségou. 
Les membres du groupe font l’achat et la vente des légumes (choux pommés et échalotes), des articles divers (boîtes d’allumette, colorants, bonbon, thé, …), des habits pour enfants et de la friperie. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce et de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 10ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Hawa Diabaté compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 20 sacs de choux pommés et 500 kg d’échalotes. Elle se ravitaille en gros avec les foraines des villages environnants de Ségou, au marché Médine de Ségou. La revente se fait en détails au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché Château, à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Madame Hawa   Diabaté espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer au quotidien. 
Elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women in the Sabali group are married and are on average 33 years old with 3 children.  Most of them live in monogamous families. They all live in the Darsalam district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali) and became acquainted through their businesses in Segou's Château market.
Group members buy and sell vegetables (round cabbages and shallots), sundries (matchboxes, dyes, candy, tea, ...), children’s and used clothing.   In order to increase their working capital and to have cash for getting fresh supplies, the group members partnered with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 10th solidarity loan.  Mrs. Hawa Diabaté plans to use her loan to buy 20 sacks of cabbages and 500 kg of shallots. She gets her supplies wholesale from stallkeepers in the villages surrounding Ségou and at Segou's Médine market. She sells her goods retail for cash and on credit, from her home and at the Château market, to a clientele composed mainly of women.  With this loan, Mrs. Diabaté hopes to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 CFA which will be used to reinvest in the business and to take care of small everyday household expenses.  Her goal is to increase the volume of her business in partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: To buy vegetables (round cabbages and shallots)

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOQ RUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Julio Cesar; el tiene 25 años de edad y es soltero; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de celulares, chips, recargas virtuales entre otros el tiene su stand que se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de San Sebastian, el lleva ya un buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le trae muchas satisfaciones, el socio a la vez es ingeniero industrial de profesión pero actualmente no ejerce su carrera ya que esta mas dedicado a su negocio.

El socio solicita el préstamo para realizar la compra de mas equipos de celular para implementar su negocio.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Julio Cesar belongs to the Mosoq Runa Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Julio Cesar is 25 years old and single.  He alternates his daily activities with the business of selling cell phones, chips, and phone recharge cards, among other things.  His stand is in the San Sebastian district.  He has been in this business for a good amount of time, and it brings him a lot of satisfaction.

He is an industrial engineer by profession, but he currently does not practice his profession because he is more devoted to his business.

He is requesting the loan to buy more cell equipment for his business.  He is happy about the loan, and he pledges to make all of his payments.

loans.use: to buy more cell equipment for his business

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 67 years old and married with 10 children.

Anita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a Sari-sari Store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock for her general store.

Anita has borrowed and repaid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the Sari-sari Store for 6 years and also earns an income from a door to door cosmetic business.

Anita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: José Jesus

texts.es:
José tiene 31 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus seis hijos en el distrito de Olmos, en la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

José se dedica desde hace 4 años a la crianza y comercialización de ganado ovino y caprino, los cuales cría en un ambiente dentro de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia.

José desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Jose, age 31, is married and lives with his wife and their six children in the Olmos district of the Lambayeque province, located about two hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

For four years, Jose has been making a living by raising and commercializing sheep and goat livestock. He raises his animals at home, and when they reach a good level of development, he offers them for sale to the general public as well as to the merchants who visit the area. With the income from this activity, Jose is able to provide for his family.

Jose would like to expand his business by purchasing more animals and balanced animal feed, thereby increasing his sales. For this reason, he has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 soles.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and animal feed

loans.name: Gongob

texts.en:
H. is from the village of Talic, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old, married, and has one child. To make a living, H. runs a business making and selling furniture in the local community.   She has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities. 

H. joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to pay for materials needed to make bamboo furniture. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: buy materials to make bamboo furniture

loans.name: Lucia Del Transito

texts.es:
Lucia, es empleada y administra una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, vive con su hija y un nieto de 5 años de edad, tiene casa propia y trabaja en el centro escolar.
Ella quiere invertir en mercadería como boquitas, dulces, galletas, bebidas, huevos, granos básicos. Esta compra le ayudara a diversificar su inventario teniendo mayores opciones para comprar.
Su objetivo es mantenerse siempre en el negocio, cuidar su empleo y apoyar a su hija y nieto.
texts.en:
Lucia works for and manages a store selling food staples. She lives with her daughter and her five year-old grandson. She has her own home and works in the school center. 

She wants to invest in merchandise such as snacks, candy, cookies, drinks, eggs and basic grains. This purchase will allow her to diversify her inventory and to have more puchasing options for her customers. 

Lucia's goals are to stay in this business, to take care of her job and to support her daughter and grandson.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, candies, cookies, drinks, eggs and basic grains.

loans.name: Kankeletigui 7 Group

texts.fr:
KANKELETIGUI 7 est un regroupement de six femmes  toutes mariées du village de Dembela dans la préfecture de NIENA région de SIKASSO troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux-parents, belles-sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans et au moins 4 enfants.
Elles exercent la culture d’arachide de riz, des pois de terre, du pois sucré et de mil.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour payer les frais de labours, acheter  une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, de riz, des petits matériels, des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de Dembela. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de NIENA et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
AWA compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 1 sac d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 15.000 à 20 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
KANKELETIGUI 7 us a group of six women who are all married. They are from the village of Dembela in the prefecture of NIENA, Region of SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in large, traditional extended families with their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law, etc.  The group members average 31 years of age and four children each, and they grow peanuts, rice, Bambara peas, sweet peas, and millet.

Concerned about make their farms profitable, the group members decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. At the main market of Dembela, the current loan will be used to pay for: labor for plowing; a sufficient quantity of seeds to plant peanuts and rice; sundry supplies and equipment; and fertilizers and the like for raising crops. 

The crops are stocked up for a while, so that they become valuable following the off-season. And then they are sold retail for cash at the main market of NIENA and at surrounding markets to a customer base of people generally from large cities. 

AWA intends to spend her loan on: a sack of urea, 2 sacks of cereal-blend fertilizer, and the labor for plowing and weeding. She envisions making a monthly profit of 15,000 to 20,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and to cover typical family expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Suos

texts.en:
The people shown in the picture are Mrs. Suos, her husband who live together with their children in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province.  Suos, 36, sells various kinds of vegetables in the busy market, and earns approximately $2 profit a day. 

She is married to Mr Roeurn, age 46, who shares responsibility for his family by planting rice crop and some vegetable. Mrs. Suos has five children all of whom are single, and two of them are working in various jobs to earn income.  Since the rainy season is coming, Mrs. Suos would like to request a loan to plant vegetable seeds and to buy fertilizers for her crops to they will grow well.

loans.use: to plant vegetable seeds and to buy fertilizers for her crops to grow well.

loans.name: Anastase

texts.fr: Anastase  est éleveur, il est Rwandais il est le client d’ACB depuis 2007,il est marie, il a 50ans, il a 2 enfants entre 15 ans et 16ans et tous vont à l’école, il a deux personne en charge. Il a 6 ans  des études secondaire c’est son sixième  cycle de prêt avec ACB.il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter  les aliments des poules et payer la main d’oeuvre.il n ya pas des difficultés attendu  de non –remboursement du credit.sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire  est de rembourse le crédit à temps et utiliser la technologie pour son élevage   .ses ambitions il voudrait devenir un grand distributeur des œufs et construire des maisons de location, et pour sa famille il voudrait payer le minerval de ses enfants et les faire soigner.
texts.en: Anastasius is a breeder, he is from Rwanda and is a client of ACB since 2007. He is 50 years old, married, has two children, who are 15 and 16 and both are attending school. He also has two other kids in his care. He completed six years of secondary education. He is requesting his sixth loan from ACB, which he will use to purchase animal food and pay his workers. He has never had any problem in paying back his previous loans. His business growth strategy is to pay back according to schedule and use technology in his breeding business. His ambition is to become a major distributor of eggs and to build houses to rent, and for his family he wants to be able to pay for the school fees of his children and for their health care.

loans.use: to purchase animal food and pay workers

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La señorita Andrea tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres.
Ella se dedica a la venta ambulante de prendas de vestir y lencerías. Empezó el negoció hace 2 años con un pequeño capital que le han aportado sus padres y así obtuvo sus ingresos en forma independiente ya que ella siempre fue muy emprendedora por lo que logró que fuera un éxito su propósito.
Andrea cubre sus gastos de estudios y personales con dicha actividad como también aporta a la canasta familiar, por lo que sus padres son orgullosos de ella y sostienen que vale la pena apoyarla en sus emprendimientos.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de prendas de invierno en general debido a que es la temporada y ya tiene muchos pedidos.
texts.en:
Miss Andrea is 20, single, and lives with her parents.
She sells clothing and lingerie as a street vendor. She started two years ago with a small amount of capital that her parents gave her, and then she made an income independently as she has always been very enterprising. Her project has been a success. 
Andrea covers the costs of her studies as well as her personal costs through this business, and she also contributes to the household funds. Her parents are proud of her for this, and see that it pays to support her in her enterprises.
She is requesting a loan for the purchase of articles of winter clothing, since it is that season and she already has many orders.

loans.use: to purchase articles of winter clothing.

loans.name: Vibol

texts.en: We know that most of the people in Cambodia work as farmers. Some are poor but not all, because some of them are rich. Mrs. Vibol is also a farmer. Everyday she and her husband always go to the farm and take care it. The outcome is that she could earn more per year. Both of them get a profit of  about $8 per day. Although they live in the country, they live in happiness. Both of them birthed three kids. For living in a modern family, she requests a loan of $1,200 to buy a pumping machine.

loans.use: to buy a pumping machine.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 61 years old and married with two adult children. She is from Aurora, Zambo, del Sur, Philippines. She has been a dressmaker for 11 years. Together with her husband, she creates dresses of all kinds -- casual, jeans, basketball uniforms, etc. Every month she earns PHP 10,000. She became a GDMPC member in 2007. Teresita is applying for her third loan of PHP 5,000. The money is intended to purchase dressmaking materials such as sewing threads, bobbin cases, etc. She is hoping to have more orders and buy another sewing machine for fast and good output.

loans.use: To purchase dressmaking materials such as sewing threads, bobbin case, etc.

loans.name: Sophia's Group

texts.en:
Sophia is seventeen years old and lives in the town of Zana in the west Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past year Sophia has sold charcoal.

Sophia‘s Group is comprised of Sophia and another hardworking woman. Sophia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

To help her charcoal business, Sophia has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda, which will be used to purchase more charcoal to sell. With the help of this loan from BRAC, Sophia hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself.

In the future, Sophia hopes to grow her charcoal business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita de cincuenta años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo. Ella posee una tortillería la cual le ayuda a mantener a flote su hogar, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las tortillas que prepara Felicita son inigualables siempre calientitas y con el servicio más rápido del lugar, además tienen un precio realmente bajo; Felicita es una mujer muy trabajadora con muchos propósitos por alcanzar, para ella la confianza y dedicación en lo que te gusta hacer, son el secreto de un éxito futuro. Quiere ver crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicito a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor , aceite y gas propano para así siempre producir la cantidad demandada y no decepcionar a la clientela. Felicita tiene fe que su trabajo le dará la oportunidad de darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Felicita, who is 50 years old, lives with her life partner and her son.

She has a tortilla shop, which helps her to keep her household afloat. Felicita has recently gotten many customers because the tortillas she makes are without equal, always piping hot and with the fastest service in the area. They are also sold at a very low price.

Felicita is a very hardworking woman with many goals to reach. For her, confidence and dedication to what you like to do are the secret to future success. She wants to see her business grow, and this is why she asked INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy corn wholesale, oil and propane gas. This way, she can always produce the amount in demand and not disappoint her customers. 

Felicita has faith that her work will give her the opportunity to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale, oil and propane gas.

loans.name: Nato

texts.en:
Nato is 32 years old. She is from the village of Dzalisi, Mtskheta District, East Georgia. Nato is married and lives with her family, which includes her husband Roland, her two-year-old son and retired parents (68 and 71 years old). Roland works in the State Ministry of Defense where he is a soldier.  

Nato is leading the agricultural business of the family. They own two pigs and 10 piglets. Nato sells on average 20 piglets per year. Along with the pig farm, the family owns a 300 sq meter greenhouse, which is used for growing cucumbers and tomatoes. The total average monthly income from the agriculture is 500 Laris. 

Nato requested a loan to develop the pig farm. She will repair the existing pigsty and purchase additional piglets, which will be raised on the farm. After a couple of the months, the piglets will be sold for a higher price. Nato plans to reinvest part of the profit in the same business, in order to increase the amount of pigs in the business, which will give them more piglets to sell.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and materials for repairing the pigsty

loans.name: Daysi Noemi

texts.es:
Daysi  continúa con su plan del proyecto de mejorar poco a poco la infraestructura de su vivienda. Requiriere cambiar el techo de su casa que se ha deteriorado con el tiempo de lluvia. Inicio las mejoras por medio de préstamo siendo la mejor alternativa para lograr sus planes. 
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo de su nivel de vida. Con este ciclo de préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: Cemento, hierro, arena, piedrín, bloques, perlines, láminas de zinc y golosa.
texts.en:
Daysi is continuing with her plan of a project to improve the infrastructure of her house little by little. She needs to change the roof of her house which has deteriorated during the rainy season. She started the improvements with a loan as it was the best way to realize the plans.

She thanks the lenders for their support in improving her quality of life. With the current loan she will buy construction materials like cement, iron, sand, gravel, cinder blocks, purlins, sheets of zinc and screws.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies to build a new interior wall and enjoy better living conditions.

loans.name: Kalyl

texts.en:
Kalyl is 32 years old, married and has 3 children who are all in school.

Kalyl is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Kalyl requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Kalyl has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Kalyl would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista lives in Uganda. She is married and has seven children, all of whom are in school. Teopista owns a food stall business. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works six days a week. Teopista sells her products at the market. 

Teopista has requested a loan of 1000000 USh from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more cassava, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, tomatoes, green paper and oranges. The main business challenges for Teopista include seasonality and transportation. 

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and to educate her children. Teopista lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of green paper, oranges, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes and cassava

loans.name: Yaneth Argelia

texts.es: Yaneth Argelia D. veintiocho años D. edad vive junto a su compañero D. vida y sus hijos. Ella posee una tienda donD. venD. artículos D. primera necesidad,  se ha hecho D. mucha clientela últimamente pues ella siempre tiene lo que ellos necesitan con productos D. primera calidad a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable. Yaneth es conocida por ser una mujer entregada a su trabajo siempre dispuesta a mejorar, piensa que para lograr grandes cosas se necesita estar convencido D. querer el éxito, quiere cumplir sus metas es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar producto instantáneo, granos básicos, golosinas, bebidas, jabones etc. Yaneth Argelia tiene la esperanza que D. esta forma lograra darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Yaneth Argelia, 28, lives with her life companion and their children.  She has a store where she sells staple goods.  She’s acquired many customers lately because she always has what they need in stock with quality products at very affordable prices; besides the service is unequalled.  

Yaneth is known for being a woman who is devoted to her work and always willing to improve.  She believes that in order to attain great things one needs to be convinced of wanting to be successful.  She wants to reach her goals and this is why she’s asked Integral for a loan to buy instant products, basic grains, snacks, soft-drinks, soap, etc.  Yaneth hopes that she’ll be able to proviD. a fulfilled life for her family this way.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Aldin

texts.en:
Aldin is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. 
Aldin has a shop that sells canned goods, bananas & vegetables. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy coconuts, bananas & vegetables.
Aldin has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future,Aldin hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts, bananas & vegetables for resale

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.es: Norma Luz D. cuarenta y tres años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijas en casa propia. Ella posee una venta D. libros en su residencia, se ha hecho D. mucha clientela pues venD. D. todo tipo D. libros para niños y adultos, todos D. muy buena calidad y a precios realmente cómodos, además la atención es excelente siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa en el rostro; Norma es una mujer muy activa siempre está dispuesta a trabajar duro para alcanzar sus objetivos, ella piensa que para viajar lejos, no hay mejor nave que un libro, está dispuesta a tomar esa nave y hacer crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar impresora, tinta, libros entre otros. Norma Luz tiene fe con su esfuerzo logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Norma Luz, forty-three years old, lives with her life partner and their daughters in their home. She owns a book stand in her home. She has maD. many customers as she sells all types of books for children and adults. All are very good quality and sold at reasonable prices. Moreover, the service is excellent and she always greets her customers with a smile on her face. Norma is a very active woman who is always ready to work hard to achieve her objectives. She thinks that to travel far away, there's no better ship than a book. She is ready to take that ship and make her business grow. For this reason she is requesting a loan from Integral which will allow her to buy a printer, ink, and books, among other things. Norma Luz has faith that with her effort she will achieve giving her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a printer, ink, and books.

loans.name: Mulwanda Shg Group

texts.en:
Michael is the facilitator of the Mulwanda SHG group. Michael and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Michael takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Michael had a very good maize yield, harvesting 9 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Michael was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½ an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Michael and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Michael will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Mulwanda SHG group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Michael is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña María, originaria de Estelí, de oficio comerciante, vende ropa, perfumes joyas de plata , nos expresa el cambio positivo que le genero el préstamo Kiva pues gracias a este primer préstamo logro buenas ventas invirtió en mercadería variada le permitió hacer nuevos clientes. Ahora ve la oportunidad de brindar empleo a otras personas pues quiere contratar para vender plata es por ello que esta solicitando un segundo crédito comprar prendas de plata de varios estilo al por mayor y con esto lograr hacer mas clientes. Siempre sigue con sus planes construir locales que pueda rentar y vivir de ello cuando envejezca y terminar de hacerle mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
María is from Estelí, and works in commerce: she sells clothing, perfume, and silvery jewelry. She tells us that her first Kiva loan made a positive impact on her life, since thanks to that loan she had good sales. She invested the loan in a range of merchandise, which helped her attract new customers. Now, she has the opportunity to offer jobs to other people, and wants to hire people to help her sell silver. 

She is requesting this second loan in order to buy different styles of silver jewelry in bulk, in order to attract more clients. Her plans are to build business spaces that she can rent out so that she can live off of that income when she gets old, and finish her home improvements.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry in bulk

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Sarita is 30 years old.  She is married and has one child who is 11 years of age. In 2004, Sarita established her tailoring business. She supports her family working seven days a week and 10 hours a day. She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW. Sarita used her most recent to buy raw materials for her business. In the future, Sarita hopes to uplift her family's economic conditions. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell materials and work on their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buys raw materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her degree course.

loans.name: Arcenio

texts.es: El señor  Arcenio tiene 25 años, el se dedica  a la crianza de ganado para su posterior venta como tambien a la venta de leche, el vive en la localidad de Batallas, este préstamo es primero que tiene con la institución, el señor  Arcenio va a usar este préstamo para compra de un ganado mejorado para tener una mejor producción, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejorar sus ingresos, el señor  Arcenio enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su negocio y calidad de vida, el señor  Arcenio va a utilizar los beneficios mejorar sus ingresos y también comprar forraje para su ganado, el señor  Arcenio desea para su negocio crecer en la crianza y venta de ganado, El es una persona muy  trabajadora y emprendedora con ganas de seguir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Arcenio is 25 years old. He raises cattle in order to sell them later, and he also sells milk. 

He lives in the locality of Batallas. This is the first loan that Arcenio has with the institution, and he will use it to purchase an improved cow in order to have a better production. His reason for requesting this loan is to improve his income, and the challenges he faces are to improve his business and his quality of life.

Arcenio is going to use the funds to improve his income, and also to purchase forage for his cattle. He wants his business—raising and selling cattle—to grow. 

He is a very hardworking, enterprising person, with the desire to move forward and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en: Teopista is married with four children and two of whom go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members. She is a tailor. She has been in this business for 15 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy rolls of materials for making clothes.  She works from home on retail basis seven days a week.  Her goal is to see that MCDT-SACCO gives her capital for her business. She resides in the family house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees,rent, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy rolls of materials for making clothes

loans.name: Sonya

texts.en: Sonya, a 21 year old woman who has willingness to be a successful businesswoman in her youth. Then she started it by selling phone credit based of high demand around her neighbor. She was initiated the business using her own capital of IDR 200,000. Alongside with selling phone credit, Sonya utilizes the benefit to sell gasoline and she has started from only 5 liters. Seeing the growth of her business Sonya dreams of improving it by adding more phone credit and more liters of gasoline, therefore she requested loan amounting of IDR 1,750,000 from TLM to realize her dream.

loans.use: to buy more phone credit and also more liters of gasoline

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca K. is a hard working mother of eight; four boys and four girls. She has been an acitve member of Life in Africa since March of 2005. She works as a bracelet maker in the Invisible Children Bracelet Project which now provides her with a steady income. She also runs a stall at a local market in Kampala from which she also receives some money. Together these two jobs allow her to maintain her large family.

Rebecca is very passionate about educating her children. She says, "They should have the education I never had." But school fees for eight children is very challenging. She is looking for ways to add to her income to insure that this challenge can be met.

Rebecca's church owns some land with clay on it that it makes available to church members for making bricks. Rebecca has already seen one of her daughters do quite well in this business. She is thus seeking a loan in the amount of shs. 500,000 ($280) to fund the start-up of her own brick business.

This investment will create 2 jobs for others who will make the bricks, and she plans on using this business to finance the building of some tenant houses on her property. These she will rent out to further add to her income so that the necessary school fees for her children will be paid.

Below is her budget.

Firewood -- 25,000/=
Transport -- 10,000/=
Labour -- 435,000/=
Total -- 500,000/=

According to Rebecca's current income, she hopes to be able to repay this loan in 10 months. She has designated the impact portion of the interest she pays to support Life in Africa's Integrated Education Program for Adults, where she is currently learning English.

Rebecca's online journal can be found here.

loans.use: Pay worker salary and build two new houses.

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.en:
Mrs Ayélé L. is married and mother of four (4) children. Her husband is an artisanal blacksmith, but doesn't have enough clients and therefore doesn't have the means to support all the needs of the family. The quasi-totality of the responsibility for the family comes back onto Mrs L.. This is a source of great sadness. However, thanks to her corn business she manages to support the essential needs of the household. However, her capital is insufficient to expand her business and increase her revenues. Very serious about her business, she has a good character and merits a loan. She is asking for a loan of $800 so she can have a consistent supply of corn to resell when there is a shortage. The realisation of this project will increase her revenues and improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from FRENCH by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame L. Ayélé est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Son mari, fait la forge artisanale mais n’a pas assez de clients et donc ne dispose pas assez de moyens pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. La quasi-totalité des charges de la famille reviennent à Madame L.. Ce qui lui donne beaucoup de peine. Mais, grâce à son commerce de maïs, elle se débrouille pour subvenir aux besoins essentiels de son foyer. Or, son capital est insuffisant pour accroître son commerce et augmenter ses revenus. Très sérieuse dans ses affaires, elle jouit d’une bonne moralité et mérite d’être soutenue financièrement. Elle sollicite un crédit de $800 qui servira à faire un stock consistant de maïs et de le revendre en temps de pénurie. La réalisation de ce projet augmentera ses revenus pour l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: storage and sale of corn

loans.name: Leonid

texts.en:
Leonid offers vehicle repair services. He has very skillful hands and can fix any auto problem. He also restores used cars and sells them at exceptional prices. Presently, his gross revenue per month is about $4,000 – $6,000, and his monthly net profit amounts to $1,400.

Leonid is a very patient and professional man. He has partnered with “Nadiya Ukraine” since 2003 and has used previous loans for business expansion. He has been able to purchase new equipment and construct a big garage which he uses for his repair shop and as a paint booth. The new equipment and garage facility have helped him repair and sell more vehicles at reasonable prices.

Leonid is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase some additional equipment to use in straightening, grinding, puttying, and painting cars as well as to do engine mechanical work and all other types of repairs. Leonid believes that good quality equipment will help him provide excellent repair service to his customers and further increase his ability to restore and sell used cars.

В Леоніда є власна автомайстерня. Він дуже талановитий, може полагодити будь-яку проблему. Він також займається відновленням автомобілів, а потім продає їх за помірними цінами. Зараз його щомісячний валовий дохід складає приблизно 4000 – 6000 доларів, чистий прибуток складає 1400 доларів. Леонід – дуже терплячий, він справжній професіонал. Він співпрацює з „Надією України” вже з 2003 року, усі попередні позики використовував для розширення власного бізнесу. Леонід придбав нове обладнання та відбудував великий гараж, який зараз використовує в якості майстерні, де ремонтує та красить автомобілі. Нове облаштування та гаражне приміщення допомогли йому відновити та продати за помірними цінами багато автомобілів. Леонід просить про позику в 800 доларів для того, щоб придбати додаткове обладнання для рихтування, шпаклювання та відновлення панелей автомобілів, а також для механічного ремонту двигунів, тощо. Леонід вважає, що якісне обладнання допоможе йому забезпечити чудове обслуговування покупців і він зможе надалі відновлювати та продавати старі автомобілі.

loans.use: To purchase tools for car repair

loans.name: Zeby

texts.en:
Zeby S. has a small sewing shop in Khujand. She is married and has three sons. She lives with her parents-in-law who are pensioners and are under her guardianship. She has a university degree and is a designer of womens' clothes. She opened her sewing shop in 2001 and had only two sewing machines in it. She worked every day, without days off. When she heard about MicroInvest she became a client of this organization. She always disbursed her loan in time. Today she is one of the most active clients of MicroInvest. Due this organization she was able to expand her business. She bought 8 machines and employed 4 seamstresses.

Zeby has constant customers who buy her products and sell them in their shops. She also takes individual orders and tries to satisfy them. Today Zeby is one of the most famous designers in Khujand. She has clients from all districts of Khudjand and some clients from Dushanbe. In the new season, national dresses with embroidery and beads are in demand and so with this new loan for MicroInvest, Zeby wants to buy embroidery machines for her sewing shop.

loans.use: Zeby would like to purchase more sewing machines for her sewing shop.

loans.name: Christian

texts.en: Christian E. has been an LAPO client for 7 years. She is married with 3 children and she is 34 years old. She sells drinks and food stuffs - including melon, oil, ogbolor, and fish - to people living in her community. She has been in this business for 8 years.  She is requesting the above loan to enable her to buy more melon, oil and ogbolor to sell in her store.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks and food stuffs for sale

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
This woman is from the city of León. She started her business at the edge of the León central market 20 years ago with modest capital of barely C$1,500 córdobas ($80), contributed by her husband who is a soldier in the Nicaraguan army.

When she realized that her husband's salary would not cover their and their children's needs, she decided to start said business, which at the beginning only consisted of a few items of cheap clothing in a makeshift stall made out of plastic, wood and cardboard. With much work and sacrifice she was able to build her humble home and pay to educate her children, one of which is still young and in primary school. Now she runs her business in a small space located in a new part of the central market. She has one employee that helps with sales. She now offers a large variety of products: Clothing, shoes, cosmetics, picture frames, articles for children etc. Her business, however, is still on a small scale.The first loan that CEPRODEL granted her was for C$1,500 córdobas and has helped her for three years (even though she still sold her products in the streets).

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Esta señora es originaria de la ciudad de León. Su negocio empieza en las afueras del mercado central de León hace más de 20 años con un modesto capital de trabajo de apenas C$ 1,500 córdobas (U$$ 80 dólares), aportados por su esposo el cual labora como soldado del ejército de Nicaragua.

Ella al observar que el sueldo de su esposo no lograba cubrir las necesidades propias y de sus hijos, decide iniciar dicho negocio, el cual al principio contaba con algunas piezas de ropa barata, en una pequeña caseta improvisada, con plásticos, madera y cartón. Como fruto de su esfuerzo y perseverancia con mucho sacrificio logró construir su humilde vivienda y darles educación a sus dos hijos. Uno de ellos aún está pequeño y cursa su educación primaria. Actualmente, el negocio tiene un pequeño local ubicado dentro de nuevas áreas del mercado central, tiene una trabajadora la cual le ayuda con su venta. Ella ahora oferta una amplia variedad de productos: Ropa, Zapatos, cosméticos, marcos para retratos, artículos para niños, etc. Aunque siempre menor escala. El primer crédito que le otorgó CEPRODEL, fue de C$ 1,500 córdobas con quien tiene más de 3 años de trabajar (desde que aún vendía en la calle).

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Golibjon

texts.en: Golibjon Kudoinazarov is an active client of Microinvest. He is 25 and he is not married. He lives with his parents. His business is cattle breeding and he has been in it for 10 years. He loves his work very much and his parents help him to take care of his animals.  His farm is located in the Ovchikalacha region, Khujand, Tajikistan. Currently he has 4 steers. They have fattened enough for sale and he is going sell them soon. He wants to receive good profit from the holiday trade. From KIVA he is requesting a loan which he plans to spend for reconstruction of his cowshed.

loans.use: Reconctruction of cowshed

loans.name: Olinda Fredesminda

texts.es:
Olinda is 43 years old. She studied only through primary school. She has 5 children; 2 remain dependent on her. She lives in the housing development Palermo in the district of Chao, province of Virú and department (region) of La Libertad in Peru. Olinda used to live in a rural area; she decided to move to the housing development so that her children would be closer to school.

She started her business selling salchipollo (fast food chicken) and noodles during the afternoons. Later she was able to acquire a sales stall in the Buena Vista martket, where she was selling vegetables but the market was not well managed and closed. It was then that she decided to sell out of her house and began to set up a convenience store, the business that she has currently.

Olinda is a member of the group Las Luchadoras. With this group she received her first loan of 300 soles (Peruvian currency) with which she bought noodles, tuna, milk and juice.

With this loan of 500 soles, which she will repay in 4 month, Olinda will buy soft drinks and beer She dreams of having savings in her old age, and of seeing her children grown and successful.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Olinda tiene 43 años de edad, estudió solo primaria. Tiene 5 hijos y 2 aún dependen de ella. Vive en el Poblado Menor Palermo del Distrito de Chao de la Provincia de Virú del Departamento de La Libertad. Anteriormente la señora Olinda vivía en la chacra y decide trasladarse al Poblado Menor Palermo para que sus hijos estén más cerca de la escuela.

Inicia su negocio vendiendo salchipollo y tallarines por las tardes, luego consigue un puesto en el mercado de Buena Vista en el cual vendía verduras pero no hubo buena administración del mercado y terminó cerrando, es en ese momento decide vender en su casa y empieza a implementar una bodega, negocio que tiene actualmente. La señora Olinda es socia del Grupo Mientras Tanto “Las Luchadoras”, en este grupo obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 soles con los cuales compró: fideos, atún, leche y jugos. Con este préstamo de S/.500.00 soles, que cancelará en cuatro meses, comprará gaseosa y cerveza. La señora Olinda sueña con tener ahorros para su vejez y con ver realizados a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of  soft drinks and beer

loans.name: Dayowo

texts.fr:
Born in 1947, Mrs. Dayowo D. is the mother of six (06) children who are still in school. Her main business is the sale of maize, which allows her contribute to the household expenses. Having mastered her trade well, she has found a way to survive, but her funds are still insufficient to expand her business. Thus, being unable to satisfy the demands of the clientele, she is asking for a loan of $350, which will let her maintain a consistent stock of maize. This will allow her to increase her sales and ensure the well-being of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1947, Madame D. Dayowo est mère de six (06) enfants encore en scolarité. Son activité principale est la vente de maïs pour pouvoir contribuer aux charges du ménage. Maîtrisant bien son activité, elle arrive bien à s’en sortir mais son fonds de commerce reste insuffisant pour développer son activité. Ainsi, ne pouvant plus satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un financement de $350 qui va lui servir à faire un stockage consistant de maïs. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour un bien être de sa famille.

loans.use: To stock maize

loans.name: Chinasa

texts.en: Chinasa O. is a 34 year old married woman with 3 children, who lives in Shibiri, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells material & tailoring supplies. She has been in business since 2004 and needs a loan of $875 to enable her to buy more tailoring supplies & material for sales.

loans.use: To buy more material & tailoring supplies for sales

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru:
Hasan M. lives in the city of Yavan. The client is 45 years old. He is married and has 8 children. He finished high school. Hasan is a mechanic by training. But his main business and the source of income for the family is agriculture. Hasan has a plot of land where he plants wheat, linen and other seeds. After receiving crops, he leaves a part for his family and sells the other large part. Hasan has been in this business for 18 years. Now is time to plant, therefore the client needs additional resources to purchase wheat seeds, fertilizer and pay for tractor rent. This is why he would like to receive a loan. This will help Hasan purchase quality seeds and get a quality crop, which will help expand his client base and to sell all crops. He plans to repay the loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer

. Муродов Хасан Гулович житель города Яван. Возраст клиента 45 лет. Женат, имеет 8 детей. Образование средне-техническое. По специальности Механизатор.Но основным видом деятельности и основным источником дохода семьи является земледелие. Имеет дехканское хозяйство, которое засеивает пшеницей , льном и другими злаковыми культурами. После того как он получает урожай , часть его оноставляет своей семье, а остальную, большую часть продает. Занимается этим видом деятельности уже 18 лет. Сейчас самое время посевных , поэтому клиенту необходимы дополнительные средства для того чтобы купить семена пшеницы , удобрения и оплатить аренду трактора.Поэтому он запланировала получить кредит. Это поможет ему закупить качественные семена и получить качественный урожай, что поможет привлечь новых клиентов и без остатка реализовать свою продукцию. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and rent a tractor

loans.name: Atakulov

texts.ru:
A. Atakulov is 43 years old and has 5 children. He works on a farm and simultaneously he owns farm animals at his house (1 cow and 30 goats). His job does not pay him, but it provides food for the whole family. A. receives a good profit from his personal farm animals. He would like to obtain a loan in order to increase the number of his animals.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer

Атакулов Абдусаттор мужчина в возросте 43 года имеет 5 детей. Oн работает в колхозе постухом одновременно у него имеется на дому свой скот ( 1 корова и 30 коз). Ha колхозe ему не плaтят зарплату , но обеспечивают его семью продуктами потания.А скот дает ему хорошую прибыль. Для увеличения скота он обратился в Микроинвест.

loans.use: To purchase more farm animals

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda is 34 years old, ever since starting her family she has been dedicated to the sale of quinua juices, delicious and nutritional nectars that she offers from 5 to 8:30 AM, seeing that the expenses of her family were increasing, she decided to prepare a space in her home to open a small grocery store, thanks to the income that she obtained with her business she is able to cover the expenses of her home and the education of her children. Mrs. Hilda has big plans to better her little store, but she doesn’t have sufficient funds to make that happen, she hopes she will receive your help. Be an important part of the progress of this business and this family.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Hilda de 34 años de edad, desde que formó su familia estuvo dedicada a la venta de jugo de quinua, delicioso y nutritivo néctar que ofrece desde las 5.00 hasta las 8.30 de la mañana, al ver que se fue incrementando sus gastos familiares decidió acondicionar un espacio de vivienda para abrir e implementar su tiendita de abarrotes, gracias a los ingresos que obtiene con este negocio está logrando cubrir los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos.Doña Hilda tiene grandes planes para mejorar su bodeguita, pero no cuenta con suficiente presupuesto para concretarlo, ella espera recibir tu colaboración. Sé parte importante del progreso de este negocio y esta familia.

loans.use: An injection of capital to convert her small grocery store into one of the best.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima Seifu, aged 32, is single with two children, ages 12 and 5. She has been selling food since last year. She works from 6am to 4pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $123.

In the past, Halima has taken out one previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to improve on her business. She requests a new loan to buy more food products for a big sale of food.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of food products.

loans.name: Osman's Group

texts.en:
The following military personnel are requesting a loan of US$ 1,700. They are: Osman M., Patrick T., Mohamed S., Borbor Patrick S. and Mohamed T.. All of these except Mohamed S. want to give their loans to their wives to invest in their current businesses. For Mohamed, he wants to invest his in his academic pursuits.

Osman M. who assumes leadership of this group was born in Kabala but is presently working in Makeni. He is 28, married with 2 children.

loans.use: Give to their wives to invest in their current businesses

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es:
Blanca belongs to the Mujeres Audaces Community Bank located in Jr. Tarapacá # 775 of the Calleria District of the Department of Ucayali. She is 52 years old and is the mother of 6 children. Her husband works in pool installation. Blanca invested her first loan of S/. 300 from Manuela Ramos in jewelry sales. At the present time Blanca is working in agriculture and raising chickens. With this loan of S/ 1,200, which will be paid over 5 months, see will buy chemicals to fumigate her fields and then be able to plant. She will also buy 200 chickens and balanced feed for her chickens.
