Each day is a challenge for Blanca as she is going through difficult times due to the great loss of her beloved son Rudy; but day by day she tries to overcome her pain now that her son has predeceased her. Blanca says that the only thing she has left to do is to continue with life and not be discouraged. She feels very happy because of the opportunity that the Manuela Ramos Movement has allowed her to receive a loan and invest it as her children and one grandchild still depend on her.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Blanca pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Audaces, ubicado en el Jr. Tarapacá # 775, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 52 años y es madre de 6 hijos. Su esposo se dedica a la instalación de piscinas. Blanca con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en venta de joyas. En la actualidad Blanca esta con lo que es agricultura y crianza de pollos. Con este préstamo de S/ 1,200 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará insumos químicos para que fumigue su chacra y seguidamente pueda sembrar; también comprará 200 pollos y alimentos balanceado para sus pollos. Cada día, para Blanca es un reto ya que esta pasando por momentos muy difíciles por la gran perdida de su queridísimo hijo Rudy; Pero ella día a día trata de superar su dolor ya que su hijo se le adelanto a la fecha e parto. Blanca dice que lo único que le queda es seguir con la vida y no desmayar. Ella Se siente muy feliz por la oportunidad que le brinda el Movimiento Manuela Ramos de recibir un préstamo e invertir ya que tiene a sus hijos y un nieto que dependen de ella todavía.

loans.use: To purchase chickens (birds) and balanced feed.  To buy chemical products for pest control.

loans.name: Phoung

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoung S. was born in 1969 and lives in Tumpoar Village in the Kampong Cham Province. Her husband, Mr. Tuy Chen, is a construction worker who can earn three dollars per day which is too small of an income to meet the needs of the family. The couple has two children who are both enrolled in school.

She is a farmer who currently faces a small problem because her field has infertile soil which affects the harvest of her crop. She is requesting a loan to buy more fertilizer to improve her soil and would use the balance of the loan to buy chicken feed. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer to improve the soil for farming and to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia  tiene 45 años, vive con sus 2 hijos.  Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, siempre ha buscado oportunidades para surgir, hace 3 años decide tener un restaurante campestre, luego de varios años de vender comida de manera ambulante y por la gran solicitud de sus clientes, emprendió este negocio, en el cual está surgiendo rápidamente. Debido a su buena sazón sus platos típicos son un éxito, para ella, cocinar es un placer, la dificultad es cuando no se abastece en atender a sus clientes.  Alicia se esfuerza para que sus dos hijos sigan superándose a través del estudio.  Solicita un préstamo para implementar la infraestructura de su restaurante, en el futuro quiere  ofrecer el servicio de hospedaje  para turistas.
texts.en:
Alicia is 45-years-old and lives with her two children. She is a very hard-working person and has always searched for opportunities to get ahead. Three years ago, she decided to open a countryside restaurant. After several years of selling food as a street vendor and many requests from her customers, she started this business, which is growing quickly. Because of the great flavor with which she makes her food, her traditional dishes are a success. For her, cooking is a pleasure. The difficult part is when she doesn't have enough food in stock to attend to her customers. Alicia works hard so her two children can improve themselves through their studies. She is requesting a loan to improve the infrastructure of her restaurant. In the future, she hopes to offer lodging for tourists.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve the infrastructure of her restaurant

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John K. T. is 48 years old. He married and a father of three kids. Currently, the kids are in school. He has been in a furniture and interior decoration business for six years. He is a specialist in dining table and chair sets, beds, stuffed chairs, kitchen decorations, etc. His experience, skills and designs are high class. He designs various kinds of styles that give his customers a new look in their homes, offices, kitchens, etc. He hopes to increase his savings to provide his children with a quality education.

He is a member of the community group called Favor Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access and repay the loan. His picture was taken when he was visited at their group meeting.

loans.use: Purchase  increased supplies of furniture and upholstery materials like linen, threads, thimbles, glue, designer materials etc.

loans.name: Leab

texts.en:
Mr. Leab N. is a 28-year-old who lives in Ang Doung village in Kandal Province. He is the father of a young child. Mr. N. is employed in garment factory. 

His wife, Mrs. Aul Thary, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. She does not have much money to support her field. 

Thus, Mr. Leab N. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds, pesticides, fertilizer, and to hire laborers to work on the field. He hopes to increase the income from the rice so he can support their household.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, pesticides, fertilizer, and to hire laborers to work in the field.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
This is a small group of five members live in Siem Reap Province. Mrs. M. was selected to be the group leader. Mrs. Mom M., age 40, sells fish and vegetables which she transports to customers' homes. She uses a bicycle for her business. Her husband, Mr. Chea Sieng, is a bricklayer who earns around $2.33 a day. They have three children, all of whom are married and live away from home. Her business is going well, with an income of $2 per day. To increase her profits, M. would like to request a loan to purchase a motorcycle to use for her business and family. Mrs. M. is joined with four other members in this group loan; 
Phon N., 30, is widowed. She is a local fish seller who is requesting a loan to build a bathroom.
Nhoem S. aged 28, is a construction worker. He is applying for a loan to purchase chickens and ducks that he will raise.
Piv R., 39, is also a construction worker. He asks for a loan to repair his old house. (R.'s wife appears in the picture because he was not available)
San V., 53 years old, is a widow. She earns a living by selling vegetables. She requests this loan to buy a second-hand motorcycle to transport her vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Beny Group

texts.en:
Manix Lukeba is 38 years old. He is single with a nine year-old boy.  Apart from his son, Manix takes also care of two abandoned boys and a girl between the ages of 5 and 15. All of them attend school. Manix started his first business in 1995 as a money changer. His starting capital was $120 and he worked outdoors until 1999 when his monthly income allowed him to move his business indoors. He worked very hard and his business prospered. In 2001, his business working capital reached $1500. Unfortunately, he lost all of this money when thieves broke into his place of business and stole it.  Due to this traumatic event, Manix closed his business. He and his children went through a hard time as he had neither a job nor any income to support them financially. 

In 2002, Manix borrowed $200 from one of his best customers to re-launch his business. He re-launched it outdoors until August 2008 when he joined one of Hope’s groups named "Beny".  Manix used the first loan he received from Hope last September to diversify his business. He added another type of business selling cellular phones. With the second loan he received from Hope, he reinforced his working capital. Currently, his business capital is equivalent to $700. His business makes about $200 of profit per month. Manix likes this business because it is profitable and it helps him become economically stable, especially concerning food, housing, electricity and water bills and school fees for his children. 

Manix’s business requires honesty and patience to keep his permanent customers. He is glad to join Hope’s group because he hopes to enhance his business with Hope's loans. With the next loan from Hope, Manix is planning to move his business indoors in order to avoid the heavy rains during the rainy season and the strong sun. Manix sells in the most populated area located in the North Eastern area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: To reinforce his working capital

loans.name: Tinuke

texts.en: Tinu is a cheerful and hardworking young woman. She sells cosmetics and drinks, and wishes to expand her business. She dreams of owning a large store in future. Tinu requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics and drinks for her business. Tinu is 34-years old and married. She says thank you to kiva lenders, and she looks forward to working towards her dream.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and drinks to sell

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Hoài năm nay 23 tuổi,  chị đang sống cùng chồng và một con nhỏ  tại thị trấn Gia Lộc tỉnh Hải Dương. Hiện taij chị đang làm hàng mã tại nhà còn anh Thứ chồng chị làm thợ nhôm kính.  Do thiếu vốn  đầu tư mua nguyên liệu phục vụ cho sản xuất hàng mã  nên năm 2008 chị Hoài đã tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương. Đến nay  qua 1 năm  được vay thêm vốn và sử dụng vốn hiệu quả  quả kinh tế gia đình chị đang ngày càng ổn định  hơn với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Với mức vốn 9.000.000đ dự định xin vay trong vòng vốn tới chị sẽ sử dụng để mua tre, giấy ....để phục vụ cho công việc sản xuất hàng mã của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. H. is 23 years old. She lives with her husband and small child at the town of Gia Loc, Hai Duong Province. Currently, she makes funeral accesories (paper replicas of real world items burnt as offerings for the dead), and her husband Thu works as a glass window installer. She joined TYM Fund in 2008 to borrow funds for her funeral accesories business. After a year, with the additional fund and hard work, her family's income has become increasingly stable at 3,000,000 VND per month. She would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to invest in buying bamboo and paper for her funeral paper offerings business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en:
Otgonjargal S. lives with her husband and two young children in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her 5- and 6-year-old children go to a local kindergarten. Her husband is a public bus driver. Otgonjargal and her husband got married in 2002 and lived in their parents' house until 2006.

In 2005, Otgonjargal S. started running a small stall for selling various belts in the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. As her business expanded, she opened another stall in the Hantalst market and an additional stall in the Narantuul market. These stalls also specialize in various belts. She and her husband were also able to build a new house for themselves with their business profit. Recently, she hired a saleswoman because she needed more time to go to China and import more products for her stalls. She has a keen interest in fashion. In the future, she hopes to open her own fashion shop.

Otgonjargal S. requests a loan to purchase more belts for resale, as there is an increasing demand for her products.

loans.use: To buy belts from China for resale

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta G. lives in Culasi, Antique Province. Culasi is a coastal town at the northern end of Antique, and the mainstays of the local economy are fishing and farming. Loreta has two daughters and a son, and is married to Edgar, a laborer. Loreta's son, a high school graduate, is 22 and the the eldest of her children; her two daughters, ages 18 and 15, are still attending high school.

Loreta has a business selling vegetables from a stall in Culasi's main public market. She also raises pigs for additional income. Loreta has been selling vegetables for about 10 years, and says that having the selection of vegetables that customers want is key to doing good business. She plans to use the proceeds of this loan as working capital, and is confident it will give her the flexibility to buy the right inventory at the right time.

Loreta's dream is for her children to be able to attend college. She wants them to be able to find good jobs, in the hopes that her children won't have to face the same challenges and hardships she has encountered in her life.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for resale at public market

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana es socia del Banco Comunal Orquídeas.
Susana es soltera, tiene 37 años y 1 hijo, Susana vende verduras en un puesto del mercado Playa Grau y también vende plásticos en el mismo lugar, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de su hermano.
Susana necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de bolsas y verduras.
Los sueños de Susana son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener un negocio prospero y tener sucursales.
texts.en:
Susana is a member of the “Orquideas” Communal Bank. Susana is single, 37 years old and has 1 son. Susana sells vegetables in a stand in the Playa Grau market and she also sells plastic items in the same place. Her brother helps her with this business. Susana needs a loan for 1800 soles to invest in buying bags and vegetables. Susana dreams that her children will become professionals and of having a prosperous business with multiple locations.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags and vegetables

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo es un noble trabajador dedicado al bienestar de su familia, ya que el progreso de su hogar es su prioridad y en este tiempo logró brindar a sus seres queridos una casa propia donde habitar. Desde que contrajo matrimonio trabaja muy duro para solventar los gastos de su familia, sus múltiples actividades le dieron la posibilidad de ahorrar para comprar un carro, con el que hace 2 años viene trabajando brindando el servicio de taxi. Sin embargo, esta actividad suele ser  arriesgada, por los asaltos, pero Ricardo aprendió a tomar las precauciones necesarias, en especial por las noches, donde es más peligroso, pero también hay mayor demanda de sus servicios. Su deseo para más adelante es adquirir nuevas movilidades para alquilar y administrar sus ganancias, por ello, le resta importancia a las horas de sacrificio que pasa fuera de casa. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y junto a sus compañeros y compañeras trabajan de manera efectiva con el fin de hacer de su banco comunal, uno de los mejores dentro de la institución. Los 700 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de repuestos para su carro, y mandará a hacerle un mantenimiento.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a noble worker dedicated to the well-being of his family, and as the progress of his household is his priority, he worked until he was able to provide his loved ones with a house of their own to live in. Since his marriage, he has been working very hard to pay off his family's household expenses. His multiple jobs provided him with the possibility to save up for a car, with which he has for the past two years been using to provide a taxi service. This work is often at risk of robbery, however, Ricardo learned to take the necessary precautions, especially at night, when it is most dangerous yet his services are also most in demand. His wish for the future is to acquire new means of transportation to rent and to manage, and for his earnings to be enough to make the hours he sacrifices away from his home more worthwhile. This is his first loan with MFP, and together with his partners he has worked very hard, the result being that their communal bank is one of the best available. The 700 soles that he requests will be invested in the purchase of replacement parts for his car and to do maintenance work on it.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de repuestos y mantenimiento de su carro

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Мухаббат –торгует посудой в магазине расположенном в центре города Худжанда.  Она досрочно погасив кредит хочет получить повторно кредит на закуп оптом сервизов и красивой посуды. У неё очень большой выбор посуды и термосов. Постоянно торговля кипит. Мухаббат благодарит всех инвесторов организации за финансирование и поддержку.
texts.en:
Muhabbat sells dishware at a store located in the city center of Khujand. She repaid her previous loan ahead of time and wants to obtain another loan in order to purchase dinnerware sets and decorative dishes wholesale. She has a wide variety of dinnerware and thermoses. Her business is always busy. Muhabbat is grateful to all the investors for the financing and support. MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”. “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of dinnerware sets

loans.name: Vaoiva

texts.en:
Vaoiva M., 50, is married with eight children. She has many years of experience in the chicken farm business. She sells to the public and villagers during every day of the week.

Vaoiva has requested a loan in order to buy tools, such as materials to build fences for the housing of her chickens. This will be her first loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about $145).

SPBD loans are Vaoiva’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She is very happy to obtain this loan and hopes to become a long-term participant in the program. She appreciates their much-needed help.

loans.use: To buy tools such as materials to build fences for the housing of her chickens

loans.name: Hiroson

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 





Зарипова Хиросон женщина 1965-го года рождения, замужем, мать 4-х детей, образование среднее. Торгует на рынке около 3-х лет. Она занимается продажей мужскими одеждами на рынке «Корвон». Хиросон просит кредит для закупки новой партии летних мужских брюк. Она хочет получить займ в сумме 4000 сроком на 8 месяцев и благодарит кредиторов за поддержку.
texts.en:
Born in 1965, Hiroson Z. is married and is a mother of 4 children. She has secondary education. Hiroson has been selling at a market for almost 3 years. She sells men's clothing at the Korvon market. Hiroson is requesting a loan for the purchase of a new stock of men's summer trousers. She wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 4000 somoni and is grateful to creditors for the support.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of men's trousers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new inventory such as cell phone accessories and spare parts

loans.name: Husna

texts.en:
Husna is a member of the Imara borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 45 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 4 children.Her children are aged 30,25,20, and 15 years.

Husna started her own cafe business selling food 5 hours ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 600,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Husna`s first Loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more sugar,rice cooking oil etc.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Husna hopes to save more,get more food for family,pay school fees money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice,sugar,wheat,salts for food

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Matilda is forty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, a son and two daughters, who are all in school. She works very hard to support her husband and to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. 

Monica sells smoked fish. She supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. She buys her goods in the north at moderate prices. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita A. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 68 years old, married and has nine grown children. Rosita has owned and operated a business selling vegetables and breads, among other things, for over five years. This is her main source of income and brings in approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rosita joined HSPFI to access their financial services, which would in turn help to improve her living situation and her business skills. Rosita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to to expand her product inventory. This will be Rosita's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to reinvest profits to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand product inventory.

loans.name: Hakim

texts.ru: Курбонов Хаким проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 36 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Хаким имеет среднее образование. Он вот как 16 лет занимается торговлей лепешек, которые сам печет в своей хлебопекарни. Ему в этом также помогает его семья. Кредит просит для закупа сырья и увеличения товараоборота.

loans.use: Закуп сырья

loans.name: Baba Jan

texts.en:
Baba jan is the son of S. N.. He lives in district 16th of Kabul Afghanistan. He is about 38 years old and married with four children. He has two daughters and two sons and all of them are school students. 

Baba jan has a general store where he sells different kinds of materials. He would like to take an individual loan of 30,000 Afghani to purchase things that are not available in his shop. He hopes that with this loan he will progress a lot and will attract lots of clients to his shop.

He is grateful to all the Kiva lenders for supporting the entrepreneurs around the world and making them start and sustain new businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more items for his shop

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
With her desire to expand her store, Elvira T. decided to request a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to 10,000 PHP for her to purchase commodities to sell in her store. She knows that through this loan, her income will increase because she can meet the demands of her customers, thus she is really hoping that lenders will approve her loan.

Elvira is 48 years old and married. She and her husband live in the village of Calamagui San Pablo Cagayan, where farming is the major source of income among the residents. The couple are blessed with three children who are studying in a local school in Tuguegarao City. Her husband, Rafael,  is 47years old and works as a farmer and driver. Whenever he is not busy at their farm, he is driving a passenger motorcycle to earn extra income. Elvira also manages a hog raising business. She shared that usually their children help them in cleaning the pig pens, especially during weekends.

loans.use: To purchase items for resale

loans.name: Teresa Reina

texts.es: Teresa Reina R. D. P. D. 38 años D. edad, resiD. en La Libertad junto a su esposo y su hijo. Ella elabora y comercializa tortillas en el patio D. su casa en donD. las personas llegan a comprar su producto. Teresa solicita un préstamo, ya que desea mejorar su negocio, comprando más maíz, el cual es la materia prima D. las tortillas, así mismo desea comprar una plancha (nombre que se le da a las cocinas que se utilizan para cocinar las tortillas), la cual cuente con la capacidad para cocinar mayor cantidad D. tortillas. A través D. este negocio es como Teresa pueD. ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos familiares, es por ello que considera D. mucha importancia mejorar las condiciones D. este.
texts.en:
Teresa Reina R. D. P. is 38 years old and lives in La Libertad with her husband and son. She makes and sells tortillas from the front of her house where people come to buy them. She would like a loan because she wants to improve her business by purchasing more corn which the main ingredient in tortillas. She would also like to buy a griddle on which the tortillas are maD.. With a griddle she'll be able to make a larger amount. It is because of this business that Teresa can help her husband with the family expenses making a big difference in their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kitchen materials

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
This is Nana K., a small-scale businesswoman in Makeni city, in the north of Sierra Leone. Nana sells a wide variety of things – shoes, laces, cottons, dishes, sprays, plastic water, drinks, cigarettes, biscuits, soap, etc.  Nana has been doing business for six years now. 

Business had been growing at a very slow pace for Nana until ten months ago when she had her first SMT/Kiva loan. With the help of that loan, Nana experienced a vast improvement in her business and personal life. Having repaid her previous loan successfully, she is again requesting a loan in order to further strengthen her business. She will use SLL 3,000,000 from this loan to invest in clothes and SLL 1,000,000 to invest in other items like biscuits, cigarettes, soap, drinks, and so on.

loans.use: invest in clothes and other items like biscuits, cigarettes, etc.

loans.name: Costeñitas Ii Group

texts.es:
Venta de verduras, elaboración de masitas (repostería), atención de tienda de barrio,  venta de cosméticos, venta de golosinas, venta de comida, producción de muebles, venta de ropa para niño son los diferentes negocios de las integrantes del grupo Costeñitas II, que a su vez realizan sus reuniones en el Centro Focal Exaltación, una de las integrantes es Miriam Villa una joven de 22 años ella vende ropa para bebe y va ofreciendo a diferentes personas, ferias, domicilios, es decir es ambulante.
Todas están esperanzadas en fortalecer y hacer crecer sus negocios y necesitan préstamo para comprar mercadería en los casos de negocios de comercialización, materia prima las que se dedican a la producción.
texts.en:
Sales of vegetables, pastry-making, general store, cosmetics sales, candy sales, food sales, furniture making, children's clothing sales are the different types of business of the members of the Costeñitas II group. The group holds its meetings in the Centro Focal Exaltación.

One of the members is Miriam, a 22 year old who sells baby clothing. She offers her products to people in markets and homes, she is a travelling salesperson.

They are all hopeful to streghten and increase their business. They need the loan to buy inventory, in the case of the commercial businesses and raw materials, in the case of production businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory and raw materials

loans.name: Srey Mao's Group

texts.en: Nineteen people, all living in Damnak Sangkae Village in Kandal Province, make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Srey Mao S. was selected as village bank president by the group members, who will all use the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she grows rice for a living and her husband, Mr. PhearU. Phoem, owns one truck for transporting soil to resell. This family faces a problem: because their truck’s wheels are too old to work, they need to exchange them for new ones. Thus, Mrs. Srey Mao S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase two new truck wheels. This couple has three children. The oldest one is a staff member in a casino club while the other two are attending a local public school.

loans.use: To purchase two new truck wheels.

loans.name: Marvin

texts.en: Marvin E., 22 years old, is engaged in a fish selling business. He is a young fisherman from Talibon, Bohol and he works every day to catch fish to help his family have an adequate supply of food, clothing and other basic needs. He desires to have a bigger income in the family. He would like to apply for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy fishing materials.

loans.use: Buy fishing materials

loans.name: Odille

texts.en:
Odille is 32 years old, is married, and takes care of two dependents. She lives in Gasabo where she owns a business selling women’s clothes and this is her eighth successful year in this business. The hours of her business are from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day.

Odille is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing some other attractive clothing styles for sale as well as additional sizes and colors. With this loan, she hopes to attract more customers to her shop and hopefully earn more profits in the process.

This, in turn will allow Odille and her devoted husband to reinvest in some other sources of income as well as creating more jobs for the people in her community.

loans.use: To buy addttional styles of clothes to sell

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en:
A married man with three children, Fidel has to earn to provide for his family’s needs.

Fidel struggled during his first years of farming but he didn’t give in despite the challenges he faced. He worked hard and now earns from his rice farm.

Fidel was seeking financial support for his business and was introduced to CEVI by his fellow farmers. He is requesting to loan Php 6,000. This loan will be used for fertilizer and other farm inputs he needs for his rice farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia G. has already requested a loan twice from Kiva through her membership of Kiva partner, ASHI. These loans have been of great benefit in growing and increasing the volume of fish she buys and resells at the town’s public market. Now, Cecilia intends to buy a motor fishing boat for her husband to manage since he has to borrow a fishing boat from their neighbor when he wants to go fishing.
Cecilia really hopes that her business growth continues. She wants to be able to increase her profits so that she can support the needs of her two children, especially her youngest who is still just a high school graduate. Once her business becomes profitable and sustainable, she feels she will have no need to worry about him anymore. Aside from her dreams for her business, Cecilia wants to use her business profits to complete the renovation of their house to make it a comfortable home and provide her family with a different kind of life.

loans.use: To purchase a motor fishing boat

loans.name: Rodis Maribel

texts.es:
Rodis es una madre de familia de 33 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos menores de edad en la unidad vecinal Ernesto Vilchez, una zona urbano marginal de la ciudad de Ferreñafe, conocida en el norte del país por los platos típicos, se ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año tiene instalada en su vivienda una pequeña bodega en la que ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite), abarrotes, verduras y utiles escolares. Este negocio es de mucha ayuda para la economía familiar, junto a su esposo se esfuerzan por salir adelante, el se dedica a la venta ambulante de CD's en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Su negocio goza de buena acogida debido a que ella brinda buen trato a sus clientes y trata siempre de brindarles productos de buena calidad. La demanda por los productos que ofrece en su bodega ha crecido y Rodis siente que ha llegando el momento de ampliarlo, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Rodis es una persona bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una persona responsable y de confianza. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de seguir estudiando para que tengan un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
Rodis is 33 years old and the mother of a family, who lives with her husband and her 2 minor children in the Ernesto Vilchez neighborhood, a marginal urban zone in Ferreñafe. This city is known in the north for it typical dishes. It is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Since a year ago she has operated a small grocery store from her house, offering her customers all types of products of primary necessity (rice, sugar, oil), and groceries, vegetables, and school supplies. The business is a big help for the family economy. She and her husband, who sells CDs on the streets of Chiclayo, struggle to get ahead. Her business is well received because she treats her customers well and always attempts to offer quality products. Demand for the things she offers in her store has risen and Rodis feels that the moment has come to expand. That's why she is requesting a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 New Sols, which she wants to invest in purchasing more groceries and products of prime necessity that will aid her in reaching her objective. Rodis is a very hard working person who is dedicated to her family. Her neighbors and acquaintances consider her responsible and trustworthy. Her greatest wish is to offer her children the opportunity to continue their studies in order to assure a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING PRIME PRODUCTS AND GROCERIES TO EXPAND HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Massajja B Nabaale Mariam Group

texts.en: N. Mariam is 27 years old, married, and has three children in school. She is a businesswoman who has been selling children's clothes for one year. She is using her loan to purchase stock to sell to her customers. Mariam wants to improve her business, and her dream is to work very hard for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: To purchase clothing stock

loans.name: C2147 Abisunganye Group

texts.en:
Regine is 39 years old, married with five children aged between 12 and 20. Regine’s husband is a businessman and they both work hard for their family. Regine is the leader of group which is called ABISUNGANYE in the local language.  Regine has an experience of four years in her business of selling clothes.

Regine and her group are requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses through purchasing more products. Regine particularly wants to purchase various styles of clothing which will help her to attract more customers. If this goal is reached, Regine will be able to earn more profit which will be reinvested into her business. With extra income Regine expects to save money as well as paying school fees for her children.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina pertenece al banco comunal “La Unión de Ollantaytambo” de la Asociación. El banco comunal tiene 5 ciclos de funcionamiento, la socia manifiesta, que se encuentra contenta y satisfecha con los servicios de crédito, ahorro, capacitación y por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal.

Dina, tiene 30 años, tiene dos hijas y vive en Ollantaytambo. Actualmente, Sus actividades principales económicas es vender jugos en el mercado Virgen Asunta de Ollantaytambo y vender comestibles en su tienda de abarrotes. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica al negocio y le va excelente. 

Dina es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario salir adelante, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo azúcar, fideos, aceite y leche. El anhelo de la socia es ampliar su negocio.    

Dina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Dina belongs to the community bank "The Ollantaytambo Union" of the Arariwa Association. This community bank has functioned for five cycles, and this member declates that she has been happy and satisfied with the credit, savings, and training services for the time that she has been a member of the bank. Dina is 30 years old. She has two daughters and lives in Ollantaytambo. Now her principal business activity is selling juice in the Virgen Asunta market in Ollantaytambo and selling food in her grocery store. She has been in this business for four years and it is going very well for her. Dina is a hard-working and entrepreneurial person who always looks for opportunities to advance herself through her daily efforts. She needs the loan to buy merchandise such as sugar, pasta, oil, and milk. Her goal is to expand her business. Dina is thankful for the opportunity offered by the loan and thus she promises to make all the payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise such as sugar, pasta, oil, and milk

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta C., married to Ireneo Coliseo and blessed with a child, makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store for quite some time now.

Marieta has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her variety store.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 14,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying groceries needed to replenish and maintain the quantity of stock in her current product inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can renovate her house with her profits.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert has been operating his vehicle repair and hardware shop for the past year. He is married with five children who all attend school. With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase new pedals, motorcycle tyres, rings and bicycle spokes for his shop. Gilbert’s other source of income is from his motorbike (boda boda) hire business. 


The major challenge in his business is seasonality. He hopes to expand his business by adding more stock to his hardware shop. Gilbert joined Yehu to get a loan to develop financially and improve his standard of living.


Gilbert owns a home with no electricity and no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his hardware store.

loans.name: Vilma Leonor

texts.es: la sra. Vilma se dedica a la Elaboracion y venta de Tortillas, le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que asi puede obtener ingresos con los que sostiene a su familia, ella es Madre soltera, cuenta con dos hijos que estan estudiando, desde muy temprano comienza con la elaboracion de las tortillas, ya que tiene clientes en varias colonias y tiene que salir a repartir su producto, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maseca, leña y carne, ya que por las noches se dedica a vender comida, su metas es llegar a graduar sus hijos y poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Vilma works making and selling tortillas. She enjoys her work because it provides her with an income that she can use to support her family. Vilma is a single mother with two children who are in school. She begins making the tortillas early in the morning, because she has customers in various parts of the city and she has to leave to deliver her products. Vilma will use this loan to buy corn flour, firewood and meat, because she also works selling food in the evenings. Her goal is to have both her children graduate from school and to be able to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn flour, water, lime, firewood, matches and meat

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old single man living with his family in Lebanon. In 2007 he opened a car spare parts shop as his own business. His father takes care of the family expenses but the borrower is trying to help him with his business income as the majority of Lebanese children do.  

Despite his young age, he was able during this short period in the field to build up a good business reputation and he is thankful for his decision. He is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy more spare parts and enlarge his shop to meet the requirements of his customers and make a good income for his family. He plans to open a bigger store to sell spare parts and  one day, he would like to  open a commercial center.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:

Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: buy more spare parts

loans.name: Meidel Pastora

texts.es: La Señora Meidel Pastora. Tiene 24 años, es casada y tiene 1 hijo de 4 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de leña, mariscos y otros, labora todos los días de la semana y lleva en esta actividad hace 4 años, lo inicio cuando estaba embarazada y no tenía un medio de ingreso para mantener a su familia, por lo que recorría lugares muy lejanos. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más mercadería como leña, mariscos entre otros pues siempre le ha gustado luchar y trabajar. Su meta es mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Meidel Pastora is 24 years old, is married and has a 4 year old son. She sells firewood, seafood and other items. Meidel works everyday and has done so for 4 years, she began when she was pregnant and did not have a source of income to sustain her family and had to go to far-off places to work. The loan will be used to invest to buy more merchandize like firewood, seafood among other items since she has always enjoyed working hard. Her goal is to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita M. is from the village of Sto. Domingo, Alicia, Isabela. She is 56 years old and married with six adult children. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing specialty tailoring services to local community members. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lolita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI which she used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to again purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lolita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her immediate family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline M. and her husband, Noel, have always dreamed of having a stable business to improve their meager income. The couple has four children – the eldest is thirteen years of age and the youngest and only daughter is two years old. The family depends on Noel's income from driving a tricycle (a motorcycle with attached sidecar for passengers) to meet their daily financial needs.
Life has been difficult for the couple but they did not lose hope that someday an opportunity would come their way. In 2008, Evangeline heard of an organization promoting a program that gives opportunity to poor women like her. Inspired by a desire to help and support her husband, Evangeline joined the organization – Kiva partner, Ahon sa Hirap, Inc., in the Philippines – to have access to capital to buy a motorcycle for her husband. Gladly, after almost three years they owned the tricycle and Noel's income increased. Today, Evangeline is applying for a loan of 25,000 PHP to use as starting capital to set up a store, which she will manage, selling motorcycle parts. She is so excited to start this business because she believes that this is the instrument for fulfilling their dreams for their children. The family is so happy that there are people and institutions that give chances to families who are full of hopes and dreams.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle parts for resale

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Hem S., 52, is a widower and resides with his child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. is a police officer, earning an income of about USD 4 per day. His child is an air-conditioner repairman, earning an income of USD 4.3 per day to help cover the family's expenses. The family has to spend USD 40 on food and USD 6 on electricity supply every month.  

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike to for his son to commute to work. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La  señora Carmen A. es casada y vive en la compañía Tacuati D. la ciudad D. atyra.

La  señora Carmen es comerciante, se dedica a la fabricación y venta D. termos forrados en cuero y cuerinas.

Al inicio D. su actividad ellos solo Fabricaban  zapatillas D. cuero y el problema era que durante el verano tenían mucho trabajo, pero en invierno no trabajaban,  porque  no había ventas.
 Luego viendo varias alternativas D. trabajos con varias personas que se dedicaban  a esta actividad, lanzaron un nuevo producto al  mercado que fueron los termos forrados en cuero que fue muy bien aceptado por  el público.

Actualmente tiene 4 personas trabajando en su local y cada día tienen más pedidos y en verano preparan termos para agua fría y en invierno termos para agua caliente.

Doña Carmen agradece por el credito, a la Fundación Paraguaya  ya que para ella es un apoyo en su actividad y mediante ello, podrá satisfacer los pedidos para las  fiestas que se avecinan, brindando un producto D. buena calidad a la comunidad y a la vez aumentando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Carmen A. is married and lives in Tacuati in the city of Atyra. She is a vendor, dedicated to making and selling thermoses lined in leather and leatherette.

When she started this activity, they only maD. leather slippers and the problem was that in the summer, they had a lot of work, but in the winter they had not work because they didn't have sales. Then, seeing various alternatives for work with multiple people dedicated to this work, they launched a new product in the market that was the thermos lined in leather that was well accepted by the public.

Currently, she has four people working in her shop and every day they have more orders and in the summer they create thermoses for cold water and in the winter thermoses for hot water.

Carmen is thankful to Fundación  Paraguaya for the loan since, for her, it is support for her work and, through it, she will be able to satisfy the orders for the festivities that are approaching providing a good quality product to the community and at the same time increasing her income.

loans.use: Acquire materials to make artisanal thermoses such as: thermoses, leather, thread, paint, decorative accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Athanas Waweru

texts.en:
Athanas is 65 years and married to Rachael. They have two children.  He has been in this business for about six years, earning a monthly profit of about Kshs. 10,000. Some of the items he sells include torches, manila ropes, radios and others.

He wants to use the money to buy more stock of new items like plastic basins, buckets and jerry cans to sell. This is his fourth loan with KADET LTD. He hopes to live a good life with his wife and to see his grandchildren prosper in life.

loans.use: To buy plastic basins, buckets and jerry cans to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.es:
la señora Emperatriz M. C. es soltera y no tiene dependientes, sus hijos ya estan grandes., vive en la aldea el Caimito, tiene casa propia y un negocio de venta de ropa y calzado en el mercado nuevo de san lorenzo, todos lo dias viaja para abrir su negocio, ofrece ropa, calzado, gorras, fajas, lentes, y mucho mas.
 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa a la moda, tiene varios pedidos y desea tener surtido su negocio.
 
su sueño es que su negocio crezca mucho mas y tener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Emperatriz M. C. is single and doesn't have any dependents as her children are already grown up.  She lives in the village of Caimito.  She has her own home and a business selling clothes and footwear in the 'Mercado Nuevo' (New Market) in San Lorenzo.  She travels there every day to open her business where she sells clothes, footwear, caps, belts, sunglasses and a lot more besides.
 
Emperatriz will use her loan to buy fashionable clothes.  She has several orders and would like to have her business well stocked.  Her dream is for her business to grow a lot and to make good profits.

loans.use: To buy jeans, shirts, t-shirts, sunglasses, caps, backpacks, sandals and ladies' shoes

loans.name: Gerard

texts.en:
Gerard is 37 years old and is married with three children. Gerard has been in the business of selling meat for about two years, and his business is open from 6 am to 8 pm every day.

Gerard has requested a loan to increase his working capital, purchase more meat to sell and offer better service to his customers. He plans to use his profits to build a house.

loans.use: To increase his working capital and purchase more produce to sell

loans.name: El Zapote Group

texts.es:
el grupo El Zapote esta ubicado en la Aldea El Zapote, de ahi se deriva el nombre del grupo, lo integran 4 mujeres, las cuales se caracterizan por ser muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

doña  Maricela de Jesus G. se dedica a la venta de carteras y mochilas en varios lugares  cercanos a su comunidad, es madre de 4 hijos de los cuales tiene una hija de 18 dias de nacida.
juntos con su esposo trabajan duro para sacar adelante la familia, sus tiempos libres visitan la iglesia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de carteras y mochilas.
 
doña Ana V. es una mujer trabajadora y muy dedicada a su negocio y a su familia, Ana se dedica a a venta de gallinas, actividad que realiza desde hace varios años, todos los dias se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para  alimentarlas y sacarles los huevos.
junto con su su esposo trabajan duro para salir adelante con su familia, ademas cuentan con la ayuda de sus  hijos, los cuales ya estan adultos y les ayudan con los gastos de la casa. sus tiempos libres lo dedican a la iglesia.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas gallinas y concentrado.
 
doña Felipa L. se dedica tambien a la venta y cria de gallinas, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos.
su tiempo libre lo dedica a visitar la iglesia y cuidar de sus hijos.

doña Gloria O. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pequeña pulperia desde hace 8 años la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitacion.
Gloria es madre de 3 hijos los cuales y los tiene estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad. 
ademas cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo y trabajan duro para sacar adelante su pequeña familia,  sus tiempos libres lo dedican a visitar a sus familiares.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su pulperia.
texts.en:
The El Zapote group is located in La Aldea El Zapote, which is where the group name comes from. The group is made up of 4 women, who are very hard-working. The following is a description of their different businesses:

Maricela de Jesus G. sells wallets and backpacks in various areas near to her community. She is a mother of 4 children, one of whom is a daughter born just 18 days ago.
She and her husband work hard to get their family ahead. In their free time, they go to church.
She will use this loan for the purchase of wallets and backpacks.

Ana V. is a hard-working woman who is very dedicated to her business and her family. Ana has sold hens for several years. She gets up every day at 5:00 am to feed them and collect the eggs.
She and her husband work hard to get their family ahead. Their children, who are adults, help them with the household costs. They dedicate their free time to their church.
She will use this loan to purchase more hens and concentrated food.

Felipa L. also sells and raises hens. She is a single mother and has 4 children. 
She dedicates her free time to visiting her church and taking care of her children.

Gloria O. sells consumer products. She has had a small grocery store in her home for 8 years.
She is a mother of three children who are attending the community school.
Her husband helps her and they work hard to get their little family ahead. They dedicate their free time to visiting family.
She will use this loan for the purchase of merchandise to stock her store.

loans.use: the purchase of wallets, backpacks, hens, beans, milk, rice, sugar, bread, cereal, butter, oil, salt, toilet paper, concentrated food for hens, batteries, matches, candles.

loans.name: Rosa Consuelo

texts.es:
Rosa Consuelo, nacio en el Dpto. de la Libertad, tiene 28 años de edad, soltera, vive en la Zona de los Ángeles de Naranjal, distrito de Carabayllo. 
Hace dos años trabaja como Profesora de Educación Inicial,en el Colegio I.E.P “Horacio Patiño Crusatti” en el distrito de Surco. 
Desde muy joven ha sido trabajadora, ayudando a su padres en los gastos del hogar.
Una de sus metas a lograr es tener su doctorado.
Con el préstamo solicitado desea pagar el grado de Bachiller, la inscripción para su Maestría en la Universidad Cesar Vallejo y mensualidades.
texts.en:
Rosa Consuelo was born in La Libertad department.  She is 28 years old, single and lives in the Ángeles de Naranjal zone, Carabayllo district.

For the last two years she has worked as an Elementary School Teacher at the “Horacio Patiño Crusatti” School in Surco district.

She has worked since she was very young helping her parents meet household expenses.

One of the goals is to get a Doctorate.

With the requested loan she wants to pay for her Bachelor’s Degree, her enrollment fee for her Master’s Degree at Cesar Vallejo University and monthly tuition.

loans.use: To pay for various educational expenses.

loans.name: Hatun Warmi ("gran Mujer") Group

texts.es:
Yessica Q. Z., 35 años de edad, casada, con 02 niños de 4 y 8 años respectivamente. Yessica es la presidenta de la alcancìa comunal " Hatun Warmi", que significa "Gran Mujer"; este grupo comunal pertenece a la localidad de Cajas Chico en la cuidad de Huancayo.
Yessica lleva 08 años en el negocio de venta de artefactos para el hogar, y trabaja en conjunto con su esposo Ademir, quien es tècnico; apoyàndose mutuamente hicieron crecer el negocio para que puedan tener mayor ingresos; ella vendiendo los artefactos y su esposo en el àrea de reparaciòn de los mismo como tècnico electricista que es de profesiòn.
Yessica tiene a su cargo a sus pequeños hijos, Naomi de 08 años y Jeff de 04 años; ellos se han convertido en el impulso para seguir esforzàndose, pues desea darles un futuro mejor al que ella tuvo.
El prèstamo serà para ampliar el local y comprar otros electrodomèsticos para aumentar las ventas.
(En la fotografìa, Yessica esta vestida de jeans color azul claro, y un chaleco de color verde con beige; y es la segunda de la izquierda)
texts.en:
Yessica Q. Z. is 35 years old, married, and has two children, ages 4 and 8.  Yessica is the president of the "Hatun Warmi" communal bank which means "Great Woman".  This group is located in the Cajas Chico area in the city of Huancayo.

Yessica has been selling household appliances for 8 years.  She works with her husband Ademir who is a technician.  Together they have been able to grow their business and obtain a higher income.  She sells the appliances and her husband takes care of repair services since he is an electrician by profession.

Yessica cares for her small children, Naomi, 8 and Jeff, 4.  They are the reason she continues to work hard so she can provide a better future for them than the one she had.

She plans to use the loan to expand her shop and buy more appliances, thereby increasing sales.  (In the photo, Yessica is the one in light blue jeans and a green and beige sweater, second from the left.)

loans.use: To buy household appliances

loans.name: Pilista

texts.en: K. is currently in business selling charcoal. She is 47 years old, a widow with seven children and five of them go to school. K. borrowed a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. She hopes to build a house with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Placida

texts.es:
Placida tiene 39 años y nació en la comunidad de Yanahuara provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Actualmente, Placida vive en la comunidad donde ella nació, ella es padre y madre para sus tres hijos pues su esposo los abandono pero Placida es una mujer luchadora, trabajadora  que a pesar de las adversidad saca adelante a su familia, ella nos cuenta que en la comunidad en que vive la gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería y pero ella se dedica a la venta de chicha, cerveza y comida pues tiene un pequeña restaurante que esta mas o menos implementado con sillas y mesas, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el micro crédito para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar insumos para preparar mas platos de comida. 

Placida pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Marcela de Virgen del Carmen” de la Asociación Arariwa  y trabaja con sus compañeras del banco comunal desde hace varias años.
texts.en:
Placida is 39 years old and was born in Yanahuara community, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.  Placida currently lives in the community in which she was born.  She is both father and mother to her three children as her husband abandoned them.  However, Placida is a fighter and a hard worker who, in spite of adversity, manages to get her family ahead in life.  She tells us that in her community people farm and raise livestock but her business is selling 'chicha' (a traditional, corn-based drink), beer and meals.  Placida has a small restaurant set up with tables and chairs.  On this occasion, she requires a loan to increase her working capital.  She would like to buy supplies for preparing more meals.

Placida is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Villa Marcela de Virgen del Carmen" community bank and she has been working with her fellow bank members for several years.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing more meals

loans.name: Nem

texts.en:
Nem H. is a 22-year-old married father who makes a living by selling firewood in the province of Kompong Tom. He doesn’t have a life partner because he got divorced from his wife years ago. 

Nem H. currently lives with his sister who is feeding some pigs in her pigpen for a profit. There are two children who need him to take care of them because they are so young; one of them is studying in the local school. 

Nem H. will use his loan to buy additional pigs for breeding purposes. This could make his family extra income, and he will sell them off when the pigs are big enough. In the future, he wants to expand his business and construct a new house.

loans.use: To buy additional pigs for breeding purposes.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen L., 39, resident of San Isidro Labarador 1, Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Macario L., a vendor, and is the mother of four children, two of whom are already working, while the others are still in school. By the grace of God, Helen has managed to support her older child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send the rest of her children all the way through college--a dream for most Filipino parents like Helen, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Helen operates a fish stall. Fish is bought fresh from nearby ports and piers, packed in ice and then brought to the local markets. Helen and her husband clean, gut and chop fish per customer orders. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 350 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 16,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fish for their everyday inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Helen dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes that her family can migrate and work in other countries in the near future. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more fish fresh from ports and piers.

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en:
Melodia is 46 years old and is married with 1 child.

Melodia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock for her general store.

Melodia has already borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from frozen foods.

Melodia aspires to save enough money so that she can expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Alma Marisol

texts.es:
Alma, se dedica a la venta D. ropa y cosméticos, tiene tres hijos D. 4, 11 y 15 años D. edad, ella inicio este negocio desD. hace 4 años, por iniciativa propia, trabaja todos los días D. 6:00am a 5:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. ropa y cosméticos, para la venta como por ejemplo, blusas, pantalones, camisas formales, en cosméticos maquillajes, labiales, cremas, este préstamo le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio y generar mayores ingresos que le servirán para tener una mejor solvencia.
Su objetivo es ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios, ya que desea verlos formados académicamente para que puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Alma works selling clothing and cosmetics.  She has three children who are 15, 11, and 4 years old.  She started her business four years ago from her own initiative.  She works every day from 6:00am until 5:00pm.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase clothing and cosmetics to sell, for example: shirts, pants, formal shirts, makeup, lipstick, and creams.  This loan will help strengthen her business and generate more income that will allow her to have better solvency.

Her objective is to help her children with their studies, since she wants to see them finish school so they can succeed.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like shirts, pants, formal shirts, makeup, lipstick, and creams.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Oscar Martin

texts.es:
Oscar tiene  47 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa e hijos menores. Esta casa está ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de  Lambayeque, es una comunidad pequeña en vías de desarrollo y con gente emprendedora.

Oscar se dedica a prestar sus servicios de chofer de transporte público, en un vehículo que alquila diariamente desde hace más de 15 años. Esta actividad le ha permitido a Oscar darle alimento y educación a sus hijos y a pesar de las adversidades él se siente confiado de que su realidad algún día cambiará.

Oscar solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles que utilizará para  hacer arreglos dentro de su hogar  y así poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Él estaría sumamente agradecido si se le concede el préstamo, pues estos arreglos le son necesarios.

Oscar es un cliente recurrente para nuestra entidad y todos sus créditos los ha cancelado adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Oscar is 47 years old and lives in his own home together with his wife and dependent children.  His home is located in the rural area of Lambayeque district.  He lives in a small, developing community whose people are entrepreneurial.

Oscar provides a public transport service in a vehicle that he hires every day.  He has been doing this for more than 15 years.  This business activity has allowed Oscar to provide his children with food and an education.  In spite of the difficulties, he feels confident that one day his situation will change.

Oscar is requesting a loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which he will use to make some repairs to his home so that he can provide his family with a better quality of life.  He would be extremely grateful to receive the loan as these repairs are much needed.

Oscar is a long-standing client of our institution and he has repaid all his previous loans properly.

loans.use: to make some repairs to his home

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, 62, is a widow with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Teresita has a sari sari (general store) business in the Philippines. Teresita has been in this business for 15 years.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items like biscuits, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari sari store.

 Teresita would like to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like biscuits, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari sari store.

loans.name: Saint Luc Group

texts.fr:
Mme Aminata Pascaline est la représentante du groupe SAINT LUC. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans et le moins âgé a 1an 02 vont a l’école et elle a 4 personnes en charge.

Elle est tisseuse depuis 04ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de pissy.ses clients sont les hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter un demi-ball de fils de tisse.

Mme économise ses bénéfices et met une partie dans les charges familiales. Elle ambitionne devenir une grande vendeuse de fils de tisse et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata Pascaline is the representative for the Saint Luc group. She married and the mother of 4 children, ranging in age from 11 to 1. 2 of her children go to school and she is responsible for 4 people. 

She has been a weaver for 4 years. She obtains her supplies at the Pissy market, and her customers are men. 

Aminata Pascaline wants to buy a half-bale of thread for weaving. She saves her profits and uses some for household expenses. Her goal is sell a large quantity of thread for weaving and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy a half-bale of thread for weaving

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, from Madab, Jordan, is a 51 year-old married woman and a mother of three children.  Ten years ago, Sarah started her business from home, and then expanded it to a licensed store.  Sarah has a grocery shop and requesting a loan 600 JD to purchase products for the store.

Sarah is looking to expand her business in order to add a refrigerator for the frozen food.  She also hopes to help her daughter to continue her studies at university.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is married with one child. She is 41 and lives in Ozamis City. 

Cynthia sells spare parts, specifically chainsaw parts, and has had this business for 14 years. Each month, she earns 5000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase more spare parts for chainsaws. 

Cynthia has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for chainsaws

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita lives in the province of Isabela. She is 36 years old, married, and has three grown-up children.  Benita sells different products, such as bread, soap, shampoo, and spices that she can offer to the people of the community. 

Benita started her business when she was 20 years old and had the help of her mother, who was in the same line of work and managed a store. As time passed, Benita became independent from her mother and opened her own store. Today she sells a variety of products throughout the entire village. Her husband helps to support her with whatever he earns from his job. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP10,000 to buy drinks, soap, candies and vinegar.  With this investment, she hopes to increase her sales and offer a wider variety of products. Her future plans include opening a general store at the market.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, drinks, bread and spices for her store

loans.name: Saha

texts.en:
Saha is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, he has operated a business selling charcoal from his home to his neighbours and passers-by. His major challenge is the high cost of transportation in his business. Saha dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan, he wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for resale.

loans.name: Orbelina Esperanza

texts.es: Orbelina Esperanza de veintisiete años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos en casa propia. Ella vende productos enchapado o con recubrimiento de oro, como cadenas o pulseras y también vende productos de belleza por catalogo; se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente pues todo lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y claro lo vende a un buen precio, además Orbelina siempre está a la expectativa de los clientes y les ofrece el servicio que se merecen; es una mujer emprendedora siempre dispuesta para el trabajo para ella trazar un objetivo, una meta, un blanco, sirven para determinar la acción de su próximo paso y obtener el resultado de mañana. Su objetivo es ver crecer el negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mayor cantidad y variedad de cadenas, pulseras, anillos, aritos, entre otros. Orbelina Esperanza tiene la fe que con todo su esfuerzo en el trabajo logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Orbelina Esperanza, 27, lives with her life partner and three children in her own house.  She sells gold plated products like chains or bracelets.  She also sells beauty products via catalogue.  She’s acquired quite a large clientele recently because everything she sells is of very good quality and, of course, she sells it at a very good price.  Besides, Orbelina is always on the lookout for customers and she gives them the service they deserve.

She is an enterprising woman always willing to work.  For her, setting objectives, goals or targets helps her to determine her next step to obtain tomorrow’s result.  

Her objective is to see her business grow so she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy larger amounts and variety of chains, bracelets, rings and hoops, among others.  Orbelina Esperanza hopes that all of her effort at work will allow her to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy chains, bracelets, rings and hoops.

loans.name: Abuzar

texts.en: Abuzar is 34 years old and earns his living as a butcher. He usually buys cattle or sheep and then sells their meat in his shop. Fresh meat is very popular among people in this area, and Abizar is doing his best to meet high demand for his products. His father helps him choose the best animals to buy, and he is able to earn a monthly income of about $250. Abuzar is a very dedicated father and husband and has two children. He is applying for this loan to improve his family's life. At AqroInvest, we consider him a good client with a proven record of repaying loans fully and on time.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Susana Eugenia

texts.es: Susana, originaria de la ciudad de León, tiene 39 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, ella es comerciante, se dedica a vender y elaborar tortillas de maíz. El negocio de las tortillas era de su madre lo trae por herencia, pues  desde pequeña le ayudaba a vender tortillas mientras su madre la elaboraba. Ahora tiene 7 años de ser ella quien se hace cargo de este negocio. Ella solicito el crédito para comprar maíz y leña para elaborar sus tortillas. En sus planes futuros ella quiere acondicionar mejor el local, comprar un terreno y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Susana is from the city of Leon. She is 39, and has two children. She has a small business making and selling corn tortillas.  

The tortilla business was her mother's, and she received it as an inheritance; since from the time she was small, she helped sell the tortillas while her mother made them.  For seven years now, she's been the one in charge of this business. 

She applied for the loan in order to buy corn and firewood to make her tortillas.  As for her future plans, she wants to better equip her business, buy a piece of land and help her children get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy corn and firewood for making her tortillas.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is 28 years old, married, and the father of two children. He runs a motorcycle business in Mshomoroni, Mombasa.  

His business has been in operation for the last three years. Said has been a KADET client, and this marks his second borrowing to finance his business. With this loan he plans to repair his motorcycle. 

The profits that will be generated from his business will be directed into the gradual expansion of his business and the repayment of the loan. His dream is to expand his business.

loans.use: repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Marie Gema

texts.en:
