Con este préstamo comprará mercadería para el almacén y guardará dinero para comprar juguetes, papel de regalo y cintas para vender en la época de Navidad. Su sueño es tener una casa propia, ya que vive con toda su familia, compuesta por su esposo y sus 3 hijos de: 17, 15 y 6 años, en la casa de su mamá. Además quiere tener su negocio en la misma casa, ya que hasta ahora arrienda un local. 
Para Juana, Fondo Esperanza es como una familia, ya que en su grupo, gracias a los temas de solidaridad y respeto inculcados por la asesora, han creado vínculos, unidad  y apoyo entre ellos.
La Cisterna es una comuna de Santiago, ubicada en el sector centro-sur de la capital chilena, y comprendida totalmente dentro del área urbana. Es una comuna esencialmente residencial y comercial.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to the communal bank “La Granja” (The Farm) in the community of La Cisterna.  Her business is a store and bazaar where there are also game machines.  She began as a member over a year ago, but two months ago she became independent.  Before this business, Juana sold fast food.
With this loan she will buy merchandise for the store and will save money to buy toys, wrapping paper, and ribbons to sell during the Christmas season.  Her dream is to have her own house as she now lives with her whole family, made up of her husband and their three children who are 17, 15, and six-years-old, in her mother’s house.  Additionally she would like to have her business in the same house as now she is renting a commercial space.
For Juana, “Fondo Esperanza” (Hope Fund) is like a family, as in her group, thanks to the themes of solidarity and respect instilled by the leader, they have created links, unity, and support among the members.  
La Cisterna is a community in Santiago located in the central-south sector of the Chilean capital and completely within the urban area.  It is a community that is mainly residential and commercial.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Naseem Muhammad Ishaq's Group

texts.en:
Naseem M. I. (in the photo the lady who is raising her hand is Naseem) is a widow and a mother of three sons. She lives in Lahore, which is one of Pakistan’s historic cities known for its history and culture. She has lived there with her family for over forty years in a two-room brick house in the area known as Mughalpura.

Naseem’s eldest son is 38 years old and sells a local Punjabi food called ladu peethi (made with flour and served with potatoes, carrots and spicy sauces) on a four-wheeled cart. He is basically a street hawker and sells his food by visiting different streets of the city. Her second son also adopted the same profession while her youngest son does embroidery work. He is very good at his work and operates an embroidery shop in the market.

Naseem helps support her family by doing sewing work in her home, which she has done since the death of her husband. She is well-known in her neighborhood for the quality of her work.

Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner Asasah for the improvement of her elder son’s business. With the loan he will buy ingredients such as potatoes, flour, spices and carrots in bulk. This will help him make larger quantities of ladu peethi and so make more money. He has been in this business for over ten years, and Naseem is hopeful that a loan will do a lot of good for his business.

Naseem is a regular client of Asasah, and this is her fifth loan application. In previous loan periods she has maintained a good credit record and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for ladu peethi, a Punjabi food, which her son will sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy all the essential construction supplies to repair his war-damaged house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 60 units of #26 bicycle tires, 60 units of #24 bicycle tires, 28 units of #26 bicycle inner tubes, 28 units of #24 bicycle inner tubes, 28 units of  #24 bicycle tire rims and 30 units of #26 bicycle tire rims.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 29-year-old single woman with three children, all below the age of 16. The family lives in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Jennifer has a dream of building a house for her family.
Jennifer knits sweaters and has also worked as a tailor for over a year now. Her business is profitable and it has allowed her to pay her children's school fees. Her business ambition is to own one of the biggest tailoring firms in town. Jennifer is requesting a loan to buy knitting yarn.

loans.use: To buy knitting yarn

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 65 años, vive en compañía D. su esposo en su casa propia. Hace más D. 21 años que tiene una tienda ubicada en su misma casa, en donD. comercializa productos D. primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, entre otros que son del consumo diario D. la gente. Cada semana se abastece D. mercadería aunque en algunas ocasiones sus proveedores van a su misma tienda para ofrecerle las promociones D. los productos. En todos estos largos años ha visto que este negocio ha resultado estable en las ganancias y afirma que le agrada estar trabajando en su tienda porque le permite estar activa todo el día, es por esa razón que seguirá trabajando por mas años. Es su crédito número 15 con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. más mercadería para su tienda y también en la compra D. sacos D. abono ya que sembrará maíz.
texts.en:
Maria is 65 and lives with her husband in their own home. She has had a store in her home for over 21 years, where she sells basic staples that people consume every day, such as: rice, sugar, pasta and milk, among others. Every week she stocks up on merchandise, and sometimes her suppliers come to her store to offer promotions. In all the time that she has had this business, it has generated a stable income and showed her that she does enjoy working in her store because it allows her to be active all day. For this reason, she will keep working for many more years.
This is her fifteenth loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support, since she has always been responsible with her payments. She is happy to be part of her communal bank, because all of the members are responsible and very united. She thanks those of you who will lend toward this loan, as it will be very useful in the progress of her business. With the loan that she is requesting, she will invest in the purchase of more merchandise for her store, and also in the purchase of bags of fertilizer since she will sow corn.

loans.use: to purchase products to stock her business, and for bags of fertilizer for her corn crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase construction materials for replacing a wall in his home

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde, tiene 33 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y nació en la ciudad de Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal de Matilde es elaborar pan, ella nos cuenta que tiene un pequeño horno en su domicilio donde elabora su rico pan. Ya son seis años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Matilde en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de harinas. 

Matilde pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Matilde is 33 years old and the mother of three children. She was born in Calca in the Peruvian department of Cusco. Her main economic activity is baking bread. She has a small oven at home where she bakes her rich bread. She has done that for six years and earned a good income thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Matilde currently needs a loan to buy several sacks of flour.

Matilde is a member of the communal bank "Señor de Huanca" of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this microfinance institution and promises to pay the installments on schedule.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of flour

loans.name: Asunta

texts.en: Asunta is currently in business selling rice. She is 29 years old, married to a businessman, with five children and three of them go to school. Asunta borrowed a loan to stock more small items like rice to sell. She hopes to educate her children with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more small items like rice to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia tiene 45 años y nació en la ciudad del Calca, Cusco,  Perú. Ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. Actualmente, Virginia vive en la comunidad de Yanahuara donde la mayoría de los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, Virginia nos cuenta que ella lleva verduras a la ciudad de Quillabamba y al regresar trae fruta para vender en la ciudad de Urubamba. 

Virginia en esta oportunidad  requiere el microcrédito para la comprar de semillas y para la mercadería de la fruta. María Virginia pertenece al banco comunal de “Villa Marcelo de Virgen del Carmen” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Virginia is 45 years old and was born in the city of Calca, Cusco, Peru. She is married and they have three children. Currently, Virginia lives in the Yanahuara community where most of the people work in agriculture and farming.  Virginia says that she brings vegetables to the city of Quillabamba and brings back fruit to sell in the city of Urubamba. 

Virginia at this time requires the loan to purchase seeds and fruit merchandise. María Virginia is a member of the community bank “Villa Marcelo de Virgen del Carmen” of the Arariwa Association.

loans.use: To buy seeds and merchandise such as fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand his business, repair his old store and cover their housing expenses.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie P. is from the village of Balila, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 29 years old. Melanie is married and has two infants. To make a living, Melanie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, powdered juice, junk foods, beverages, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. Melanie's husband is providing motorela or habal-habal services (motorcycles that can handle multiple passengers). Melanie has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Melanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Melanie is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & beverages. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Melanie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & beverages

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married to Mathew and they have been blessed with four children. She sells second hand clothes in Kikuyu market in the outskirts of Nairobi city. This market is very busy and receives customers regularly. This is her primary business which she has been doing for the past two years.

She was introduced to KADET by an existing member and this is her second loan with KADET. She has not borrowed from other financial institutions apart from KADET. Her previous loan was repaid successfully and on time.

Jane hopes that, with this loan, she will be able to add more clothing stock and substantially grow the business.

loans.use: To purchase 3 bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther de 52 años, está casada desde hace 27 años con Santiago, con quien tiene 4 hijos, pero solo vive con 3 de ellos, en su casa propia que fue heredada de parte de su padre; en la localidad de Alto Yapaz. Como tradición familiar, su actividad económica es la agricultura. Desde niña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra, desde entonces comenzó a sembrar café y plátanos en sus 4 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas donde trabaja con mucha dedicación. Pues sabe que depende mucho del buen cuidado y fertilización para btener un buen fruto. Según cuenta le va muy bien, pues los comerciantes de las diferentes ciudades (La Merced, Santa Ana), le pagan muy bien por sus cosechas. “Siempre me gusto sembrar, ahora estoy incursionando en la producción de Piña”, asegura. Además de abrir una tienda de comestibles hace 2 años, donde vende productos de primera necesidad, como también productos que le solicitan constantemente, pues la zona donde vive es muy lejana e inaccesible. Ahora desea seguir expandiendo su tienda y convertirla en la mejor. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Progresistas”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se compromete a trabajar con mucho esfuerzo y ahínco en el logro de sus objetivos. Esther, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad, así como útiles de escritorio, asimismo desea incursionar en la venta de prendas de vestir y zapatillas.
texts.en: Esther is 52 years old, married to Santiago for 27 years, by whom she has 4 children.  She lives with 3 of them, in her own home, which she inherited from her father, in the Alto Yapaz area.  Her family has traditionally been involved in farming.  From childhood, her parents taught her to work the land, and since that time she started planting coffee and bananas in the 4 hectares of farmland, where she works diligently.  She knows that good care and fertilizers will enable her to have a good yield.  She says that things are going well, for merchants in the different cities (La Merced, Santa Ana) pay her well for her harvests.  “I always liked to plant, and now I’m moving into pineapple production,” she states.  This in addition to opening a grocery store two years ago, where she sells convenience items, and goods that people always ask for, since the area where she lives is remote and inaccessible.  She would like now to expand her store and become the best.  She belongs to the “Los Progresistas” communal bank, and this is her first loan with MFP.  She commits to working hard and enthusiastically to achieve her goals.  Esther will use the requested loan to purchase convenience items, as well as school supplies, and also wishes to expand into selling garments and sandals.

loans.use: buy goods to supply her store, school supplies, and also clothing and sandals.

loans.name: Jose Hernaides

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la venta y reparación de celulares y sus accesorios, vive con su esposa y tienen un hijo de 4 años de edad, José inicio trabajando con un amigo, luego se independizo y puso su propio negocio desde hace 6 años.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, protectores, carcasas, baterías, cargadores y todo tipo de accesorios, este préstamo será una gran ayuda para el negocio y poder brindar un mejor servicio.
Su objetivo es crecer en su negocio, crear estabilidad y un mejor servicio a los clientes, también mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
José sells and repairs cell phones and their accessories.  He lives with his wife and they have a 4-year-old son.  José started working with a friend but he later became independent and opened his own business six years ago.

He is currently asking for a loan to buy merchandise: protectors, cases, batteries, chargers and all sorts of accessories.  This loan will be a great help for his business and to be able to offer better service.

His goal is to grow in business, to create stability and better customer service as well as to improve his family’s condition.

loans.use: to buy cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Nathaniel

texts.en:
Nathaniel is 33 years old, married, and has an 8-year-old son. He has been running a hotel (also known as a restaurant) business for 8 years and employs 6 people. He sells breakfast, lunch, and supper to people in his area. Nathaniel plans to use this loan to renovate the hotel and purchase new furniture. He also wants to refurbish the vehicle used by his business. 

This is Nathaniel’s 9th loan with SMEP. He is a good client and repays on time. In the future, he plans to purchase a fleet of Matatus so he can run a mini-bus transport business. He also dreams of developing a plot of land. Nathaniel describes himself as very innovative and dynamic.

loans.use: to renovate the hotel and purchase new furniture.

loans.name: Phidiliah

texts.en:
Phidiliah is a widow with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. 

For the past 5 years, Phidiliah has operated a clothing business, selling as retail and from door-to-door to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes and a food-vending business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes and a food-vending business

loans.name: Belen

texts.es: La señora Belen es una mujer muy responsable que ha dedicado su vida por más de 21 años a trabajado para una maquiladora de la ciudad para poder sostener los gastos del hogar al igual que su esposo ya que de esta manera es como se ayudan mutuamente. Desde hace 19 años adquirieron su vivienda de interés social y que con el tiempo el techo de la misma se ha ido deteriorando por lo que Belen se ve en la necesidad de reconstruirlo ya que es su único patrimonio que les podrá ofrecer a sus dos hijos. Para arreglar su techo necesita comprar material de construcción y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en: Belen is a very responsible woman who has dedicated her life for over 21 years working for a factory in the city to pay for household expenses.  Her husband also does this, as this is how they help each other. For 19 years they got affordable housing and over time the roof of their house has deteriorated so Belen needs to rebuild it, as it is their only asset they can offer their two children. To fix the roof she needs to buy building materials and pay for labor.

loans.use: to rebuild the roof of her house.

loans.name: Nancy Hilay Group

texts.en: Nancy is 42 years old and lives in Pangalalan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married, has five children and earns about PHP 2,000 a month by selling dried fish. She is applying for a loan for PHP 3,000 to buy more dried fish to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for three years and is committed to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions. Nancy leads a two-person loan group. Each member of the group is responsible for paying back entire loan should the other person not be able to make payments.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Guirmen Augusto

texts.es: Guirmen, de 40 años es padre de dos hijos, vive en casa propia junto a sus menores hijos y su esposa con quien comparte la educación de sus hijos.El señor Guirmen empieza su jornada laboral muy temprano. Sale a las 4:30 de la madrugada a las calles de la ciudad en busca de sus eventuales pasajeros quienes tienen necesidad de transportarse de un lugar a otro. Lleva 20 años en esta actividad, tiempo en el cual aprendió mucho del negocio.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene disposición de su tiempo ya que sabe en que momentos hay mas afluencia de pasajeros y en que momento puede ir a su casa a hacer algunos quehaceres. Lo que no le gusta es que el sol es muy fuerte y el estado de las pistas maltrata su vehículo y le dañan sus riñones. Espera poder más adelante comprar una unidad mas para así poder empezar a alquilar y tener un ingreso extra.Lleva 6 años con la institución, dice que le agrada trabajar con MFP ya que los intereses son bajos y sobre todo puedes acceder a un seguro no solo para ti, si no también para tu familia.Con el préstamo solicitado 1000 soles, el espera poder comprar algunos repuestos para su mototaxi y así mejorar la imagen de su herramienta de trabajo.
texts.en:
Guirmen, 40, is the father of two children.  He lives in his own house with his minor children and his wife with whom he shares the children’s education.

Guirmen starts his work day very early.  He sets off at 4:30am to seek out customers along the city streets that need to be transported from place to place.  He’s been in this line of work for 20 years, time in which he’s learned quite a bit about the business.

What he likes about his work is that he can manage his own time since he knows at what times passengers are plentiful and when he can go home to do chores there.  What he dislikes is that the sun is very strong and the state of the roads is such that his vehicle becomes damaged as do his kidneys.  He hopes later on to be able to buy another vehicle to lease it out and earn extra income.

He has been with the institution six years.  He says he likes to work with MFP because interest rates are low but, above all, because you can access a secure loan not just for yourself but for your family as well.  He will use the requested 1000 soles to buy some replacement parts for his mototaxi to improve the appearance of his work tool.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his mototaxi.

loans.name: Saveit

texts.en: Saveit, 56 years old, sells fruit with her husband. Their income is 5 USD per day. She has three children, all of whom work. The combined income for everyone in her family is 9 USD. She also has three grandchildren, so there are a total of eight family members. Every month, she spends 70 USD on food, 15 USD on electricity, 19 USD on rent, 30 USD on transportation, and 10 USD on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of 600 USD to buy a motorbike for transporting the fruit that she sells. In the future, she wants to sell more kinds of fruit so that she can earn more income. She wants to support her grandchildren's education through high school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transporting fruit

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 49 years old, married and has five children in school.  

She has been operating a grocery store and a retail shop for over ten years. She has been able to retain the business through the financial support of Faulu Kenya.
  
In five years, she hopes to expand her business into wholesale. She needs a loan of 60,000 KES to buy cooking fat, sugar, tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, sugar, tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Rice farming is Milagros' primary source of income. She is 49 years old and married. Together with her husband, she patiently works hard to keep improving their crop production. She usually gets a yield twice a year. From her half hectare plot of land, she earns P15,000 during the month of May and November. Profits earned are just enough to cover her family's consumption such as monthly electric bills, daily meals and allowances for her three children.

Milagros is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy seeds and insecticides, and to pay for laborers who help in transplanting rice seedlings. She wants to improve her crop production and generate more income from it.

Milagros would like to keep producing an abundant harvest in order to save enough money for future expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds and insecticides, and to pay for laborers who help in transplanting rice seedlings

loans.name: Ma.caren Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Ma. Caren, 49, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Pedro, a taxi driver. A mother of three children, she dreams of sending them all to school. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Caren owns a variety store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar, and other primary commodities that are needed in every household. Aside from this, she also sells frozen meat products. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

Caren is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 that will help her to have additional capital. She will use the loan to buy additional groceries, toiletries, beverages and frozen meat products that will help her to accommodate the demands of her customers. With the help of God, she strongly believes that her business will be more prosperous.

Caren hopes to continuously provide a good life for her family. She wants her children to have their own businesses when they grow up. Hard work and faith in God paves the way for her to turn dreams into reality. She never fails to attend to the fellowship* every week as it inspires her to grow more spiritually. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products to sell

loans.name: Hut

texts.en: Hut is a housewife. She is a single mother who lives with four children, all of them are working. Together, they earn 10 USD per day for all. Every month, Hut has to spend 120 USD on food, 10 USD on electricity, and 10 USD on other expenses. Each of her family expenses is covered by her first daughter because she can make a better income than the others. Hut would like to request a loan of 500 USD to buy construction material for repairing her house. This loan helps her to get a better house to stay in.

loans.use: to buy construction material for repairing her house

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is 49 years old and is a window with two children aged between 15 and 24 years old. She also takes care of a relative who is 76 years old.  

Sharifa owns a business selling African clothing. This is her 2nd successful year in this business and the hours of her business are from 7 am until 5 pm every day. 

Sharifa has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying more African clothes to sell. With any profit, she will be able to build a secure future for her business as well as for her family, she will be able to reinvest in her business and continue paying her children's school fees.

loans.use: buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Reina Esperanza

texts.es: Reina Esperanza D. 63 años D. edad, habita en casa propia junto con su esposo D. 63 años y su hijo el cual ya es mayor D. edad. Reina ha trabajado toda su vida para colaborar con la economía D. su hogar y no dejar toda la responsabilidad a su esposo. Es una mujer increíble ya que a pesar D. su avanzada edad sigue luchando y no se da por vencida ya que su sueño es poder mejorar su situación económica. Ella posee una pequeña tiendita y un comedor en su hogar D. residencia el cual es un lugar accesible y muy frecuentado. Reina ha sabido ganarse la confianza D. todos sus vecinos los cuales están muy satisfechos con el servicio que Reina ofrece. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener  su negocio activo por muchos años y es así como quiere mantenerlos ya que para ella es muy importante tener esta fuente D. ingresos ya que el  salario D. su esposo no cubre todas las necesidades del hogar. Esto ha motivado a Reina a tomar la decisión  D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra D. insumos tanto para su tienda como para su comedor. Por tanto el crédito lo invertirá en la compra D. : verduras, cereales, frutas, carnes, huevos, golosinas, bebidas, aceite, etc. todo esto con el objetivo D. mejor el servicio que ofrece D. tal forma que pueda cubrir una mayor demanda que le permita aumentar su nivel D. ingresos y por consecuencia mejorar su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia.
texts.en:
Reina Esperanza, 63, lives in her own house with her 63-year-old husband and her adult son.  Reina has worked her entire life to contribute to the family economy and not leave that responsibility solely on her husband.  She is an unbelievable woman who despite her advanced age continues fighting and does not give up because her dream is to be able to improve her economic situation.

She has a little store and eatery at home that’s quite accessible and visited by many.  Reina has succeeded in gaining the trust of all her neighbors who are very satisfied with the service Reina provides.  With much effort and dedication she’s kept her business active for many years and that’s how she wants to continue to keep it because it’s very important for her to have this source of income because her husband’s salary isn’t quite enough to cover all the household needs.

This is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to buy supplies both for her store and for her eatery.  She will therefore use the loan to buy vegetables, grains, fruit, meats, eggs, snacks, beverages, oil, etc. with the goal in mind of improving the service she offers so that she can cover a larger demand that will lead to increased income and as a result improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, grains, fruit, meat, eggs, snacks, beverages, oil, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a mother of four. All of her children are adults save for the last born. She is 47 years old and has been in farming for 20 solid years. Her farm now produces cabbage, carrots, potatoes, and milk for the local market.

Susan made a loan request with Juhudi Kilimo for 30,000 KES to buy poultry for her farm and diversify her farming business. She says she will use the income to educate her children and feed her family. 

She laments of pests and other animal diseases, which result in great losses.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Martha Angelita

texts.es:
La Señora. Martha es socia del banco comunal Vida Plena, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia Ricaurte, ubicada al noreste de la ciudad de Cuenca, Ricaurte es conocido a nivel regional por su gastronomía típica, entre la que destaca el cuy asado, muchos de sus habitantes se dedican también a la crianza de este roedor. Sin embargo también existen los cultivos de maíz y otros vegetales, su gente mantiene la vestimenta típica de sus pueblos y son personas amables y cálidas.

La Señora. Martha tiene 19 años,  vive en unión libre y fruto de esa unión ha concebido un niño de un año y cuatro meses. Su esposo labora como guardia de seguridad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Ella trabaja como ayudante de cocina, labora medio día de lunes a sábado y el resto de su tiempo lo dedica al cuidado de su hijo. En su tiempo libre se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de Omnilife y en esta actividad se encuentra hace un año.
 
Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de Omnilife.
 
Su meta es crecer en la venta de estos productos y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the community bank Vida Plena.  She lives near the Ricaurte church, located northeast of Cuenca. 

Ricaurte is known regionally for their typical gastronomy, among which stands out the roasted guinea pig. Many inhabitants raise guinea pig and grow corn and other vegetables. The inhabitants keep the traditional clothing of their people and are friendly and warm.

Martha is 19 years old and lives in a free union with her spouse and their 4 month old child.  Her spouse works as a security guard and does not own their home, therefore he rents. 

She works as an assistant in the kitchen, working half days Monday through Saturday. The rest of her time is dedicated to caring for her child. In her free time she sells natural products from Omnilife and she has been doing this for the past year.
 
This is her second loan through the community bank and she is going to invest in purchasing Omnilife products.
 
Her goal is to increase her product sales and continue to advance her family.

loans.use: to buy Omnilife products.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa is now a 27-year-old single lady who lives with her parents. She is the youngest member of her four brothers and sisters. 

Safaa opened a small food store where she mostly sells snacks for the kids in the neighborhood, so she can help her family financially. It has been three years now since she started, and her brother Mohammad sometimes helps her by taking shifts so she can rest.

Now Safaa has applied for a loan to offer more food products like sugar, rice, etc to reach more customers. Because Safaa is a conservative person, she asked her brother Mohammad to appear in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: to offer more food products like sugar, rice, etc. to serve more customers.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with three children, age 2, 8 and 9. She and her husband are both farmers. They till land in Talibon, Bohol, where they also live. They grow rice and coconuts on their land.

Jocelyn has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Jocelyn hopes for their business to grow. She also hopes to save for her children's college education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Qorilazo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORILAZO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yeni; ella es conviviente y tiene 27 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende arroz,azúcar,leche,aceite y golosinas ,la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia también se dedica a vender choclos cocinados con queso ella vende en forma ambulatoria, por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los choclos con queso y también ampliar la tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite al por mayor y también para comprar choclos y queso al por mayor.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de jora, negocio de gallinas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de  venta de comida, negocio de venta de cuyes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Qorilazo communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

One of the members is Señora Yeni. She is 27 years old, is in a common-law marriage, and has two children. Her business is a grocery store. She sells rice, sugar, milk, oil and candies. She works from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm. She also sells corn cooked with cheese, which she sells as a street vendor. Through these little businesses she is raising her children. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell corn with cheese and also to expand her grocery store. She is applying for the loan to buy products such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil wholesale, and also to buy corn and cheese wholesale.

The other members' businesses include selling chicha (a traditional Andean corn-based alcoholic drink), a chicken business, a grocery store, selling food, and selling guinea pigs.

Sra. Yeni is thankful to those who form part of her dream through the loans and she promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, corn, and cheese wholesale.

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en:
Saroeurn, 30, is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling breads and steamed corn for over ten years to generate income to support the family as well as to cover her children's educational expenses. However, she could not afford her children's educational expense because she is the only one who makes money to support the family. Therefore, all of her children have been forced to stop studying and find a job to do in order to help her generate income to support the family. 

Currently, all of her children are employed at a garment factory. Due to the difficulty in transporting her breads and steamed corn to sell, Saroeurn is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike to carry her breads and steamed corn to sell around the village. In the future, she plans to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to carry her breads and steamed corn to sell.

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: Don Pedro, es un humilde agricultor de zona de Ticuantepe, durante muchísimos años se ha dedicado al cultivo de piña, la mayor afectación que se le presento fue causa de los desastres naturales, lo cual de tanto lluvia el cultivo se perdió gran totalidad, en estos momentos no cuenta con capital para poder salvar lo poco que se salvo y necesita abono, herbicidas y otros productos necesarios para la inducción. Su esposa es comerciante de frutas y verduras en un mercado de capital , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar siempre en sus estudio a su hijo menor .
texts.en: Pedro is a humble farmer who lives in the area of Ticuantepe. For many years he has made a living growing pineapple. The thing which has affected him most recently has been natural disasters; because of so much rain he lost most of his crop. Now he doesn't have enough capital to be able to purchase fertilizer, herbicides and other products that will allow him to save what little crop he has left. His wife sells fruits and vegetables in a market in the capital. His plans for his family are to improve their quality of life and as always support his youngest son in his studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and other products for the care of his pineapple crop.

loans.name: Rahat

texts.ru: Рахат, 38 лет, не замужем, есть сын - школьник, учится в 7 классе. У Рахат среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Рахат, ее хозяйство на сегодняшний день насчитывает 3 коровы. На ежедневно основе продает экологически чистое молоко. На участке в 2,0 Га Рахат выращивает клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. В хозяйстве есть маленький мотоцикл, он - большой помощник по хозяйству, на нем Рахат привозит сено, корма, использует при очистке сараев. Бизнес в целом приносит до 17,000 сом (KGS)в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рахат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого, вкусного молока. Доходы от кредита Рахат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а в ближайшем будущем накопить на покупку дома.
texts.en:
Rahat is 38 years old, not married. She has a son who is in school, 7th grade. Rahat has completed secondary education. 

Her husband and she breed livestock and cultivate plants for a living. Thanks to Rahat's hard work, there are three cows in her household now. She sells eco-friendly milk on a daily basis. On the 2.0 ha land lot she cultivates clover for private consumption and for sale. The family owns a small bike which is of great help in the household that Rahat uses to transport hay and animal food, and to clean the barns. Her business brings a monthly income of 17,000 som (KGS). 

To expand her business, Rahat turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase two dairy cows in order to increase the sales of eco-friendly, tasty milk. The borrowed money will be invested to increase the livestock headcount and save enough money in the future to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows in order to increase the sales of eco-friendly milk

loans.name: Hanife Guler

texts.en:
Hanife Guler is married with one child.  She started work as a hairdresser’s assistant as an 11 year old.  After working as an apprentice, she became a hairdresseere.  Four years ago she opened her own hair salon and has one employee.  She plans to renovate her salon by making alterations and expand her business with the microloan.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Hanife hanım evli bir çocuk annesi.  Hanife hanım on bir yaşından beri kuaförlük  mesleğine ilk adımı çırak olarak başlamış.  Çıraklıktan kalfalığa geçmiş.  Dört yıl önce kendi dükkanını açmış.  Yanında bir eleman çalıştırıyor.  Aldığı mikro kredi ile dükkana tadilat yaparak yenileyecek ve bu şekilde işlerini geliştirmeyi planlıyor.

loans.use: to renovate her salon by making alterations and expand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Given a loan of USD 450, Mary will add her stock to enable her give her customers better services.

loans.name: Essenam

texts.en:
Ms. Essenam S. is a married mother of four children. She is very energetic and is experienced in selling secondhand clothing in her town. Her husband is a moped and motorcycle mechanic who is unable to pay the household expenses due to a lack of customers. Thanks to her rigorous business management, Ms. Essenam S. has been able to manage two consecutive loans that were both repaid in full. She is requesting a new loan of $800 to increase the size of her shop and display window. The amount requested will serve to buy and sell new lines of secondhand clothing. In light of the existing needs of her family, this loan will be very beneficial as it will allow her to increase her income, something that will have a large effect on her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame S. Essenam est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Elle est très dynamique et expérimentée dans la vente de la friperie dans sa localité. Son mari est un mécanicien à 2 roues qui n’arrive pas à couvrir les charges du ménage faute de clientèle. Grâce à sa gestion rigoureuse, Madame S. Essenam a su gérer deux fois de suite ses crédits qui ont été bien soldés. Elle sollicite ce crédit de $800 pour agrandir sa boutique et son étalage. Le montant demandé servira à acheter et à vendre de nouvelles gammes de friperie. Vu aussi les besoins existants au sein de son foyer, ce prêt lui sera très bénéfique puisqu’elle va ainsi augmenter son revenu qui aura une très forte répercussion sur le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and sell new lines of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes lives in Nkurankan, Ghana and has been a client of Kraban Support Foundation for years. She has had several training sessions on simple record keeping and loan management from the organization. She cooks kenkey and fried fish (a local meal) and sells it to school children in her town. She is seeking a loan of $700.00 from Kiva to help her cook enough for sale.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Valentin

texts.en:
Valentin earns a living working as a taxi driver. Many weeks he works seven days in a row, always making himself available to drive. Valentin works with a taxi dispatching company and has a radio in his car. This not only makes him more efficient in his work, but it helps ensure a steady supply of customers. He typically makes between $24 and $30 per day. The more he is able to work the more money he can make.

Valentin has requested a loan for $500 so that he can have some welding work done on the engine of his car. Having a reliable vehicle is vitally important to Valentin’s business. We are happy for this opportunity to help him complete these repairs and continue to provide safe, dependable service to his customers.

loans.use: Valentin would like to repair his taxi so he can continue making money as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is the single mother of one child. They are natives of the Escobedo neighborhood of Nuevo Leon. Faced with having to get the things that her son needs, Juana started a business selling cosmetics two years ago, starting with sales to her neighbors and friends, but soon managing to increase both her customer base and her sales. Juana is an entrepreneur who works hard day after day so that her son can get a good education and have a better future.

Juana now needs a $475 loan that she will use to buy merchandise so that she can offer her customers a better level of service, as well as a wider range of products. She promises to repay this amount in 6 months. You can help someone today who badly needs your help so don’t just think about it. Juana sincerely thanks you for your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana es soltera y tiene un hijo, ellos son originarios de la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León. Ante la necesidad de obtener los recursos que su hijo necesita, desde hace doce años Juana inició su negocio con la venta de cosméticos, comenzó con sus vecinos y amigos pero pronto logró incrementar sus clientes y ventas. Juana es una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza día con día por sacar adelante a su hijo y desea ofrecerle una buena educación que le permita tener un mejor futuro.

En estos momentos Juana necesita de un crédito de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos así como un mejor servicio, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes hoy ayudar a quien más lo necesita, no lo pienses más, Juana agradece sinceramente tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for sale.

loans.name: Awah

texts.en:
Awah Janet is married and is a mother of one child.  Growing up, she was not privileged enough to get basic education because her polygamous father could not pay her school fees.  Now, at the age of 23 years, she still plans to continue her education.  However, she lacks the money for school fees.

With a loan of $100, she plans to invest in her grocery business so she can raise enough money to sponsor herself in school.

She plans to repay the loan in 15 months with the first installment on the day the loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Invest in her grocery business to raise money for school

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is an experienced entrepreneur from Kamenka-Dneprovskaya, Ukraine. For the past ten years she has been developing a successful women’s clothing and shoe sales business called “Odezhda Magazine” or Clothes Store. She has worked hard and gained many friends and loyal customers over the years. Her customers appreciate the quality service she offers. Irina is married. She and her husband Uriy have five children - three daughters and two sons. Her business is a valuable source of income as she and Uriy raise their family.

Irina has requested a loan of $1000 to help buy new inventory for her business. She’d like to purchase new kinds of clothing and attract new customers. Irina has been a great client with Nadiya Ukraine and has benefited from previous loans. We are happy to be able to continue assisting her with her business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Lastenia Del Rosario

texts.es:
Sra. S. sells hardware, a business she started 5 years ago with savings of C$1,000. She sold her products in the La Estacion market at first, but then moved to the market at La Terminal where there were more potential customers and greater opportunities for sales. She has an excellent space inside the market, with a person responsible for security who she pays jointly with the other traders in her part of the market.

Sra. S. is married with 3 children who she struggles to educate so that they might be prepared for bright futures.

Ceprodel has provided Sra. S. with 22 loans over the last three years, funds that have given her peace of mind as her income from the business has grown.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La actividad económica de la señora S. se inicia con la venta de artículos ferreteros, teniendo 5 años de tener el negocio iniciando con un capital de C$1,000.00 producto de dinero que ahorro en su oportunidad de mas joven. Comienza vendiendo en el mercado la Estación para luego trasladarse al mercado La Terminal por haber mayor fluidez de clientes que le generan mayores ventas y desde luego mayores utilidades. Tiene un puesto fijo con óptimas condiciones dentro del mercado, dejando una persona encargada de seguridad que se paga en comunidad con otros ferreteros del sector.

Es casada con 3 hijos que viene luchando para educarlos para que sean personas preparadas en la vida.

Ceprodel le ha brindado la mano financieramente desde hace tres años con un total de 22 créditos otorgados y pagados en donde el impacto que han tenido es que se siente tranquila porque su negocio tiene buenos ingresos y se le ha han dado créditos para el mejoramiento de su familia y vivienda, teniéndole mucha confianza a su institución financiera.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Albino

texts.es:
Señor Albino A. lives in his own house in the Alpacoma zone of La Paz city, with his wife and his three children. Señor Albino works in a brick factory.

With previous credits Albino has managed to wall around 50% of his home, leaving the south and west walls at foundation level.

This loan will be used to finish the walling of his house. This is the fourth time he has asked for a loan, and socioeconomic analysis undertaken qualifies him favourably to apply for another credit.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Albino A. vive en casa propia en la zona Alpacoma de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa y sus tres hijos. El señor Albino es empleado en una fábrica de ladrillos.

Con anteriores créditos el señor Albino realizó el amurallado de su vivienda en un 50%, quedando en cimientos los muros Sur y Oeste.

El crédito solicitado será destinado al acabado del amurallado de su vivienda. Esta es la cuarta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Finish building the perimeter wall of his house

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
The local store in the El Sauce municipality of the city of León is very important because it fills the basic needs of the people. Ana Maria P. has had her business for 10 years in the same location in the municipality of El Sauce.

It is important to stress the fact that despite life's hardships, she has been able to go on to help her husband with the maintenance of the household and school fees for her two children whom she loves. Today, her biggest concern is to urgently acquire merchandise for her store so she can continue the upkeep of the household. Previously, when she was in need, she wisely went to Ceprodel who gave her credit which she used to buy her products.

Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de pulpería en el municipio El Sauce de la ciudad de León es de mucha importancia porque a diario las personas hacen uso de estas para suplir la necesidad por la que pasan. La señora Ana Maria P. se dedica a este negocio desde hace 10 años siempre teniéndolo ubicado en el municipio de El Sauce.

Es de interés plantear que a pesar de las adversidades de la vida, ella ha logrado salir adelante para apoyar a su esposo con el sustento del hogar y pago del colegio de sus dos hijos que tanto ama. Hoy en día su mayor necesidad es la urgencia de adquirir los productos de pulpería para lograr continuar manteniendo su hogar. Para esto, muy sabiamente anteriormente ha acudido a Ceprodel quien le ha brindado créditos que los ha utilizado en la compra de sus productos.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Doi Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Đới, who is 51 years old, resides with her husband and her three children in Quảng Xương which is in the Thanh Hóa province. Mrs. Đới has borrowed money in the past and she started a bamboo weaving business. This business was successful, but her profit margins were low. Recently, Mrs. Đới started a concrete cutting business and her family's income has substantially increased to approximately $250 USD a month. At this point, Mrs. Đới's sons work for others as laborers, but she would like to have them work for her company because of the construction boom in her province. Mrs. Đới is requesting a Kiva loan in the amount of $525 USD to purchase additional concrete cutting equipment.

Chị Đới Thị L., 51 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Các vòng vốn trước đây chị thường vay vốn mua tre nứa về đan thúng. Nghề này tuy mang lại thu nhập thường xuyên nhưng lợi nhuận thấp. Khi các con đã trưởng thành, chị L. vay vốn Quỹ đầu tư cho con mua máy khoan cắt bê tông. Nhờ có máy nên các con chị chủ động hơn trong công vệc không phải làm thuê cho các chủ máy khác như trước đây, đời sống gia đình cũng đã sung túc hơn nhiều. Thời gian gần đây trong vùng có nhiều công trình xây dựng nên lúc nào công việc khoan cắt bê tông của gia đình lúc nào cũng đông khách. Thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình là 250USD. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 525USD để mua thêm một máy nữa.

loans.use: Purchase concrete cutting equipment

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru:
Halima Mustafoevna B. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is a widow, 47 years old with two children. She has secondary education. Halima is in the retail business of buying and selling fabrics for national Tajik dresses and has been doing it for more than five years. By working from her home she is able to take care of her small children. It's also convenient for her neighbors to buy from her without having to travel outside of town. This business is the only source of income for her family. At this time, Halima wants to buy more fabrics because the time for lighter clothes is around the corner. She does not have enough capital so she decided to apply for a loan. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобоева Халима Мустафоевна жительница города Турсунзаде.Она вдова , имеет 2 детей.Возраст 47 лет. Образование средние. Халима занимается куплей продажей ткани для пошива национального платья.Клиентка торгует из своего дома.Занимается этой деятельностью более 5 лет.Торгуя из дому ,она может смотреть за своими маленькими детьми.Это удобно и ее соседям,они могут приобретать ткани и выезжая в город.Бизнес является единственным источником дохода ее семьи. В данный момент клиентка хочет закупить больше ткани,так как наступает сезон более легкой одежды. Своих оборотных средств у нее не хватает и она решила взять кредит.Планирует погасить кредит в течние 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the variety of merchandise

loans.name: Thi Nguyet

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Nguyệt i s39 years old. She has a store selling bicycles. She needs a loan of 2.478.000 VND to buy bicycle parts. She also sells snacks at the market (grilled sweet potato) to gain some more money. Her family income is 130.000 VND/ day. She has 4 children who are still going to school. This is her second group loan, th efirst loan was successfully paid off. She volunteers to be the group leader because she believes in her group. She would be able to help othe rgroup members. She likes SEDA program very much because it is effective and fast.
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Chút is 52 years old. She sells basic goods. She needs 2.242.000 VND.
- Mrs Phan Thị Lý is 57 years old. She sells CDs. She is requesting 2.242.000 VND.
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Vinh is 45 years old. She runs an internet cafe. She is requesting 2.242.000 VND to expand her cafe.
- Mrs Đặng Thị Thạnh is 35 years old. She needs 2.242.000 VND to buy wood to make furniture.
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Tĩnh is 20 years old. She needs 2.242.000 VND to open a hair salon.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cô Nguyễn Thị Nguyệt (MS: 030012), năm nay 39 tuổi. Cô vay 2.478.000 VND để bổ xung vốn mua bán xe đạp. Bản thân cô còn làm thêm để có thêm thu nhập cho gia đình, cô đi chợ bán khoai nướng. Mức thu nhập của gia đình 130.000 VND/ ngày. Cô có bốn con đang đi học. Cô cùng nhóm đã hoàn trả tốt một chu kỳ vay vốn của chương trình. Nhóm côlàm việc rất tôt nên cô tiếp tục nhân làm nhóm trưởng để giúp đỡ nhóm. Cô rất thích tham gia vào chương trình vì thủ tục nhanh gọn và thuận tiện. Cô Nguyễn Thị Chút (MS: 030013), năm nay 52 tuổi. Cô vay 2.242.000 VND để đi chợ mua hàng bán. Cô Phan Thị Lý (MS: 030014), năm nay 57 tuổi. Cô vay 2.242.000 VND để mua bán băng đĩa. Cô Nguyễn Thị Vinh (MS: 030015), năm nay 45 tuổi. Cô vay 2.242.000 VND bổ xung vốn mở rộng quán Internet. Chị Đặng Thị Thạnh (MS: 030016), năm nay 35 tuổi. Chị vay 2.242.000 VND để bổ xung vốn mua gỗ đóng bàn ghế bán. Chị Nguyễn Thị Tĩnh (MS: 030028), năm nay 20 tuổi. Chị vay 2.242.000 VND để mua đồ mở của hàng làm tóc.

loans.use: bicycle store

loans.name: Bear Bozzu Group

texts.en: Abdul T. is very grateful to Kiva for his previous $175 loan. With the loan, Abdul purchased dozens of dried fish using cash and thus increased his income. The profit enabled him to begin building his own business capital and family income. Abdul is the group leader, 45 years old, married and with four children. He organized and encouraged the group members to save to mitigate late payment. The group members also assist each other to purchase the fish in turns. All the members sell fish in Magburaka town and surrounding villages, and are requesting a loan of Le.3,200,000 ($US1,100) to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To increase stock of fish in order to earn more income.

loans.name: Amélé Elise

texts.fr:
Born in Attivé in 1972, Mrs. Amélé Elise A. is an energetic woman. Married and a mother of two, she currently lives with her husband, a peasant, and her whole family in Blamacondji. Selling cassava flour and corn is her principal occupation. Sacks in hand, she circulates from village to village to buy her products which she sells at the local markets and to the customers in Lomé, the capital. Today, she intends to seize this opportunity to increase her buying power with this loan in order to sell more. This will allow her to improve the living conditions of her entire family and her own business conditions.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Née à Attivé en 1972, Madame A. Amélé Elise est femme très dynamique. Mariée et mère de deux enfants, elle vit actuellement avec son mari, un paysan et toute sa famille à Blamacondji. Le commerce du gari et du maïs est son activité principale. Sacs en mains, elle circule de village en village pour acheter ses produits qu’elle revend sur les marchés locaux et aux consommateurs de Lomé, la capitale. Aujourd’hui, elle compte saisir de cette opportunité pour augmenter sa capacité d’achat à partir de ce financement afin de mieux vendre. Ce pouvoir lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de toute sa famille et ses propres conditions d’activités.

loans.use: To buy and sell cassava flour

loans.name: Ilyos

texts.en:
M. Ilyos is 38 years old. He is married and has three children. Ilyos sells potted goods, sweets, soft drinks, juices, and many other grocery items. He rents a place at the local market to sell his goods and has been running his own small business for 2 years. His wife, who is pictured in the photo, helps Ilyos with the business, which is their main source of income. Ilyos works very hard to give his children a good education and to make them happy.

In order to cover the higher education expenses of his oldest son at the university, Ilyos is planning to increase his working capital to increase his range of goods. For this reason, Ilyos requests 2000 Somoni (600 US dollars) for the term of 12 months. He thanks everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan on time. He is counting on your help. Be an important part of the growth of Ilyos’s business.

loans.use: To purchase a wider variety of goods for his business.

loans.name: Twezimbe Women's Group

texts.en: N. Florence is the leader and chairperson of the Twezimbe women's group in Lugazi, Lweru village. She is a married woman who has eight of her own children as well as two orphans that she takes care of. In addition to farming, she raises cattle, poultry, and goats just to earn a living. She is so happy with these activities because each one helps her and her family in one way or another. She is asking for a loan that she hopes will help her pay the school fees for her six school-going children. She is planning to repay her loan by selling milk from her two cows as well as by selling produce like matooke, cassava, and sweet potatoes from her farm. She also says that the loan helps to pay the laborers that she employs on her farm under the direct supervision of both herself and her husband. She and her husband have become a successful team who plan together what to do next. So far they have acquired different plots of land and more animals. She is so grateful for her loans from Pearl Microfinance because what her family has now would not have been possible without them. And now she plans to buy hard corn that she can fry at home and sell to schools, shops and supermarkets for additional income.

loans.use: To buy hard corn

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr: Bintou D. est une femme mariée, mère de 04 enfants. Elle veut, avec ce prêt financer un commerce d’habillement. Elle souhaite acheter en gros et revendre en petit détail spécialement des tissus, quelques chaussures et des sacs à main, ce qui lui permettra d’accroître ses revenus.
texts.en:
Bintou D. is a married woman and the mother of 4 children. She wants to use this loan to sell clothing. She would like to buy wholesale and sell retail, especially cloth, some shoes and some handbags, which will allow her to increase her earnings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cloth and various other items such as shoes and handbags

loans.name: Davronjon

texts.en:
Davronjon is a very hardworking and responsible entrepreneur. He and his family live in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is not married, but despite his young age he already supports his parents. 

Davronjon works in the central city market, selling men’s clothing (jeans, jackets, shirts) and women's national dresses. His business is characterized by stability and consistent growth. He has been working in the market for 4 years. Currently, his net profit is about $200 per month. Davronjon likes to work for himself. His business has been the main source of income for his whole family. 

Today Davronjon would like to ask for a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750 USD) for the term of 6 months so he can purchase inventory from wholesalers and increase the assorted merchandise in his store. 

We believe Davronjon’s drive for success will help this young entrepreneur succeed and thrive in business. You can be an important part of the growth of Davronjon’s business.

loans.use: To purchase new goods to sell

loans.name: Diénaba

texts.fr: DiénaB. B., 36 ans, mariée, 07 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Plateau 2 depuis 1 an et demi. Elle veut  renforcer ses activités de restauration au niveau du marché hebdomadaire et de vente de sucre et d’huile. L’activité de restauration est menée les jours de marché de la localité. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
DiénaB. B., 36, married and raising 7 children, has been a member of the Village Bank of Plateau 2 for a year and a half. She wants to bolster her food service business (at the weekly market) as well as her sales of sugar and oil. The food served takes place on the market days in that locality.

Her income allows her to help support her family. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months, in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sugar, oil, and condiments

loans.name: Ponlork

texts.en:
Mr. Ponlork N., 35, and his wife, Mrs. Sopheak Khorn, 34 live in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1994 and have four children: three sons who are learning Khmer traditional music and one young daughter.

Ponlork has been a musician for nine years. He wants to create another business producing rice wine to get extra income for his family. His wife has been selling fish and raising pigs for three years. Ponlork also assists his wife in raising pigs when he has free time. He is requesting a loan of US$ 600 to purchase raw materials for producing rice wine.

loans.use: To purchase materials for producing rice wine.

loans.name: Dele

texts.en:
Dele is 46 years old and married with 4 children.

She is a hairstylist who also sells weaveons and hair extensions. She hopes to expand this business. In order to do so, she needs a loan of N50,000 to purchase more weaveons and hair extensions to sell. She hopes this will help to attract more customers to her shop.

Dele is a client of LAPO. She says thank you to all who will make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more weavons and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Pik

texts.en: Mrs. P. is 35 years old and her husband's name is Ruon, aged 31. They currently live in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. P. raises oxen for its offspring, and she also uses them for her rice farming business. Her husband is a local construction worker, and they are currently earning approximately $5 each day. The couple now cares for three children, all of them are still young and are enrolled in primary school. P. and her husband work hard at the business everyday for daily income to make sure their children receive the highest education. P. has requested a loan to buy a second-hand motorcycle for the family's riding needs.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle for the family.

loans.name: Alimatu

texts.en: Alimatu S. is 47 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. Through this business, Alimatu has supported two of her children to finish senior high school, and the others are currently in school. Alimatu lives with her husband, who is a security man, together with their children. She is a food vendor and sells kenkey as well as maize, something she has done for twenty years. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked, and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers, because many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, as well as firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education. Alimatu belongs to a village bank called ‘Jordan’. She also hope to receive GH800 to develop her business by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, as well as firewood.

loans.name: Adhiambo

texts.en:
Adhiambo F. O. is a 19-year-old mother of one child, aged 6 months. Her husband is currently looking for work, so F. sells fast-food items like chips, mandazi (like donuts) and chai to support her family.

Adhiambo lives and works in the Nyamasaria slum, and she buys her goods from the main market in downtown Kisumu. She says the biggest challenge she faces right now is meeting the demands of her customers because she currently doesn’t have the capital to keep up her stock. She also hopes to help her husband set up a kiosk to sell paraffin (kerosene) near her own kiosk. She is asking for 50,000 shillings.

loans.use: To buy food items to sell and to set up a kerosene kiosk

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en: Hidaya B. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. She runs a business selling traditional clothes (kanga and vitenge) at Mbagala ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the clothes from Mnazi Mmoja traditional clothes shopping center, from the wholesale shops, and sells retail to customers at Mbagala. She has been in the business for five years. She needs to borrow 1,200,000 Tanzania shillings to buy more business items to meet the demand.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for retail

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha E. is 45 years old. She is married and has given birth to six children: one son and five daughters. She says some of her children are in the polytechnic, senior high and junior high schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

Martha works to support her husband financially to provide for the family. Martha’s husband is a commercial driver while she is a trader. She trades in all kinds of cereals such as maize, beans, etc. Martha procures the goods all the way from Ejura in the northern sector. She sells at the local market to food vendors and retailers. Martha has been in business for 14 years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure cereals

loans.name: Kajogo

texts.en:
Kajogo M. is currently in the business of selling bread and groundnuts (peanuts) and is requesting a loan to buy more groundnuts to make paste to sell. Kajogo is 22 years old and is married with a husband that is an army officer. She has one child and her child does not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts

loans.name: Soltan

texts.en: Soltan

loans.use: To purchase 5 baby calves

loans.name: Avau

texts.en:
Avau I., 41, is married with five children. She has six years of experience in the plantation and vegetable garden business. She sells to the general public six days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala. She has three previous loans with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Avau I.’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of the loan will be used for home improvement.

loans.use: To purchase taro tops, chemicals, vegetable seeds, fertilizer, cement, timber and iron roofing

loans.name: Haitgul

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
     Хайтгул – молодая женщина 25 лет, замужем но пока детей не имеет. Её муж занимается купле -продажей скота на скотном рынке. А она откармливает крупнорогатый скот дома. Она помогает мужу в развитии его бизнеса, потому что хочет иметь больше прибыли, чтобы расширять семью, так как Хайтгул готовится стать матерью. За счет займа Хайтгул и её муж хотят увеличить количество скота и  получить больше прибыли. Хайтгул кредитуется в нашей организации два года. Это ее четвертый займ за этот период. Хайтгул всегда целенаправленно использует свой займ и поэтому она смогла помочь мужу для увеличения количества своего скота. Она благодарит нас и КИВУ за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Haitgul is a young 25-year-old woman. She is married and does not yet have children. Her husband is involved in buying and selling livestock at a livestock market. And she feeds cattle at home. Haitgul helps her husband with developing his business because she wants to have more profit in order to expand their family, especially since Haitgul is getting ready to become a mother. Haitgul and her husband want to use this loan to increase their livestock quantity and make a bigger profit. Haitgul has been a client of our organization for two years. This is her fourth loan during this time period. Haitgul always uses her loans purposefully and because of this, she has been able to help her husband in increasing quantity of livestock. She thanks us and Kiva for the financial support.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing livestock quantity

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Mom Ouch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people living in Chrouy Slaeng village in Takeo province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Srey Mom O. is the twenty-six-year-old village bank president. She owns a small grocery store. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery products to sell. Her husband, Mr. Kim Chanthorn, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land for cultivating rice. He also uses a motorbike with a cA. to transport goods as well as to convey passengers for additional income. This couple has a child who is too young to work or study. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients stA. to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
pili is a member of the Furaha borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 42 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 5 children.Her children are aged 29,22,16,13,3 years.

Pili started her own business selling charcoal 4 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly  profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Pili`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Pili hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pottery and sandals.

loans.name: Brak

texts.en: Brak S. is 49 years old and resides with her husband in the Siem Reap province. She is a good house wife cooking for the family members. Her husband is a construction worker who typically makes US$4 every day. This couple has six children, one of who is a soldier and five are students. Brak S. is asking for a loan of US$600 to purchase a motorbike for a family transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Prak N., 53, is a widow and lives with two of her children in Takeo province. To earn a living, she has been selling traditional medicines and is able to make US$4 of profit ever day. She is also supported by one of her children who work as a construction worker and typically makes US$3 per day.

Prak N. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase more medicines to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene A. is from the village of Tagulalo, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 30 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Arlene owns and operates a business selling fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Arlene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to improved and expand her business. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to pay for the tuition of her children. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Federick

texts.en:
Federick A. is currently in the business of purchasing and selling sugar and is requesting a loan to expand her business and buy more items like salt, rice, and so on to sell.  Federick is 40 years old and married to a husband who is a storekeeper. She has eight children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children up to university level.
