BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business and buy more products to sell

loans.name: Roquesa

texts.en:
Roquesa O. is from the village of Quiboro, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old. Roquesa is married and has 9 school-aged children.

To make a living, Roquesa provides transport services to local community members. Roquesa has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2008, Roquesa joined HSPFI to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roquesa successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI which she used for maintenance for her two motorcycles.

Roquesa is requesting her fifth loan, for 16000 PHP, which she will use to purchase materials needed to provide better service.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani is a 48-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Hani has been spraying all types and forms of aluminum for 11 years.

Hani requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to expand the specialized oven he uses in his work. His clients are stakeholders and relatives; his special work experience and the absence of competitors have been advantages in his business.

In the future, he plans on improving and expanding his business and income through finding a bigger place to work.

loans.use: To expand his oven.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
M. Abdoulaye D. est un commerçant, agé de 38 ans et demeurant à Bambey, une communauté rurale distante environs de 100km vers l'est du Dakar.  UIMCEC y a ouvrit une caisse en Juillet 2009 pour mieux servir les clients ruraux.  L'élevage de moutons est une activité secondaire pour lui, lequel lui permets de diversifier ses revenus.  Son oncle lui a laissé son propre élevage en 2002 qu'il gère depuis et a pris goût au métier  
Avec le crédit de 150,000 FCFA, M. D. peut profiter de la chute du prix des moutons après la fête de Tabaski, la fête Islamique du sacrifice.  Il est marié et père de trois enfants entre un et six ans.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye D. is a 38-year-old shopkeeper and lives in Bambey, a rural community about 100 km to the east of Dakar. UIMCEC (one of Kiva's field partners) started a local loan fund in Bambey in July 2009 to better serve rural clients. The raising of sheep is a secondary activity for Mr. D., and allows him to diversify his income. His uncle left him his own sheep-rearing business in 2002, which he has managed since, and he has taken a liking to this job. With this loan of 150,000 FCFA, Mr. D. can profit from the drop in the price of sheep after the celebration of Tabaski, the Islamic day of sacrifice. He is married and the father of three children who are between 1 and 6 years old.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Menime

texts.en:
Menime S. is 27 and married with 2 children (ages 5 and 10).  She is starting a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Menime needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 111 tala or US $46 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Menime joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Menime's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Menime S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2.1 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.5 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Juncel

texts.en:
Juncel R. is from San Roque, Ozamiz City. He is 30 years old, is single, and has one infant child. Juncel owns and operates a business providing Internet services in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Juncel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 45,000 PHP from GDMPC. Juncel is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be his sixth from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is married with two daughters. She is an entrepreneur from Novaya Kahovka where she sells children’s clothing in one of the local malls called “Tsentralnyi”. Lubov was forced to launch her own enterprise 15 years ago when the whole country was struck by economic collapse. She managed to consistently grow and develop her startup and achieved its consistent expansion. Currently, Lubov has about 25,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. Her net profit amounts to 6,500 Grivnyas a month.  

Lubov is requesting a 15,000-Grivnya loan to increase her turnover capital. She always says she is ready to excel to please her customer. We believe the way Lubov makes her clients feel will determine her further success, encouraging new customers to buy from her.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Delma

texts.en: Delma, age 38, is a married woman from Agusan Del Sur. Together with her husband, she maintains five hectares of rice field. She also runs a small store to have extra earnings. She wants her business to prosper, so she works hard to achieve prosperity. She recently joined CEVI to gain access to its program and other opportunities. She asked for a loan of PHP 6,000, which she will use to buy farm supplies, such as seeds and fertilizers. She will also acquire additional supplies for her store.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm, and additional supplies for her store

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en: Romeo O.'s main source of income comes from providing internet services in his community. He is 32 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the city of Arellano Extension, Tuguegarao City. Romeo has been in his business for over four years and earns approximately 35,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Romeo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Romeo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from ASKI. He is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be his third loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Insaf

texts.en:
Insaf, who lives in Azoun village next to Qalqilia city, is the mother of one baby girl and runs a poultry farm with her husband. They breed different types of birds such as chicken and doves to sell. She and her husband started building their own house a couple of years ago. Due to a money shortage, the building has been suspended. Since they already have the farm, Insaf thought of taking a loan to improve it and buy a bigger number of poultry to increase the flock and be able to sell to villages around Azoun.  This will help them continue building the house.

Insaf's husband works in a tile and marble factory besides having the farm.  She tells us that Azoun is suffering from a financial crisis and their farm is the only farm in the village.

Insaf and her family appear in the picture above.

loans.use: To improve the farm and buy more poultry to breed

loans.name: Lawenignina

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur est un informaticien de formation, il a ouvert une boutique de vente en détail de matériel informatique qu’il a appelé « PROTON ELECTRONIQUE », il fait ce commerce depuis 2003 et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Voulant augmenter son stock, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de divers consommables informatiques et assurer le transport des marchandises.
Il est marié et père de 3 enfants.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a trained computer specialist, who opened a retail shop for computer–related equipment he named “Proton Electronique”. He has been running this business since 2003 and gets his supplies in Lomé. Wanting to increase his stock supply, he is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy various computer consumables and ensure transportation of the merchandise. He is married and the father of three children.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy computer consumables

loans.name: Melida Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Melida J. es socia del  banco Corazones Unidos ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca, urbe considerada la más bella del país por su arquitectura y su belleza natural, sus calles empedradas, sus ríos serpenteados, agraciados balcones de hierro, y bellos jardines forman parte de la atmósfera afable de esta ciudad histórica que atrae al turista nacional y extranjero.

 Nuestra socia  es casada tiene 36 años y  concibió  cinco  hijos de 14, 13, 10, 8 y 2 años, sus dos primeros hijos estudian  en el colegio y los dos  menores en una escuela de la ciudad;  su esposo trabaja como mensajero de una empresa y ella a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo hace tres años, además limpia oficinas hace ya cuatro años, gracias al  esfuerzo del trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Se encuentra en el cuarto crédito en la fundación y fue invitada por su cuñada a formar parte de este hermoso grupo, los crédito obtenidos ha invertido en la compra de mercadería,  con su nuevo crédito va a comprar  cremas, tratamientos, bases, labiales,  y más cosméticos para su exigente clientela.

Su meta es comprase un auto  para entregar la mercadería a domicilio lo más pronto posible.
texts.en:
Sra. Melida J. is a member of the Communal Bank “Corazones Unidos” (United Hearts), which is located in the city of Cuenca, considered to be the most beautiful city in Ecuador because of its architecture and natural beauty. The cobblestone streets, winding rivers, detailed wrought iron balconies, and beautiful gardens shape the friendly atmosphere that attracts domestic and foreign tourists to this historical city.

Melida is 36 years old, married, and has five children (ages 14, 13, 10, 8, and 2). The two oldest children are high school students, while the next two children attend an elementary school in the city. Her husband works for a company as a messenger. Melida has been selling cosmetics through a catalog for three years. In addition, she has been cleaning offices for four years. Thanks to her hard work and that of her husband, they have been able to build their own home.

Melida is receiving her fourth loan from the Foundation. Her sister-in-law invited her to join this wonderful group. She invested her previous loans in the purchase of merchandise. This new loan will be used to buy crèmes, treatments, foundation, lipsticks, and other types of cosmetics for her demanding customers.

Her goal is to buy an automobile as soon as possible so that she can use it to carry her merchandise home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase crèmes, treatments, foundation, lipsticks, and other types of cosmetics

loans.name: Lidia Johanna

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 32 años de edad y tiene un a carpintería en su casa de habitación.  Inicio hace 14 meses con fondos propios y ayuda de su esposo quien está en los estados unidos y le envió dinero para poder impulsar el negocio.

Lidia ha beneficiado de préstamos en el pasado y con estos préstamos ha podido invertir en su negocio y sacarles provecho.

Lidia esta casada y tiene un hijo de 14 años.  Los metas de su negocio son ampliar mas el taller comprando maquinas industriales y al ves, ampliar su clientela y crear más empleos.
texts.en:
Lidia is 32 years old. She has a carpentry shop in her home. She began four months ago with her own funds and help from her husband. He is in the United Starts, and he sends her money so that she is able to operate the business. Lidia has benefited from loans in the past. With the loans she was able to invest in her business and get more earnings. Lidia is married and has a 14 year old son. The goal for her business are to expand her shop by purchasing industrial machines. Other goals are to increase her customers and create more jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy Pochote and Guanacaste wood

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en:
A. Suzan is thirty-five years old, she is married and blessed with four children who are all studying in primary schools. A. Suzan owns a unique drug shop in Ociba Coast and she has been running the business for the last three years. 

She will use the loan to purchase a variety of drugs to sell to her clients. She is a hardworking business woman whose dream is to stock more drugs to sell.

loans.use: To purchase variety of drugs to sell to her clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Blanca Dalide

texts.es:
Blanca de 38 años, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas en disolución), ella vende almuerzo en su casa para trabajadores del sector por donde vive. 

Para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares ella comenzó a vender almuerzos por el sector donde vive, como se le fue incrementando la clientela y al no tener dinero para un local, utilizo el comedor de su casa para atender a sus clientes, poco a poco se le ha incrementado la clientela, vende platos típicos. 

Para poder construir mejor su casa y que sus clientes estén mas cómodos, ella quiere comprar con el préstamo bloques, cemento. En el futuro quiere formalizar el negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca is 38 years old and lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil (a suburban zone with dirt roads and eroding hills). She sells lunch from her home, to the workers in her sector. She began selling lunch in her sector in order to help her husband with the family expenses. As her clientele began to increase, she did not have enough money for a food stall, so she began user her dining room to serve her customers. She sells typical dishes and has increased her clientele little by little. She wants to buy cinder blocks and cement so that she can make some improvements to her home so that her customers will have a more comfortable place. She plans to formalizer her business in future.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es: Eugenio es de 49 años de edad, es casado, tiene cinco hijos un varón y cuatro mujeres, se dedica a confeccionar playeras de diferentes estilos y tallas, en la actividad tiene aproximadamente ocho años, con la ayuda de su esposa han salido adelante, solicita su primer préstamo para aumentar su capital de trabajo en tela y material de confección, sus referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable y trabajador.
texts.en:
Eugenio, 49, is married and has five children, one boy and four girls. He makes t-shirts in different styles and sizes. He has been in this line of work for about 8 years. With help from his wife they have managed to succeed. He is asking for his first loan to increase his working capital buying fabric and sewing supplies. His personal references indicate that he’s a responsible and hard working person.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en: Nuon P., 55, lives in Phnom Penh. She is a crop farmer growing rice, vegetables, and some fruit on her own farmland. She is married and has three children who live together in the family home. To facilitate the work on the farm, her husband works frequently alongside her. In addition, Nuon P.'s husband takes time to operate a motor-taxi service. Growing crops is something with which the couple has had great success. They are able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Nuon P. is looking for a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticides, and seeds.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticides, and seeds.

loans.name: Liv

texts.en:
Liv L., 36, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. L. sells clothes for an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband operates his truck to sell goods everywhere around the province, earning an income of USD 10 per day.

 L. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more goods to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. L. appears in the photograph wearing a black shirt.

loans.use: buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Dilovarsho

texts.en: V. Dilovarsho has always been a hardworking man who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread. He is married with four children. Dilovarsho has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foods. With a small amount of starting capital, Dilovarsho began this enterprise 10 years ago. Thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he has expanded his business and today his whole family is engaged in this business. Dilovarsho needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of goods he is selling. He is requesting a loan of 6,500 somoni for this purpose. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while, to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea C., 53, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. She makes a living selling beverages and food, earning an average of $5 per day. Her husband raises pigs, earning an income of $2 per day. The family has to spend $75 a month on food, $3 for electricity, and $30 to educate their children. C. is applying for a loan of $1,200 to buy more beverages and food to sell to her customers. In the future, she would like to use the profits she makes from her work to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. We see C. in the photograph with her daughter.

loans.use: buy more beverages and food to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El señor  Daniel P. Q. tiene 19 años de edad es conviviente con la señora Clementina Zambrana, Montaño tienen un hijito de 9 meses, viven en Colomi Comunidad Palta Loma hacia el norte.      
                                                                                                      El señor Daniel P. se dedica a la actividad agrícola produce papa, oca, papaliza anualmente y lleva a comercializar en los días de feria semanal de Colomi, aparte tiene 2 cabezas de ganado vacuno (yunta) que los utiliza en las faenas agrícolas y una lechera, el necesita un préstamo para comprar abono orgánico (gallinaza) mas una cabeza de ganado vacuno, por lo que se apersono a solicitar un crédito, por último el señor Daniel  nos dice que su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida y tener ingresos mejores a futuro. y así poder mantener de lo mejor a su familia que tiene por delante.
texts.en:
Daniel P. Q. is 19 years old. He lives together with Clementina Zambrana Montaño, and they have a little 9-month-old child. They live in Colomi, in the Palta Loma community toward the north. 

Daniel P. works in agriculture, growing potatoes, oca (yams) and papa lisa (ulluco) each year. He takes them to sell during the weekly market days in Colomi. In addition, he has 2 heads of working cattle which he uses for agricultural tasks, as well as a milk cow. He needs the loan to buy organic fertilizer (chicken manure), as well as another cow. For this reason, he came in to request a loan. Finally, Daniel reports that his dream is to improve his quality of life and have a better income for the future, so that he can provide as well as possible for his growing family.

loans.use: Buying organic fertilizer for his farm and another cow

loans.name: Lolango Plus Group

texts.en:
Bedi L., aged 38 and married, is the president of the Community Bank named “Lolango Plus,” which consists of 21 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Bedi started her business in 1999. She has been running a restaurant located west of the city of Kinshasa. She is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC who has already received five different loans and has repaid them properly. 

She intends to use the next loan to increase the stock of her restaurant by buying one sack of flour, two bags of sugar, and beans with the aim of increasing profits. Each week, her business brings in a profit of $60. 

Her ambition is to open a big restaurant in her area. Bedi has four children whose ages are between 8 and 20 years old. All of them go to school.

loans.use: Increasing the stock of her restaurant by buying flour, beans and other goods

loans.name: Rose Wanjiru

texts.en:
Rose is 50 years old and married to James N.. They have three children and her spouse contributes towards the family income. She has been running her shop for 16 years with an income of Kshs 11,500 per month. 

She has a good history with KADET and is applying for her third loan which she intends to use to buy stock of flour, bar soaps, and liquid detergent to sell. She hopes to buy a piece of land for the family.

loans.use: To buy flour, bar soap, and detergent to resell

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.pt:
Olímpia J. nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, viúva mãe de uma rapariga de 24 anos de idade já casada. Vive na casa propria e para alem da sua filha responsabiliza se pela sua neta e pelas sua  duas sobrinhas que vivem com ela em sua casa.

Olímpia J. perde o pai muito cedo, inicia com os estudos e faz a 7ª classe, esta fica grávida e consequentemente seu marido perde a vida. Isso causa um conflito familiar devido a herança, ela decide voltar para casa dos pais. Começa a praticar pequenos negócios com o fundo da indemnização do seu falecido esposo, vendendo tomate na esquina perto da sua casa, no período da manhã e no período da tarde ia a escola. Através do pequeno negócia consegue reabilitar a casa da sua mãe e constrói a sua própria casa e uma banca no mesmo quintal. Hoje é proprietária de um estabelecimento comercial onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade tais como (arroz, cebola, batata, amendoim, sapatos e chinelos) adquiridos na Suazilândia gastando uma média de 10.000.00mt em cada viagem e tendo de lucro 7.000.00mt.

Este é o quinto empréstimo de Olímpia na Hluvuku e terceiro com Kiva no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar (arroz, cebola, batata, amendoim, sapatos e chinelos) para aumentar a quantidade dos seus produtos. O primeiro de 5.000.00mt foi usado para concluir mínimas partes do estabelecimento, os restantes de (10.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt e 20.000.00mt) para aumentar e manter o volume dos seus produtos.

 Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para construir um botequim para venda de sapatos e chinelos separando com os produtos comestíveis.
texts.en:
Olímpia J. was born in the Namaacha District, in the Maputo Province, South Mozambique. She is a widow and the mother of a 24 year old young lady who is already married. She lives in her own house and besides her daughter she supports her granddaughter and two nieces who live with her. 

Olímpia lost her father very early. She started school and concluded 7th grade. She then became pregnant and lost her husband. Her husband's loss and inheritance caused conflict in the family so she went back to her parents' house. She started a small business with the money received from her husband's passing. She sold tomatoes in a corner close to her house in the mornings and went to school in the afternoon. With her small business she was able to renovate her mother's home and build her own house and a stand in the same lot. Today she owns a store where she sells staples (rice, onions, potatoes, peanuts, shoes and sandals) purchased in Swaziland. She spends on average 10,000 meticais in each trip and has a profit of 7,000 meticais.

This loan, in the amount of 20,000 meticais is her fifth loan with Hluvuku and third with Kiva. She intends to purchase rice, onions, potatoes, peanuts, shoes and sandals to increase her inventory. Her first loan, for 5,000 was used to finish the store and the remaining loans, for 10,000, 15,000 and 20,000 were used to increase and maintain the volume of her inventory. 

She is confident she will pay the loan back ahead of time and request a new loan to build a separate store to sell shoes and sandals away from the groceries

loans.use: Purchase of inventory (rice, onions, potatoes, peanuts, shoes and sandals)

loans.name: Mak's Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people are requestiing a village loan; they are located in Preaek Char village in Kandal province. Mrs. Mak K. is 45 years old and was selected as the village bank president by the group's members. While each member of this village will use his/her portion of the loan to support a different purpose. 

Mrs. Mak K. and her husband, Mr. Pum Pe, are farmers who own 1.50-hectare rice field.  They do not have enough money to cultivate it so she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and gasoline to grow rice. The couple has six children, one of whom is seamstress in a garment factory, two of whom are construction workers, and four of whom are students who also help their parents with the farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and gasoline to grow rice

loans.name: Rovinson

texts.en:
Rovinson is 46 years old.  He lives near the city of Reque, which is 15 minutes south of the major northern city of Chiclayo, located in the vast costal desert of northern Peru.  The area is located along a river and the pan-American Highway, which provides significant trade and agricultural opportunities.  Rovinson lives alone and has no children.

Rovinson operates a mototaxi, providing transport services to locals and for cargo as necessary.  He owns the mototaxi.  In addition, Rovinson is a member of the neighborhood security force and acts as a coordinator for the region.  He is proud of his work and community service, assisting his neighbors in meeting their needs and protecting their persons and property.

This will be his first experience with a financial institution.  He has good personal and business references.  Rovinson plans to use the loan funds to continue growing within the realm of transport and potentially change his mototaxi.

loans.use: To continue growing within the realm of transport and potentially change his mototaxi.

loans.name: Annonciatha

texts.en: Annonciatha is 39 years old, married and has one child who is 10 years old. She has made a living as a tailor for the last five years and makes clothing for both women and men who live in her area. She also makes school uniforms for young children. She works from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day, and also trains young men and women to become tailors so that they can have a marketable skill. She has applied for this loan to buy more sewing materials for his workshop.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a tailor shop

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol, D. 38 años, vive en casa D. sus suegros junto a su esposo, Pedro. Ambos tienen dos hijos adolescentes, quienes aún estudian. Hace más D. 4 años está trabajadora madre D. familia, se dedica a L. venta D. gas, actividad que lo realiza en su mismo domicilio. DesD. entonces se dedica en L. distribución D. los balones D. gas al domicilio D. sus clientes, quienes requieren del servicio. Por otro lado, trabaja en L. municipalidad D. su distrito D. esa manera se asegura un ingreso extra. Es así que sus hijos L. apoyan, cuando las veces que trabaja en L. municipalidad, ellos se dedican D. hacer el pedido D. gas, D. esa manera  buscan mejorar su calidad D. vida. ElL. está muy contenta con su nuevo trabajo, pero a L. vez todas las tardes no descuida D. su negocio; Como es una mujer emprendedora en adelante anheL. ampliar su negocio y sobre todo comprarse una moto lineal para distribuir gas con mayor rapidez. Es el 11avo crédito con MFP, y se compromete a ser responsable con el pago D. sus cuotas, pues como es líder D. su banco comunal, debe ser ejemplo, asimismo podrá acceder a otros créditos fácilmente. D. obtener el crédito que solicita, podrá incrementar más balones D. gas, para así auto sostener su negocio.
texts.en: Marisol is 38 years old and lives in her in-laws' home with her husband Pedro. They have teen-aged children who are in school. For more than four years this hardworking family has been selling gas which they sell out of their home. Since then, they have engaged in the distribution of gas tanks to the homes of customers who require service. She also works in the municipality of her district which ensures that she will have extra income. When she is working for the municipality her children help with the gas orders thus they are searching for a better quality of life. She is very happy with her new job but at the same time she does not neglect her business in the evenings. Because she is an enterprising woman she hopes to expand her business in the future and above all to buy a motorbike so that she can more quickly distribute gas. This is her 11th loan with field partner MFP and she promises to be responsible with her payments because she is the leader of her community bank she has to set an example and so she can access other loans. With the loan she is requesting she will be able to increase her gas tanks so that her business can be self-sustaining.

loans.use: Purchase more gas tanks.

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en:
Ramiz A. is a 33-year-old man from Bilasuvar. He is married and the loving father of two children. After the birth of his daughter, Ceyran, and his son, Nusrat, life became harder for the young family. 

Ramiz decided to start a cattle-breeding business. His wife does household chores and also helps him in the business. He has been doing this business for about four years and now his normal monthly income is around 300 AZN. Ramiz sells dairy in the local bazaar. 

There were two cows in his farm but diligent Ramiz didn't want to stop there. That is why he requested a loan of 1800 AZN from AqroInvest and Kiva to buy four more cows. This is his first loan. Ramiz dreams of buying a piece of land for a larger farm.

loans.use: To buy four cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy corn in bulk to make tortillas

loans.name: Ferida

texts.en: Ferida G. is currently in the business of selling clothes. She is 26 years old, married to a driver, and has three children, all of whom go to school. G. requested a loan in order to stock more clothes to sell. She hopes to expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: To buy more inventory of clothes to sell

loans.name: Mujeres En Acción Group

texts.es:
La señora María M., del km 12 Acaray, Asentamiento Bello Horizonte de Ciudad del Este, contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona.
El comité se denomina “Mujeres en Acción”, está en el Octavo Ciclo con 11 integrantes. Es un grupo muy unido, solidario y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas, realizan actividades de recaudación de fondos, como también de motivación, y pretenden terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento de responsabilidad con la institución.
La sra. Juliana, por ejemplo, se dedica a la venta de bebidas, ella provee generalmente para fiestas de cumpleaños, bodas o festejos varios que se realizan en su zona, es muy conocida por la buena calidad que ofrece, pero su meta es aumentar dicha calidad, y aumentar variedad a su negocio, por ello solicita el préstamo de Kiva, esperando contar con su ayuda financiera.
texts.en:
María M., from km 12 Acaray, Asentamiento Bello Horizonte in Ciudad del Este, contacted her neighbors and friends to form a committee in their area. 
The committee is named “Mujeres en Acción”. The group is on its 8th cycle with 11 members. The group is very united, supportive and responsible. The members have a great enterprising spirit. They stay up to date with their payments by working to collect funds to repay the loans, with motivation and they want to try to finish this cycle responsibly with institution.
Juliana, for example, sells drinks. She usually provides drinks for birthday parties, weddings, or other celebrations in the area. She is very well known for the good service she offers. However, her goal is to improve her quality and add some variety to her business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Kiva and she hopes she will receive financial help.

loans.use: to buy beer, soft drinks, cider, juices, etc.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija is married and has three children, two boys and one girl. Two of children are still in school while the third is married. For the last four years, she has made a living in her home, selling soft drinks to neighbors and passersby.  She is applying for this loan from Kiva and Yehu to improve her living standards by buying a refrigerator in which she can store drinks before sale. In the future, she dreams of opening a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator in which to store soft drinks before sale.

loans.name: Agulu

texts.en: L. is currently in business selling soft drinks. She is 38 years old, married, with four children and two of them go to school. L. borrowed a loan to stock more soft drinks to sell. She hopes to build a house for rent in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Belenda

texts.en:
Belenda D. is from the village of Macupa in Tangub City. She is 36 years old. Belenda is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Belenda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer trabajadora D. 28 años D. edad, ella vive junto a su esposo, en la parte rural del distrito D. TambogranD. – Piura, en una comunidad  D. condición humilD. pero con muchos deseos D. superación.

Ana se dedica a la crianza D. ganado ovino y aves D. corral los cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local. Su esposo es agricultor y la apoya en las actividades que Ana realiza. Existe una buena relación en la pareja, ambos contribuyen con los gastos del hogar.

Ana solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles que utilizará para la compra D. alimento balanceado para el engorD. D. sus ovinos y aves D. corral. Esto le permitirá venderlos a un mejor precio y por lo tanto seguir creciendo económicamente.
texts.en:
Ana is a hard-working 28 year-old woman who lives together with her husband in the rural part of TambogranD. district - Piura.  She lives in a community which is a poor one but has a great desire to improve.

Ana raises and fattens sheep and poultry which she then sells in her local market.  Her husband is a farmer and supports her in her business activities.  The couple have a good relationship and they both contribute towards their household expenses.

Ana is requesting a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed with which to fatten her sheep and poultry.  This will allow her to sell them at a better price and she will therefore be able to continue growing financially.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals

loans.name: Edis Argentina

texts.es:
Edis, vive con sus dos hijos D. 16 y 12 años D. edad, se dedica al comercio D. granos básicos y frutas, tiene 5 años D. tener el negocio y trabaja en lo propio D. lunes a sábado.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo  para invertirlo en maíz, frijol, azúcar, café, y frutas, manzanas, bananos, sandias, peras, para fortalecer el negocio y tener mayor inventario para ofrecer a los clientes.
Su objetivo es mejorar económicamente, dar a sus hijos la oportunidad D. la educación para que puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Edis lives with her two children, ages 16 and 12.  She sells basic grains and fruit and has been in business for five years.  She works Monday through Saturday.

She has requested a loan to buy corn, beans, sugar, coffee and fruit: apples, bananas, watermelon and pears, to strengthen her business and offer more inventory to customers.

Her goal is to improve economically and give her children a good education so they can be successful.

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, sugar, coffee, fruit, apples and bananas.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en: 58-year-old Daniela is a farmer from the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. She grows rice and corn to sell. Daniela is a widow. She works hard to provide for the needs of her children. She requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm materials. Daniela hopes to have an abundant harvest. She also hopes to have her own capital someday.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm materials.

loans.name: Saldivar Poty Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres, Saldivar Poty, se conformo gracias a que la actual Directora General. la Sra.Maria, quien se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de artículos de limpieza, contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para enterarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras,una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 13º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Ellas se consideran mujeres emprendedoras, que luchan por brindarle a sus familias un techo y una vida digna y decorosa.
La Sra. Maria se dedica a la elaboración de productos de limpieza desde hace ya varios años. Ella misma se encarga de la elaboración de sus productos y luego de venderlos. Posee un pequeño puesto, el cual algún día le gustaría ampliar.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de los materiales para la elaboración de los productos de limpieza, tales como jabones, esencias, colorantes y demás.
texts.en: The Saldivar Poty group was formed thanks to current general director Maria, who makes a living making and selling cleaning supplies. She contacted an adviser at a weekly meeting in the area about working with the Women's Entrepreneur Committee. Once she learned more about the program she was able to bring together 17 women who are now passionately working jointly and with solidarity on their 13th loan cycle with the program. They consider themselves to be enterprising women who fight to provide their families with a dignified and decent life. Maria has made a living making cleaning supplies for a number of years. She is in charge of the production and then later sells the products. She has a small sales post that she would like to expand some day. She is requesting the loan to purchase materials like soaps, scents, colorings and other items to make her cleaning products.

loans.use: To purchase materials, such as soaps, scents, colorings and other items,  to make cleaning products.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es: El señor Wilson, oriundo de Agua y Castilla  del departamento de  Chuquisaca, estado civil soltero, su actividad es de albañil, esta prestando su servicio en la ciudad de santa cruz en un condominio, el sr. Wilson  esta agradecido con nuestra entidad por haber confiado en el y brindarle un apoyo para poder obtener una línea de moto taxi y así obtener otra fuente de ingreso y una mejor calidad de vida, es un joven trabajador con ganas de superación.
texts.en:
Wilson, a native of Agua y Castilla in the department of Chuquisaca, is single and works as a mason. He is currently working at a condominium in the city of Santa Cruz.

Wilson is grateful to Emprender for having confidence in him and offering him support so that he can obtain a moto-taxi line and thereby have another source of income and a better quality of life. He is a young man with a desire for self-improvement.

loans.use: to buy a moto-taxi line

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 19 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Marites has a retail shop where she sells electronic loads for several networks like GLOBE & SMART. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional electronic loads to sell.

Marites is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marites hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional electronic loads to sell.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Heng, 32, is married and lives with his wife and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. His children are school-aged.  Heng grows short-cycle crops, such as corn and rice and sells his products in the wholesale market. With the loan he plans to buy corn and rice seeds and fertilizer. 

The loan helps him economically to meet his needs. He is up against challenges such as crop plagues and lack of money to hire more workers. So Heng would like to borrow some funds through Kiva for the purpose of purchasing seeds and fertilizer. His dream is to send all his children to study at a high level.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nakree

texts.en: Nakree is 30 years old, and is a farmer. Her husband is a motor taxi driver, their income is $5 per day. She has one child; he is four years old. Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $5 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a Tok-Tok for her husband to run a Tok Tok service, so that he can make a better income. She hopes her husband's career can improve so that she can have enough money for repairing her house.

loans.use: To buy a Tok-Tok for her husband to run a Tok-Tok service

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es: Ana María D. 41 años D. edad, madre soltera, vive con sus tres hijos y posee un chalet en la cercanía a su casa. El negocio se haya instalado en una localidad muy concurrida D. personas, venD. pupusas, gaseosas, jugos dulces y otros, todo D. muy buena calidad, higiénico, a un buen precio y con un servicio excelente; Ana María es una mujer activa y positiva, con ganas D. salir adelante, ella piensa que con perseverancia se mueven montañas y es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz, frijoles, chicharrón,  queso, bebidas, golosinas, para D. esta forma satisfacer la necesidad D. los clientes que han demandado mas sus productos en los últimos días y ver crecer el negocio. Ana María tiene la esperanza que con su esfuerzo logrará darle a su familia seguridad económica y una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Ana María , 41, is a single mother and she lives with her three children and she has a bungalow near her house.  She has set up a business in her area that is very popular. She sells pupusas (typical food of El Salvador-tortillas stuffed with cheese, beans, or pork and grilled), soft drinks, juices, and more.  All her food is good quality, clean, reasonably priced, and she offers excellent service.

Ana María is an active and positive woman who wants to get ahead.  She thinks that you can move mountains with perseverance and that is why she decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL that will help her buy corn, beans, pork skins, cheese, drinks, and sweets.  This way she can give her customers what they want in their latest requests for products, and it will enable her business to grow.

Ana María  has hopes that with effort she will be able to give her family more financial security and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, pork skins, cheese, drinks and sweets

loans.name: Nouratou

texts.fr:
Nouratou est une femme  âgé(e) de 47ans. Nouratou est mariée à un cambiste. 
Nouratou travaille comme revendeuse de produits cosmétiques et des produits pharmaceutiques depuis 1980. 
Nouratou vend à ses clients dans un marché de la place. Nouratou achète les produits au  NIGERIA 
Nouratou a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des produits pharmaceutiques.
texts.en: Nouratou is a 47-year old woman. She is married to a foreign exchange agent. Nouratou has been working as a vendor of cosmetics and pharmaceutical products since 1980. She sells at the local market. Nouratou stocks up on her products in Nigeria. Nouratou is requesting her second-cycle loan from WAGES in order to buy pharmaceutical products.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and medications

loans.name: Jailobai

texts.ru: Жайлобаю 63 года, женат и имеет 2 детей. Начиная с 1991 года, Жайлобай со своей семьей занимается животноводством и полеводством.  Начав со стартовой суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS), Жайлобай  развил свое хозяйство с бычками, коровами и баранами.  В целях дополнительного источника дохода, по сезону Жайлобай предоставляет услуги комбайнера жителям близлежащих сел. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жайлобай	 обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушу м и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита он планирует вложить в увеличение поголовья, чтобы в будущем иметь возможность купить новый комбайн.
texts.en: Jailobai is 63 years old, he is married and has two children. Beginning in 1991 Jailobai and his family started a business in animal husbandry and agriculture. With a starting capital of 20,000 soms (KGS) Jailobai developed his business with calves, cows and lamb. With a goal to have an additional source of income Jailobai provides a season service of combine-harvester driver to the residents of the nearby villages. To further develop his business Jailobai has come to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy cattle. He plans to invest the profit from the loan to increase the headcount of cattle so that he may be able to buy a new combine in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Vodacom Group

texts.en:
Dorothea, who is in her early 40s, is a widow with three children who are still going to school. She has had a general store for 10 years now. She works from 6:30 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a fairly good profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to increase the store's inventory. Her dream is to one day be able to open a wholesale shop (the one she has is a retail shop).

She will share this loan with her loan group "Vodacom," which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase her store inventory.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: El señor Carlos  es un profesor que trabaja desde hace 10 años tiene edad 56 años. El no tiene hijos dependientes, y en la actualidad cuenta con problemas con su esposa. El señor Carlos trabaja en un colegio muy lejos de su casa que queda a 45 minutos, el se transporta en vehículos de servicio público,  pero a veces no puede llegar a su trabajo cuando hay paros de transporte y bloqueos que son muy frecuente; Carlos tiene un vehículo pero no se encuentra en buenas condiciones, y el cree que podría trabajarlo incluso como de taxi, para ello el necesita un crédito para poder reparar su vehículo y así poder sortear todos los obstáculos que a veces le impiden llegar a su fuente de trabajo, asi como también tener la oportunidad de poder mejorar su calidad de vida .
texts.en: Carlos, 56, is a teacher and has been working for the last ten years.  He has no dependent children and is currently having problems with his wife.  Carlos works at a school that’s quite far from his house; it’s 45 minutes away.  He uses public transportation to get around but sometimes when there are strikes and street demonstrations which are quite frequent he’s unable to get to work.  Carlos owns a car but it’s not in good running order and he thinks that he’d even be able to put it into work as a taxi but to do so he needs a loan to repair it to be able to get around all the obstacles that impede his getting to work as well as having an opportunity to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: María Edith

texts.es: María Edith D. 52 años D. edad, habita en casa propia junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo, hijo y nieto. María se caracteriza por ser una  mujer  trabajadora, responsable y dedicada. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. deliciosas pupusas. Tiene muchos años D. dedicarse al negocio por lo que ya cuenta con muchos clientes fijos. Su negocio está ubicado en un lugar estratégico el cual es muy accesible y transitado. El sueño D. María es ver florecer su negocio por lo que ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra D. la materia prima necesaria (maíz, arroz, queso, chicharon, frijoles, gas propano, etc.), que permita cubrir una mayor demanda D. tal modo que sus ventas se vean aumentadas así como su nivel D. ingresos. D. esta manera espera y confía en Dios que su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia mejoraran.
texts.en:
María Edith, age 52, lives in her own house with her family, which consists of her husband, son, and grandson. María describes herself as a hardworking, responsible and dedicated woman. Her business is making and selling delicious pupusas (stuffed tortillas). She has been involved in this business for many years, which is why she already has a lot of established customers. Her business is located in a strategic location which is very accessible and busy.

María’s dream is to see her business flourish. That’s why she maD. the decision to apply for this loan from INTEGRAL. She will invest the loan in her business by purchasing basic materials (corn, rice, cheese, pork rinds, beans, propane gas, etc.) that will allow her to meet a greater demand so that her sales increase and, along with this, the level of her income. In this way she hopes, God willing, that the quality of life of her and her family improves.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, cheese, pork rinds, beans, propane gas, etc.

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Walter B. trabaja y vive en la ciudad de Ica, el es un hombre soltero de 21 años de edad, el es chófer de una mototaxi, escogió este tipo de negocio porque le gusta transportar gente y porque le sale rentable. Gana aproximadamente S/. 279 nuevos soles semanales, el señor es un hombre trabajador y muy luchador con muchas ganas de sacar a su familia adelante.  

Walter empezó su negocio en el año 2005 en el área de transporte, diariamente trabaja alrededor de 6 horas y 6 días a la semana, recibiendo ayuda de su amigo, gracias al crédito que recibirá lo invertirá en pagar sus primeras cuotas de su propia moto, también su crédito le permite a Walter en pensar en el futuro , el sueña con tener su propia empresa de transporte de mototaxi y con tener un auto propio a un mediano plazo.  Su asesor de crédito piensa que es un excelente cliente y que pagara sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Walter B. works and lives in the city of Ica. He is single, 21 years of age and works as a motorcycle taxi chauffeur. He chose this type of business because he enjoys transporting people and because it is profitable. He earns approximately 279 nuevos soles a week. He is a very hardworking man who very much wants to help his family get ahead.

Walter started his business in the transportation area in the year 2005. He works about six hours a day,  six days a week, receiving help from his friend. Thanks to the loan he will receive, he will be able to make his first payments on his own motorcycle. The loan will also enable Walter to think of the future. He dreams of having his own motorcycle taxi business and of owning his own automobile in the not too distant future. His credit counselor believes he is an excellent client and that he will make his payments promptly.

loans.use: to make some payments on the motorcycle taxi he acquired.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
Feliciana nació en la  ciudad de Zurite de la provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco y ahora vive en la ciudad de Urubamba, ella tiene 33 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos.

Feliciana desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Urubamba, ella se dedica  a la venta de golosinas  en un local alquilado. Ya son seis años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

Feliciana requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería y así de esa forma poder abastecer su puesto de venta. 

Feliciana se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Feliciana pertenece al banco comunal “Tercer Milenio” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Feliciana was born in the city of Zurite in the province of Anta in the department of Cusco and now she lives in the city of Urubamba. She is 33 years old and is married and from this union she has 4 children.

Feliciana's daily economic acivities take place in the city of Urubamba. She works selling candy in a rented facility. She has been in this business for 6 years and it is going very well. Feliciana is asking for a loan in order to buy merchandise and thus in this way be able to supply her candy stand. 

Feliciana is grateful for the opportunity given to her by the granting of a loan and at the same time she promises to make her payments on time. Feliciana belongs to the communal bank Tercer Milenio of the Asociación Arariwa of the city of Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as candy, cookies and other items

loans.name: Nabih

texts.en: Nabih is a 54-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and one school aged child. Hie is the main source of income for the family and works really hard to offer them a fair way of living. He is a professional dentist. He has owned a dental clinic for the past twenty five years and looks forward to further growing his business. His wife is also employed, and works as a teacher in a local school. Today, he’s asking to borrow $1600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renovate and change the interior design of his clinic in order to keep it modern and proper. In the future he plans to take more Kiva loans and purchase additional technological equipment in order to offer his customers a better service.

loans.use: to renovate and change the interior design of his clinic.

loans.name: Horl

texts.en:
Mrs. Horl is a 58-year-old married woman who has been residing in the Baray district. She has been in the agricultural business there. She grows rice crops together with her husband. In addition, Mrs. Horl owns a small store selling mixed products from her house. Now she is blessed with six children, three of whom are already married and live independently. The other three are students and live under her income. 

Mrs. Horl will use this loan to buy potatoes in bulk from local farmers to stock; she will sell them for a profit to tradesmen. She hopes that she will be able to expand and improve her existing businesses.

loans.use: to buy potatoes in bulk from local farmers to stock.

loans.name: Miwawiwe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MIWAWIWE est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Lokossi Tangni, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la septième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de son activité. Lokossi Tangni est âgée de 55 ans et est mariée à un dépanneur du nom de Antoine. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés dont un reste à leur charge. Lokossi Tangni vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant à charge et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Lokossi Tangni n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a quinze ans que Lokossi Tangni prépare de la nourriture (pâte de maïs accompagnée de sauce, etc.) qu'elle vend dans un marché du Bénin. Parallèlement à cette activité, Lokossi Tangni vend du maïs et de la boisson locale. Lokossi Tangni s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Lokossi Tangni sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MIWAWIWE, un septième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Miwawiwe group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of this group, named Lokossi Tangni, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. This is the seventh time that this group is requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to raise the level of their business. 

Lokossi Tangni is 55 years old and is married to a repairman named Antoine. The couple has three children all in school of whom one is still their dependent. Lokossi Tangni lives together with her husband and her dependent child and takes care of the diverse family responsibilities together with her husband. Lokossi Tangni did not go to school. 

For fifteen years Lokossi Tangni has been preparing food (corn dough accompanied by sauce, etc.) which she sells in a market of Bénin. At the same time as this business, Lokossi Tangni sells corn and local drink. Lokossi Tangni gets her supplies in a market of Bénin. 

In seeking to satisfy her clientèle and to grow her business numbers and her income, Lokossi Tangni is requesting together with the other members of the Miwawiwe group, a seventh loan from ALIDé. The previously received loans were well repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn and condiments.

loans.name: Thoeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoeng is a mother of four children. She is a farmer as well as a recycled materials retailer who has been residing in the Prey Chor district of Kampong Cham province. Her husband shares responsibility for the family by providing construction services. 

At this time, Mrs. Thoeng will use her second loan from Kiva to build a bathroom with a toilet in it to satisfy her family’s needs. The loan will provide a healthy and comfortable living for the entire family. In the future, Mrs. Thoeng hopes to expand her existing businesses and improve her situation someday.

loans.use: to build a bathroom with a toilet in it.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita es una mujer muy trabajadora, a sus 66 años ella se siente muy joven y con mucha fuerza y salud para seguir trabajando y seguir adelante, ella vive en la ciudad de nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima calido y por la majestuosas lineas de nazca por la cual la ciudad recibe gran cantidad de turistas durante todo el año, Felicita es madre de 8 hijos los cuales ya son mayores y estan casados, asi mismo como buena peruana el platillo que mas le agrada es el riquisimo "Lomo Saltado", Felicita solo estudio hasta el quinto año de educacion secundaria ya que sus padre no tenian muchos recursos economicos pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Secretariado.

Felicita trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes, al cual le dedica 12 horas diarias, 12 horas a las cuales le pone mucho empeño para vender sus productos,en un dia puede atender hasta 30 clientes y es que Felicita cree que le va bien en su negocio porque trata a los clientes con mucho cariño y sobre todo porque se trata a los demas como quisieramos que nos traten.

Felicita esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda mrindada ella podra comprar mas mercaderia para su negocio y con ello mejorar su calidad de vida y obtener mayores ingresos para poder seguir ahorrando y poder realizar su mas grande sueño:"Tener una bodega mucho mas grande y exitosa"
texts.en:
Felicita is a very hardworking woman. At 66 years old she feels very young, with the strength and health to continue working and getting ahead. She lives in the city of Nazca, which has a warm climate and the majestic Lineas de Nazca that bring in a great amount of tourists during the entire year.  

Felicita is the mother of 8 children who are already grown and are married. As a good Peruvian her favorite dish is the very tasty “Lomo Saltado.” Felicita only studied until the 5th year of secondary school since her parents didn’t have a lot of money, but she would have liked to study in a secretarial course. 

Felicita works in her grocery selling business which she does for 12 hours each day, 12 hours during which she works hard to sell her products. In one day she can have about 30 customers. Felicita believes that things are going well in her business because she treats her customers with a lot of care and above all because she treats others how she would like to be treated. 

Felicita is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help provided she can buy more merchandise for her business and with that improve her quality of life and get more income to be able to keep on saving and realize her biggest dream: “to have a much bigger and more successful store.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise (groceries)

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama habite au Sénégal dans le sud âgée de 25 ans,célibataire sans enfant.Elle travail de le domaine de la restauration depuis 2 ans ,elle démarre sa journée de 07h à 11h pour le petit déjeuner et de 14h à 23h déjeuner et diner,elle travaille tous les jours ,mais son activité marche bien pendant la période scolaire car son restaurant est en face à la grande porte de l’école.Pendant la période scolaire,elle gagne 15000f à 20000f par jour,elle a une seule charge d'une facture d'électricité à payer tous les 2 mois.Mariama sollicite un crédit de 300 000f pour renforcer son stock en alimentation et meuble .Son projet est d'épargné beaucoup d'argent,être une grande commerçante avant qu'elle ne se marie

loans.use: ACHETER RIZ HUILE BEURRE MAYONNAISE ETC

loans.name: Kpedetin V Group

texts.fr: KPEDETIN V est un groupement composé de treize personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C’est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Marie (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 33 ans. Marie est mariée à un couturier du nom de Abel. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Marie et son mari. Pour cette raison, Marie vend des objets pieux et des fruits de saison de façon secondaire ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Marie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Marie sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe KPEDETIN V, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des objets pieux et des fruits.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 40-year-old married mother of five, who has been working in Agriculture business supporting her husband in developing their business and covering their family's increasing living needs for four years.
Sahar used to work in providing cleaning services in nearby villages upon ladies requests, but she decided that she is starting to be very weak for this type of work and decided to support her husband in their small family business.
Her students are enrolled in a public school, she hopes that one day they can graduate with university degrees.
Sahar is working hard to develop her business, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy an additional cow to increase her dairy production and develop both her business and living.
This is Sahar's second loan cycle as Al Majmoua borrower, through her previous loan she developed her business and increased her family's income.

loans.use: To buy an additional cow to increase her dairy production and develop both her business and living

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
C. Bosco has been an active member of Life in Africa since 2005. He currently works at the WE Center as a gatekeeper and he also makes bracelets for the Invisible Children Bracelet Project.

Like so many others who have been forced to leave the war torn Northern Uganda, he and his family live in the displaced persons camp known as the Acholi quarters. He supports three children and working in the stone quarry made it impossible for him to earn enough money. Since coming to Life in Africa, he now earns enough money to make their lives much easier since they now have money for food, rent, and more important, for the school fees for his children. Now he feels proud and for the first time, he can start to see a future for his family again.

His first priority is to build a family home. He wants his children to have the security of having their own home again. He has a plot of land that the King of Buganda donated to the Acholi some years ago. He has already started to build his home but was forced to stop due to lack of funds. He is now seeking a loan in the amount of 800,000 to finish this home. He will be able to repay this loan in 6 months.

LOAN AMOUNT: 800,000

PLAN: BUILDING

He wants to buy the following materials

1: 12 iron sheets @----------------11000--------132,000/

2: 12 bags of cement @--------------18500-----201,000/

3: 3000 bricks @ 60-----------------------------180,000/

4:13 pieces of timber for roofing

(3x4)- 3000----24,000/

(4x2)-----5000-------------------25,000/

5: 2 trips of sand @----------60000----------------120,000/

6: transporting materials to the site-------------- 40,000/

7: Labour-------------------------------------------78,000/

TOTAL: 800,000/

C. plans to pay back this loan in 6 Months in amounts of 147,335 per month and he saves Ushs 170, 500/= per month. He has designated the community impact portion of the interest he will pay to support Life in Africa's Talend Discovery team.

loans.use: Finish walls and roofing

loans.name: Amèvi

texts.en:
Mr. Amèvi T. was born on 19 February 1966 in Lomé. He is the father of five (05) children who are in his care, along with his wife and mother. In Kpémé, the demand for basic goods and general food products is very large. Mr. Amèvi T. is one of the merchants who provides basic need goods and general food products to the local population. Not having had the chance to go to school due to a lack of means, he quickly became interested in this business, which he manages very well. He has already obtained a loan of $100 which he repaid without incident.

Today, with the rapid development of his business, Mr. Amèvi T. is asking for a loan of $750 to create new sections for different products in his store. These include, among others, crockery, detergents, and children's toys, as demanded by his clientele. Financing such a business will allow Mr. Amèvi T. to contribute effectively to the development of all his family members.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur T. Amèvi est né le 19 février 1966 à Lomé. Il est père de cinq (05) enfants qui demeurent à sa charge ainsi que son épouse et sa mère. A Kpémé, la demande en produits de premières nécessités et d’alimentation générale est très importante. Monsieur T. Amèvi fait partie des commerçants qui fournissent des produits de première nécessité et d’alimentation générale à la population locale. N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école par faute de moyens, il s’est vite intéressé à ce commerce qu’il gère très bien. Il a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit de $100 qu’il a remboursé sans incident.

Aujourd’hui, avec l’essor que connaît son commerce, Monsieur T. Amèvi sollicite un crédit de $750 pour créer de nouveaux rayons de produits. Il s’agit entre autres de la vaisselle, des produits détergents, des jouets pour enfants sur la demande de sa clientèle. Financer une telle activité permettra à Monsieur T. Amèvi de contribuer efficacement à l’épanouissement de toute sa famille 

loans.use: To create new store sections for dishes, detergents, and children's toys

loans.name: Olga Leticia

texts.en:
Lety sells in one of the busiest markets in the city. She has a considerable number of clients; her aim is always to please each person who approaches her kiosk. "My daughter helps me with the business. This is very important for me and gives me the support I need to move the business forward. With her help, I am able to stay open all day. We plan to buy more inventory, for which we need $1200".

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Doña "Lety" vende en uno de los tianguis mas concurridos de la ciudad manifiesta tener un considerable número de clientes, su finalidad es complacer a todas las personas que se acerquen a su puesto. "Mi hija me ayuda con el negocio eso para mi es muy importante pues me brinda el apoyo para sacar adelante la venta con su ayuda puedo mantener abierto todo el día, los planes que tenemos son comprar mas inventario para esto necesitamos $1,200. dlls".

loans.use: To buy inventory to sell

loans.name: Choo

texts.en: Mrs. Choo S. is 31 years old and lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia with her husband and their two children.  Her husband is a fisherman, while Mrs. Choos S. sells his daily catch at the market.  Together, they earn about $5/day profit which is enough to put their 2 children through school.  This loan will be used to purchase a new fishing net so they can increase the number of fish they can catch each day.  In the future, Mrs. Choo S. and her husband would like to purchase a second boat so they can increase their fishing business, and also to build extra rooms on their house that they can rent out.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing net and repair her house

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en: Ludmila has requested a $1000 loan to increase her working capital and purchase new clothing inventory for her attractive little clothing sales business. Ludmila’s store has a nice indoor location at the busy City market in Novaya Kohovka. An experienced entrepreneur, Ludmila has been helping meet the clothing needs of her customers for over twelve years. She enjoys having her own business and the opportunity to provide for her family. She and her husband, Sergei, have one son who is twelve years old. We are happy for this opportunity to assist Ludmila as she works to develop her business and meet her family’s needs.

loans.use: Increase working capital and purchase inventory for a clothing store.

loans.name: Novruz

texts.en:
Novruz B. is a 28 years old. He is married. He is from Sumgayit region, situated in the eastern part of the Azerbaijan Republic.

He began his business with $300 in 2003. He started selling a small variety of religious things. With this small business and only $300 in working capital, he could hardly earn enough money to meet family's food and important consumption needs. He had difficulty in covering other consumption.

In 2005-2006, he made necessary changes in his small working place. He expanded his business and bought different religious things.

Now, he needs a $700 loan in order to further develop his business, to buy other religious things and expand his shop to increase his business and to improve his family’s living condition with this additional income. He will repay the loan within 12 months. He hopes eventually to expand his business.

loans.use: To increase his business, buy other religious things and expand the size of his shop

loans.name: Nabuvat

texts.en: Nabuvat is mother of 4 children and, like every mother in the world, she wants that her children will not be in need of anything vital to their welfare. She works hard every day without days off. Her clothing stall is located in the centre of the market in Istaravshan, Khujand. She has good turnover of her goods.She is very polite and an honest person.She repays her loans on time without delay. She is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders with the purpose of increasing her working capital and purchasing seasonal goods.

loans.use: Purchase of warm clothes for resale

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina is a member of the Community Bank Mujeres del Future. She lives in the district of Independencia, in the province of Huaraz in Peru. She sells grain flour (made from wheat, corn, bean, kiwicha and peas) in bulk and in individual packages in the northern cone of Lima.

With this loan of 1500 soles, to be paid back over the course of 6 months, she will purchase 2 sacks of corn, 2 sacks of wheat, 2 sacks of peas and 2 sacks of beans to be processed and turned into flour.
