Marina is 65 years old, married with 7 children. Her husband worked as a break-maker, and owned his own shop, but now he is too elderly to work. Now her husband helps Marina with her business. Her profits help her to pay for living expenses, and also to help support her single daughter who has 2 children and lives at home.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer

La señora Marina pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres del futuro, vive en el distrito de Independencia, Provincia de Huaraz. Se dedica a la venta de harina de granos (harina de trigo, de maíz, de haba, kiwicha, arvejas), vende por mayor y menor en el cono norte de Lima.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará 2 sacos de trigo, 2 sacos de maíz, 2 sacos de arvejas, 2 sacos de haba, para ser transformados en harina.

La señora Marina tiene 65 años, casada y tiene 7 hijos, su esposo antes tenia su panadería, ahora ya no, por la edad ha dejado este negocio. En la actualidad él apoya a su esposa en este negocio. Sus ingresos le permite solventar los gastos del hogar, una de sus hijas es madre soltera con dos hijos, a la que también apoyan económicamente.

loans.use: To purchase grains in bulk

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
Mr. Ronald lives with his in-laws in San Cristobal Street Nº 50B in the Tacagua area, of the city of La Paz. He is 38 years old and lives with her wife and children. He works making unisex jackets and vests of polar fabric (warmer than regular fabric). His workshop is located at his house. He supports his wife and meets their needs with this business. He will use the loan to buy fabric, threads, etc. His record qualifies him as a good client and he can gain access to a new loan. He is a client of IMPRO since 2002.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Ronald vive en casa de sus suegros en la calle San Cristóbal Nº 50B de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene 38 años y vive con su esposa he hijos. La actividad que realiza es la confección de chamarras y chalecos de tela polar (que abriga más que la tela regular) para ambos sexos y su taller lo tiene ubicado en la misma casa; con esta actividad mantiene a su esposa y cubre sus necesidades. El crédito que solicita es para comprar tela, hilos y otros. Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2002.

loans.use: Buy polar fabric, thread, etc.

loans.name: Ide Violeta

texts.es:
Ide L. is 34 years old and lives in Cuyuchugo hamlet, Usquil district in the Otuzco province of the department of La Libertad. She has 4 children that still depend on her. She has a 5th grade education.

Ever since before she was married, she did the housework and worked on the farm. After many years, she met her husband and they both began working in fruit sales. Today she travels weekly to Barrio Negro and Calamarca, both areas in the Julcán district, in the province of Otuzco.

Ide also prepares chuño de maíz (a popular dish in the La Libertad mountain range) and sells it in her neighborhood.

She's part of Banco Comunal "San Juan de Miraflores" and received her first loan of 300 soles (3 soles = $1) which she used to buy a variety of fruits.

With the loan of 1000 soles, which she will repay in full in 4 months, she'll buy a hundred oranges, limes and apples, as well as, ingredients to prepare chuño de maíz. Ide is an associate of the mother's club "Santísima Trinidad".

Her dream is to have means of transportation to transport her merchandise.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ide López tiene 34 años de edad, vive en el caserío de Cuyuchugo, distrito de Usquil, provincia de Otuzco departamento de La Libertad. Tiene 4 hijos que aún dependen de ella. Sólo estudió hasta el quinto grado de primaria.

Desde antes de que se casara sólo se había dedicado a la chacra y a las obligaciones del hogar, después de mucho tiempo conoció a su esposo, juntos empezaron a trabajar en la venta de frutas. Actualmente viaja semanalmente por el caserío de Barrio Negro y Calamarca, lugares pertenecientes al distrito de Julcán, provincia de Otuzco.

La señora Ide también prepara chuño de maíz (plato popular en los lugares de la Serranía Liberteña) y lo vende por su caserío.

Ella integra el Banco Comunal “San Juan de Miraflores ” en el que le dieron su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00,con este dinero compró una variedad de frutas.

Con el préstamo de S/.1000.00 que cancelará en 4 meses, comprará un ciento de naranjas, limas y manzanas; además comprará los ingredientes para preparar el chuño de maíz. La señora Ide es socia del club de madres “Santísima Trinidad ”.

Su mayor sueño es tener un medio de transporte para trasladar su mercadería.

loans.use: To buy a hundred oranges, limes and apples, as well as, ingredients to prepare chuño de maíz .

loans.name: Mercedes Odila

texts.en:
Mercedes is an older and experienced businesswoman who lives in the Río Arriba community of Baní.  To make a living and help her husband support their children, she retails fuel to motorcycle and cars owners.  Mercedes humbly explains that “you won’t get rich by doing this business”, but she mentions that now she can face many financial issues and support her children’s education.  Actually the entrepreneur has seven children, all of whom are in their twenties.
With her loan, the entrepreneur will buy more fuel so that she can keep running her business and satisfy her customers’ needs.

loans.use: Purchase of fuel for re-sale in her community

loans.name: Fatuma's Motomoto Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is 35 years old and is a married woman with one child. Fatuma owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2000. Every day, she works from 4am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food (rice, beans and maize flour) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Fatuma A., who has business dealing in charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items (rice,beans and maize flour) for her business.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam A. is 55 years of age. She runs her own stand selling vegetables at a roadside market in Kampong Cham. She enjoys her work and earns $2.50 (US) per day. Her husband’s name is Phat Ron. He is also 55 years of age and makes his living as a fishermA. in several local lakes. He has been fishing the same area since 1980. He earns $2 (US) per day. The couple has seven children, two of whom are married and live separately from the family. The married children still help support the family through the grocery store and photocopy shop they own. Of their children that live at home, one is a garment worker and another is a professional translator. The youngest three children are all students. Her youngest daughter is pictured here helping Sam A. run her stand.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell and a photocopy machine.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es:
Olga is 40 years old and lives an a neighborhood next to Villa Venezuela. She is married and has three children, 11, 13, and 15 years old. Her husband is abroad and supports her financially.

Doña Olga works in a school and is the director there. The loan she is requesting is for construction on her home to build a porch. In the future, she would like to keep making improvements to her home and improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Olga tiene 40 años de edad, habita en el barrio anexo de Villa Venezuela, es casada y tiene tres hijos de 11,13 y 15 años de edad. Su esposo está en el extranjero y le apoya económicamente.

Doña Olga trabaja en centro educativo y es la directora de dicho centro, con este préstamo que esta solicitando es para infraestructura de su vivienda en la construcción de un porche. A futuro es seguir haciendo mejoras a su vivienda, y mejorar el nivel de vida.

loans.use: Build a porch onto her home.

loans.name: Julián

texts.es:
Julián is a father and the head of his household. For this, he must work to cover his family’s needs, above all those of his three daughters who are students and who generate many expenses with their studies. For this, Julián thanks agriculture and the earnings he has made in it. He’s succeeded in acquiring a little money that he invested in opening a small shop that helps him with his finances and to serve his neighbors who now have access to diverse basic need products close to their houses. Julián wants to be able to establish his business and supply his shop with the best basic need products in his community. For this, he needs the loan that he asks for with the aim that you will be able to make him a loan and help him in the success of his projects.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Julián es padre y cabeza de su hogar, por ello tiene que trabajar para poder cubrir las necesidades de su familia, sobre todo la de sus 3 hijas quienes son escolares y generan diversos gastos por sus estudios.Por ello que Julián gracias a la agricultura y las ganancias que obtuvo en ello, logró adquirir un dinerito el cual invirtió en abrir una pequeña tienda que le ayuda en su economía y en servicio sus vecinos que ahora pueden tener acceso a diversos productos de primera necesidad más cerca de sus casas.Julián desea poder implementar su mercadería y surtir su tienda con los mejores productos necesarios dentro de su comunidad. Para esto requiere de dinero que solicita ante su persona con el fin de que usted pueda prestarle y ayudarlo en el logro de sus proyectos.

loans.use: Increase in Merchandise for his Shop

loans.name: Kougnawo

texts.fr:
Née en 1957, Madame A. Kougnawo est marié et mère de six enfants. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu, la vente de poissons fumés. Elle achète aussi des noix de palme à base desquelles elle produit de l’huile rouge. 

Pour redynamiser ses activités et améliorer son revenu, elle sollicite un crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1957, Mrs. Kougnawo A. is married and the mother of six children. In order to earn her living, she sells smoked fish. She also buys palm nuts from which she extracts red palm oil.

To bolster and revive her businesses and improve her income, she is requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of smoked fish

loans.name: Adidjatou

texts.fr:
Née à Sokodé en 1970, madame A. Adidjatou est mariée et mère d’une famille de quatre enfants. C’est une femme qui se bat pour aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de safamille. Elle est commerçante comme son mari et elle vend des pagnes et des effets vestimentaires.
Elle est habituée à prendre du crédit et elle paye toujours bien. Grâce au crédit précédent son activité a évolué. Elle voudrait en prendre encore pour augmenter son stock de 56 pièces de pagnes.
texts.en:
Mrs Adidjatou Arolina was born in 1970, in Sokode. She is married and the mother of a family with four (4) children. This women fights hard to assist her husband in providing for the needs of the family. She is a business person, like her husband, and sells pagne (decorative cloth) as well as finished clothing.

She is experienced with making loans and has always repaid fully. Thanks to these previous loans her business has grown. She would like to make another loan to increase her stock with 56 pieces of pagne.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 56 pieces of "pagne" (decorative cloth)

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
La señora Betty, socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Bellavista. Se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y golosinas y el negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, en el Jr. Lamas C–12.  Se inicia en el negocio  ante la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos y contribuir a la economía de su hogar.  

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará agua mineral, gaseosas de diferentes marcas y tamaño personal, mediano y familiar, así como golosinas como galletas, caramelos de diferentes marcas y sabores, chupetines, plátanos en racimos para luego ser vendidos al menudeo. Estos son productos muy requeridos por sus clientes. 

La señora Betty tiene 33 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hijo. Es una mujer muy perseverante y responsable, con ganas de sacar adelante su negocio para el bienestar de ella y la de su familia. Desea más adelante implementar, con más productos, el negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Betty, member of the "Virgin of the Rosary" Communal Bank, lives in the San Martin Region, province and district of Bellavista. She is dedicated to sell carbonated beverages and sweets. Her business is located on her home. She started her business out of the need of generating her own earnings and contribute to the household income.

With this 1,000 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, which will be paid in 6 months, Betty will buy mineral water, different brands and sizes of carbonated beverages (personal, medium and family size) and also different sweets like cookies, an assortment of caramels and candies, lollipops and suckers and banana bunches to be selled at retail. These products are highly requested by her customers.

Betty is 33 years old, lives with her husband and a child. She is a very perseverant and responsible woman, with great enthusiam to see her business growing for her family's welfare and hers. She wishes in the future to establish and expand her business with more products.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will buy mineral water, carbonated beverages and also sweets

loans.name: Tsotsovi

texts.fr: Agée de 65 ans, Madame A. Tsotsovi est une veuve ayant 4 personnes à charge aux besoins desquelles elle subvient grâce à la commercialisation de céréales. Actuellement, sa clientèle a presque triplé mais son faible pouvoir d’achat ne lui permet pas de les satisfaire. Cette situation crée un certain mécontentement au niveau des clients fidèles. C’est dans la perspective d’augmenter son pouvoir d’achat aux fins de mieux satisfaire les clients et d’augmenter ainsi son chiffre d’affaire pour offrir de meilleures conditions d’existence à son ménage qu’elle sollicite un crédit. Ce crédit lui servira aussi de fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Aged 65, Mrs. Tsotsovi A. is a widow with four people to look after. She provides for their needs by selling cereals. Her clientele has now almost tripled but her weak purchasing power does not allow her to meet their requirements. This situation is making her loyal customers rather unhappy. She is therefore requesting a loan so that she can increase her buying power and better satisfy her customers as well as increase her revenue and thus improve the living conditions of her household. The loan will also serve as working capital.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and sale of cereals

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina O. sells second hand clothes. She travels to Lagos and Onitsha to purchase second hand clothes to sell to her customers. Justina hopes to expand her business. She needs the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more second hand clothes to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria A. is single. She has received schooling through junior high and is a seamstress by profession. Since 2001, Gloria has been selling a variety of fabrics at Aboom in Cape coast. She uses her income to pay her children's school fees, the family's utility bills, and other expenses. Gloria will use the loan to purchase additional fabrics and sewing materials. She will reinvest the extra profit in her business to increase its capital base.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics and sewing materials

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sabougnouma (composé de 3 femmes  mariées et d’une célibataire) ont une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans avec en moyenne 1 enfant. Elles résident dans le quartier  Médine de la ville de sikasso.
Elles  exercent des activités commerciales différentes respectivement : la vente  d’oignons, du charbon de bois, du savon et des pagnes wax et real.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 10 pièces de pagne wax et real, une trentaine de carton de savons importés, 14 sacs de 100kg de d’oignons  et 70 sacs de charbon de bois. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place à Sikasso et environnants.
Les produits sont vendus en détail et la plupart au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso (Médine et le grand marché de la ville) et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 17 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt,subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group Sabougnouma is composed of three married women and a one who is unmarried who average 25 years of age and one child. They reside in the Médine district of the city of Sikasso and do various kinds of commerce: onions, charcoal, soap, and “pagnes” (colorful West African cloth).

They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy the needs of their customers. They are on their second solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding ones have been correctly repaid. They plan to use this loan to buy ten lengths of WAX and REAL brands of pagnes, thirty boxes of imported soap, fourteen 100-kg sacks of onions, and seventy sacks of charcoal. Supplies are gotten locally in Sikasso and surrounding areas. The goods are sold retail and mostly for cash in the marketplace of Sikasso (Médine and the grand marketplace of the city) and in the districts, to customers composed of women and men.

With this loan, the group members each hope to realize a monthly profit of 17,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay the loan interest, provide for the family, and to invest the rest in their businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy onions, charcoal, soap, and cloth

loans.name: Bakhruz

texts.en: Bakhruz A. is a young man of 26, married with 2 children. Bakhruz keeps a food store in the small village of Imishli City where he sells macaroni, preserved food, tea, sugar and other items. Bakhruz got this shop from his father and continued this business. His main profession is photographer, and sometimes he works in the local wedding parties. His family income depends on the shop that Bakhruz keeps. Now he would like to expand his business and purchase more food products for his store.

loans.use: Purchase food products to resell
